name: abandon
trans: v. to leave and never return to 放弃
v. to give over unrestrainedly 放纵

sentences.english: How could she abandon her own child?
sentences.chinese: 她怎么能抛弃自己的孩子呢？

detailed_translations.chinese: 离弃， 丢弃； 遗弃； 抛弃； 放弃
detailed_translations.english: to leave someone, especially someone you are responsible for

name: abate
trans: v. to become weaker 减弱

sentences.english: We waited for the storm to abate.
sentences.chinese: 我们等风暴减弱。

detailed_translations.english: to become less strong or decrease

name: abbreviate
trans: v. to make shorter 缩短

sentences.english: And, furthermore, he started to abbreviate.
sentences.chinese: 此外，他开始使用缩写词。

sentences.english: I like to abbreviate my name because it's easier for people to remember.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢缩写我的名字，因为这样人们更容易记住。

sentences.english: N You can even abbreviate and put Y or N.
sentences.chinese: 甚至可以缩写Y或。

name: aberration
trans: n. something that is unusual or unexpected 异常

sentences.english: It became very clear that the incident was not just an aberration; it was not just a single incident.
sentences.chinese: 已经很明确这次事件并不仅仅是一次失常，也不只是一个单独的事件。

detailed_translations.english: An aberration is an incident or way of behaving that is not typical

name: abet
trans: v. to actively second and encourage 支持，怂恿

name: abeyance
trans: n. a state of temporary inactivity 中止

sentences.english: The question is in abeyance until we know more about it.
sentences.chinese: 问题暂时搁置，直到我们了解更多有关情况''。

sentences.english: The abbot was taken aback and could not abide her abeyance .
sentences.chinese: 男修道院院长很吃惊并且不能忍受她的中止。

detailed_translations.english: something such as a custom, rule, or system that is in abeyance is not being used at the present time

name: abnegation
trans: n. denial especially: self-denial 否认

sentences.english: Only spontaneous love flowing with sincere generosity and self- abnegation can fertilize the soul of others.
sentences.chinese: 唯有充满诚挚慷慨与自我放弃、油然而生的爱才能丰盛他者的灵魂。

name: abound
trans: v. to be present in large numbers or in great quantity 充满

sentences.english: Rumors of such coordination abound, but as with many rumors, they have no basis in fact.
sentences.chinese: 关于这类协调的谣传很多；但如同许多其他谣传一样，它们没有事实根据。

sentences.english: Finally, offer this closing prayer to the Lord: May the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, that you may abound in hope by the power of the Holy Spirit.
sentences.chinese: 最后，将结束的祷告告诉主：愿在你拥有信仰的时候希望的上帝用快乐与和平充满你的人生，让你在圣灵的力量下富于希望。

name: abridge
trans: v. to shorten in duration or extent 删减

sentences.english: The time is limited, so he abridge his composition.
sentences.chinese: 时间有限，他缩短了他的作文。

sentences.english: She decided to abridge her stay in campus since she wants to hunt for a job immediately.
sentences.chinese: 考虑到她想要马上找工作，他决定缩短在校园里逗留的时间。

name: absolute
trans: adj. complete and total 完全的
adj. not limited in any way 不受限制

sentences.english: I have absolute confidence in her.
sentences.chinese: 我对她充满信心。

sentences.english: Some of the stuff on TV is absolute rubbish.
sentences.chinese: 电视上播放的有些东西简直就是垃圾。

sentences.english: How did you do that? You’re an absolute genius.
sentences.chinese: 你是怎么做的？ 你绝对是个天才。

sentences.english: That meal last night cost an absolute fortune.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚那顿饭花了一大笔钱。

detailed_translations.english: complete or total

name: absolve
trans: v. to make free from guilt, responsibility, etc. 免罪

sentences.english: A police investigation yesterday absolved the police of all blame in the incident.
sentences.chinese: 警方昨天的调查为其开脱了在这件事故中所有的责任。

detailed_translations.english: to say publicly that someone is not guilty or responsible for something

name: absorbing
trans: adj. fully taking one’s attention 吸引人的

name: abstemious
trans: adj. not eating and drinking too much 有节制的

sentences.english: Ireland looks like an abstemious jogger that has suffered a heart attack.
sentences.chinese: 爱尔兰看似一位心脏病发作的有节制的慢跑者。

sentences.english: In this foundation, Proposed further deepening idea of energy conservation and taking measures to build an abstemious corporation.
sentences.chinese: 在此基础上提出了进一步深化节能理念，建立节约型企业所采取的措施。

sentences.english: The women also mentioned the "rampant" sex that the supposedly spiritual and abstemious monks practiced with each other in the Gelugpa sect.
sentences.chinese: 这些妇女还提及在理论上应该精神化并有节制的格鲁派僧侣之间“疯狂的”性行为。

detailed_translations.english: careful not to have too much food, drink etc

name: abstinence
trans: n. the practice of not doing or having something that is wanted or enjoyable 节制

sentences.english: ...six months of abstinence.
sentences.chinese: …6个月的禁欲。

detailed_translations.english: the practice of not having something you enjoy, especially alcohol or sex, usually for reasons of religion or health

name: abstract
trans: adj. relating to or involving general ideas or qualities rather than specific people, objects, or actions 笼统的
adj. difficult to understand 抽象的，深奥的
n. a brief written statement of the main points or facts in a longer report, speech, etc. 摘要
v. to obtain or remove from a source 提取
v. to draw away the attention of 分散注意力

sentences.english: By the age of seven, children are capable of thinking in abstract terms .
sentences.chinese: 儿童到了七岁就具有抽象思维的能力。

sentences.english: Human beings are the only creatures capable of abstract thought (=  thinking about ideas  ) .
sentences.chinese: 人类是唯一具有抽象思维能力的动物。

detailed_translations.english: based on general ideas or principles rather than specific examples or real events

detailed_translations.chinese: 摘要，梗概；抽象派艺术作品
detailed_translations.english: a painting, design etc which contains shapes or images that do not look like real things or people

name: abstruse
trans: adj. hard to understand 难理解的

sentences.english: Maths is a mix of abstruse theory and detailed calculations.
sentences.chinese: 数学既有深奥的理论，又有精密的计算。

detailed_translations.english: unnecessarily complicated and difficult to understand

name: absurd
trans: adj. extremely silly, foolish, or unreasonable 荒谬的

sentences.english: It seems an absurd idea.
sentences.chinese: 这似乎是个荒唐的想法。

detailed_translations.english: completely stupid or unreasonable

name: abundance
trans: n. a large amount of something 大量

sentences.english: an abundance of wavy red hair
sentences.chinese: 浓密的红色鬈发

sentences.english: One quality the team possessed in abundance was fighting spirit.
sentences.chinese: 该队的一大特点是斗志昂扬。

detailed_translations.english: a large quantity of something

name: abuse
trans: v. to treat in a harsh or harmful way 虐待
v. to use wrongly 误用
n. a corrupt practice or custom 恶习

sentences.english: several cases of child abuse
sentences.chinese: 数宗虐待儿童案

sentences.english: An independent committee will look into alleged human rights abuses.
sentences.chinese: 一个独立委员会将对涉嫌践踏人权的行为进行调查。

detailed_translations.english: cruel or violent treatment of someone
to deliberately use something for the wrong purpose or for your own advantage

name: accelerate
trans: v. to move faster 加速
v. to cause to happen sooner or more quickly 促进

sentences.english: measures to accelerate the rate of economic growth
sentences.chinese: 加快经济增长速度的措施

detailed_translations.english: if a process accelerates or if something accelerates it, it happens faster than usual or sooner than you expect

name: accept
trans: v. to endure without protest or reaction 忍受

sentences.english: Rick accepted her offer of coffee.
sentences.chinese: 她请里克喝咖啡，他接受了。

sentences.english: He accepted the invitation to stay with us.
sentences.chinese: 他接受了邀请来我们家住。

sentences.english: His school reports said that he is always ready to accept a challenge (=  agree to do something difficult  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的学业报告上说他乐于接受挑战。

sentences.english: Please accept this small gift.
sentences.chinese: 请收下这份小小的礼物。

sentences.english: They offered me a job and I accepted.
sentences.chinese: 他们给我一份工作，我接受了。

sentences.english: He readily accepted her invitation (=  accepted it quickly  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他欣然接受了她的邀请。

detailed_translations.english: to take something that someone offers you, or to agree to do something that someone asks you to do

name: accessible
trans: adj. capable of being understood or appreciated 容易理解的

sentences.english: The island is only accessible by boat.
sentences.chinese: 这个岛只有坐船才能到。

sentences.english: There is a church which is easily accessible from my home.
sentences.chinese: 有座教堂离我家很近。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易接近的；可进入的；可理解的
detailed_translations.english: a place, building, or object that is accessible is easy to reach or get into

name: accession
trans: n. the act or process by which someone rises to a powerful and important position 就职
n. adherence 遵守

detailed_translations.english: an official process in which someone becomes king, queen, president etc

name: acclaim
trans: v. to praise in a very strong and enthusiastic way 称赞

sentences.english: His work was acclaimed by art critics.
sentences.chinese: 他的作品得到艺术评论家的推崇。

sentences.english: Angela Bassett has won critical acclaim for her excellent performance.
sentences.chinese: 安杰拉·巴西特因她出色的表演而赢得了评论界的赞扬。

detailed_translations.english: to praise someone or something publicly
Acclaim is public praise for someone or something

name: accommodate
trans: v. to make fit, suitable, or congruous 适应
v. to make room for 容纳

sentences.english: He bought a huge house to accommodate his library.
sentences.chinese: 他买了一座大房子来放他的藏书。

sentences.english: The ballroom can accommodate 400 people.
sentences.chinese: 那个舞厅可容纳400人。

detailed_translations.english: if a room, building etc can accommodate a particular number of people or things, it has enough space for them

name: accustomed
trans: adj. familiar with something so that it seems normal or usual 习惯的

sentences.english: The pans were in their accustomed places.
sentences.chinese: 那些锅在老地方。

detailed_translations.english: usual

name: acerbic
trans: adj. expressing harsh or sharp criticism in a clever way 尖刻的

sentences.english: acerbic wit
sentences.chinese: 尖刻的俏皮话

detailed_translations.chinese: 尖刻的（等于acerb）；酸的；辛辣的
detailed_translations.english: criticizing someone or something in a clever but cruel way

name: acknowledge
trans: v. to say that you accept or do not deny the truth or existence of  承认
v. to regard or describe (someone or something as having or deserving a particular status 感激

sentences.english: The family acknowledge the need for change.
sentences.chinese: 全家人都承认需要改变一下。

sentences.english: I would be grateful if you would acknowledge receipt of this letter.
sentences.chinese: 收到此信后请告知，不胜感谢。

detailed_translations.english: to admit or accept that something is true or that a situation exists

name: acquiescence
trans: n. passive assent or agreement without protest 默许

sentences.english: Caitlin smiled her acquiescence.
sentences.chinese: 凯特琳以微笑默许。

detailed_translations.english: Acquiescence is agreement to do what someone wants, or acceptance of what they do even though you do not agree with it

name: activism
trans: n. a doctrine or practice that emphasizes direct vigorous action 行动主义

sentences.english: The constant buzz of shared activity and knowledge gives rise to constant innovation and activism.
sentences.chinese: 共同活动和知识的不断传播带来了不断的创新和激进主义。

sentences.english: The baby boomers, who entered adulthood promising a lifetime of activism, have been a politically undistinguished generation.
sentences.chinese: 出生于生育高峰的人，在成年后承诺行动主义，只是一代政治上平庸的一代。

sentences.english: Japanese bosses gripe about activism, yet privately concede that the pressure is spurring many firms to increase returns to shareholders.
sentences.chinese: 日本的老板抱怨激进主义，然而，私下却承认这种压力刺激了很多公司给股东增加了投资回报。

detailed_translations.chinese: 行动主义； 激进主义
detailed_translations.english: Activism is the process of campaigning in public or working for an organization in order to bring about political or social change

name: acumen
trans: n. the ability to think clearly and make good decisions 敏锐

sentences.english: His business acumen helped him to succeed where others had failed.
sentences.chinese: 他在商业上的敏锐帮他在其他人失败的地方获得成功。

sentences.english: Science considers to make clear, the baby is to comparative to outside information of acumen, acceptance rate is quite rapid also.
sentences.chinese: 科学研究表明，婴儿对外界信息是相当敏锐的，接受的速度也相当快。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to think quickly and make good judgments

name: acute
trans: adj. keenly perceptive or discerning 敏锐的
adj. extremely sharp or severe 严峻的

sentences.english: Young children have a particularly acute sense of smell.
sentences.chinese: 幼儿的嗅觉特别灵敏。

detailed_translations.english: acute senses such as hearing, taste, touch etc are very good and sensitive

name: ad hoc
trans: adj. fashioned from whatever is immediately available 临时的
adj. formed or used for a special purpose 特别的

name: addiction
trans: n. an usually great interest in something or a need to do or have something 嗜好

sentences.english: She helped him fight his drug addiction.
sentences.chinese: 她帮助了他对抗自己的毒瘾。

detailed_translations.english: the need to take a harmful drug regularly, without being able to stop

name: adhere
trans: v. to give support or maintain loyalty 遵守

sentences.english: Small particles adhere to the seed.
sentences.chinese: 微小的粒子紧贴着种子。

sentences.english: We adhere to the principles of equal rights and freedom of expression for all.
sentences.chinese: 我们坚持人人平等和言论自由的原则。

detailed_translations.english: to stick firmly to something

name: admirable
trans: adj. deserving to be admired 令人敬佩的

sentences.english: an admirable achievement
sentences.chinese: 令人钦佩的成就

detailed_translations.chinese: 令人钦佩的；极好的；值得赞扬的
detailed_translations.english: having many good qualities that you respect and admire

name: admonish
trans: v. to speak to in a way that expresses disapproval or criticism 反对，批评
v. to tell or urge to do something 告诫

sentences.english: They admonished me for taking risks with my health.
sentences.chinese: 他们告诫我不要拿自己的健康来冒险。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone severely that they have done something wrong

name: adopt
trans: v. to take a child of other parents legally as your own child 收养
v. to begin to use or have 采用

sentences.english: The courts were asked to adopt a more flexible approach to young offenders.
sentences.chinese: 法庭被要求对少年犯采取更为灵活的处理方法。

sentences.english: The store recently adopted a drug testing policy for all new employees.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店近来实行新雇员一律要做药检的政策。

sentences.english: California has adopted a tough stance on the issue.
sentences.chinese: 加利福尼亚州对这一问题持强硬立场。

detailed_translations.english: to start to deal with or think about something in a particular way

name: adroit
trans: adj. very clever or skillful 精明的，灵巧的

sentences.english: an adroit negotiator
sentences.chinese: 一个谈判高手

detailed_translations.english: clever and skilful, especially in the way you use words and arguments

name: adulation
trans: n. excessive or slavish admiration or flattery 谄媚

sentences.english: He basks in other people's adulation.
sentences.chinese: 他陶醉在别人的奉承中。

sentences.english: Being a multi-selling megastar hasn't always been mass adoration and adulation.
sentences.chinese: 作为多产的巨星并不总是有大众崇拜和谄媚。

sentences.english: We edit and exaggerate, we crave adulation, we pretend we don't notice the socialisolation.
sentences.chinese: 我们编辑、夸大、渴望得到奉承。我们假装没有注意到社交孤立。

detailed_translations.english: praise and admiration for someone that is more than they really deserve

name: advanced
trans: adj. being beyond others in progress or ideas 先进的

sentences.english: advanced learners of English
sentences.chinese: 高级程度的英语学习者

sentences.english: advanced physics
sentences.chinese: 高等物理（学）

detailed_translations.english: studying or dealing with a school subject at a difficult level

name: advantage
trans: n. a good or desirable quality or feature 优势
n. benefit or gain 利益

sentences.english: Younger workers tend to be at an advantage (=  have an advantage  ) when applying for jobs.
sentences.chinese: 年轻点的工人申请工作时往往处于优势地位。

sentences.english: One of the many advantages of living in New York is that you can eat out at almost any time of day.
sentences.chinese: 住在纽约的诸多好处之一是几乎任何时候都可以外出吃饭。

detailed_translations.english: something that helps you to be more successful than others, or the state of having this

name: adversarial
trans: adj. involving two people or two sides who oppose each other 对立的

sentences.english: the adversarial nature of two-party politics
sentences.chinese: 两党政治的对抗性

detailed_translations.english: an adversarial system, especially in politics and the law, is one in which two sides oppose and attack each other

name: adverse
trans: adj. bad or unfavorable 不利的
adj. acting against or in a contrary direction 逆的

sentences.english: They fear it could have an adverse effect on global financial markets.
sentences.chinese: 他们担心这会对全球金融市场产生不利影响。

sentences.english: Miller’s campaign has received a good deal of adverse publicity .
sentences.chinese: 米勒的竞选活动招来许多负面报道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不利的；相反的；敌对的（名词adverseness，副词adversely）
detailed_translations.english: not good or favourable

name: advocate
trans: n. a person who argues for or supports a cause or policy 拥护者
v. to support or argue for 支持

sentences.english: Extremists were openly advocating violence.
sentences.chinese: 极端主义者公开鼓吹使用暴力。

sentences.english: Mr. Williams is a conservative who advocates fewer government controls on business.
sentences.chinese: 威廉斯先生是一位提倡减少政府对商业的控制的保守人士。

detailed_translations.english: If you advocate a particular action or plan, you recommend it publicly
someone who publicly supports someone or something

name: aesthetic
trans: adj. of or relating to art or beauty 审美的
adj. pleasing in appearance 美观的

sentences.english: From an esthetic point of view, it’s a nice design.
sentences.chinese: 从美学角度看，这是个不错的设计。

sentences.english: a work of great aesthetic appeal
sentences.chinese: 极富美之神韵的作品

detailed_translations.english: connected with beauty and the study of beauty

name: affable
trans: adj. friendly and easy to talk to 和蔼可亲的

sentences.english: an affable guy
sentences.chinese: 一个平易近人的人

detailed_translations.english: friendly and easy to talk to

name: affiliate
trans: v. to associate as a member 接纳，使附属
n. an organization that is a member of a larger organization 分支机构

sentences.english: He wanted to affiliate with a U.S. firm because he needed expert advice in legal affairs.
sentences.chinese: 他想成为一家美国公司的会员，因为他需要法律事务方面的专家意见。

detailed_translations.english: if a group or organization affiliates to or with another larger one, it forms a close connection with it
a company, organization etc that is connected with or controlled by a larger one

name: affinity
trans: n. a feeling of closeness and understanding that someone has for another person because of their similar qualities, ideas, or interests 紧密联系
n. likeness based on relationship or causal connection 类同
n. liking for or an attraction to something 吸引力

sentences.english: He has a close affinity with the landscape and people he knew when he was growing up.
sentences.chinese: 他对他成长过程中所熟悉的景色和人们有一种很强的亲切感。

detailed_translations.chinese: 密切关系；吸引力；姻亲关系；类同
detailed_translations.english: a close relationship between two things because of qualities or features that they share

name: affirm
trans: v. to say that something is true in a confident way 确信

sentences.english: The general affirmed rumors of an attack.
sentences.chinese: 将军证实了袭击的传闻。

sentences.english: Both sides affirmed their commitment to the ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 双方均申明答应停火。

detailed_translations.english: to state publicly that something is true

name: affluent
trans: adj. flowing in abundance 丰富的

sentences.english: affluent families
sentences.chinese: 富裕的家庭

sentences.english: The diet of the affluent has not changed much over the decades.
sentences.chinese: 富人的饮食数十年来没怎么变。

detailed_translations.english: having plenty of money, nice houses, expensive things etc
The affluent are people who are affluent

name: aggravate
trans: v. to make more serious or severe 加剧

sentences.english: Their money problems were further aggravated by a rise in interest rates.
sentences.chinese: 由于利率上调，他们的财务问题更加严重。

sentences.english: Building the new road will only aggravate the situation .
sentences.chinese: 建造那条新路只会使情况恶化。

detailed_translations.english: to make a bad situation, an illness, or an injury worse

name: aghast
trans: adj. shocked and upset 惊骇的

sentences.english: Hank looked at her aghast.
sentences.chinese: 汉克惊恐地望着她。

detailed_translations.english: feeling or looking shocked by something you have seen or just found out

name: agreeable
trans: adj. pleasing to the mind or senses 令人愉悦的
adj. able to be accepted 合适的，可被接受的

sentences.english: We spent a most agreeable couple of hours.
sentences.chinese: 我们非常愉快地度过了几个小时。

sentences.english: My parents are quite agreeable to my studying abroad.
sentences.chinese: 我父母很同意我去国外留学。

detailed_translations.english: pleasant

name: alacrity
trans: n. a quick and cheerful readiness to do something 乐意

sentences.english: She accepted with alacrity.
sentences.chinese: 她欣然接受了。

detailed_translations.english: quickness and eagerness

name: alarmist
trans: adj. causing unnecessary fear or anxiety that something unpleasant or dangerous is going to happen 危言耸听的

name: alien
trans: adj. not familiar or like other things you have known 陌生的
adj. from another country 外国的

sentences.english: alien cultures
sentences.chinese: 异域文化

sentences.english: an alien multiracial society
sentences.chinese: 一个多种族的异国社会

detailed_translations.chinese: 外国的；相异的，性质不同的；不相容的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to another country or race
someone who is not a legal citizen of the country they are living or working in

name: audacious
trans: adj. very confident and daring 大胆的

sentences.english: the risks involved in such an audacious operation
sentences.chinese: 如此大胆的行动中存在的风险

detailed_translations.chinese: 厚颜无耻的；大胆鲁莽的
detailed_translations.english: showing great courage or confidence in a way that is impressive or slightly shocking

name: augment
trans: v. to make greater, more numerous, larger, or more intense 增加

sentences.english: Any surplus was sold to augment their income.
sentences.chinese: 所有多余的东西被售卖一空来增加他们的收入。

detailed_translations.english: to increase the value, amount, effectiveness etc of something

name: auspicious
trans: adj. showing or suggesting that future success is likely 有望成功的

sentences.english: The new boy had an auspicious first day in the elementary school.
sentences.chinese: 这个新来的男孩在小学校里有幸运的第一天。

sentences.english: On the reverse the same inscription is repeated, besides a row of five Swastikas as auspicious symbols signifying security and good luck.
sentences.chinese: 倒转的同样碑刻是重复的，此外一排五个纳粹党所用的十字记号如幸运的符号表示安全和好运。

detailed_translations.english: showing that something is likely to be successful

name: austere
trans: adj. simple or plain 朴素的

sentences.english: the church’s austere simplicity
sentences.chinese: 那座教堂的朴实无华

detailed_translations.chinese: 严峻的；简朴的；苦行的；无装饰的
detailed_translations.english: plain and simple and without any decoration

name: authoritative
trans: adj. having or preceding from authority 有权威的

sentences.english: the most authoritative work on English surnames
sentences.chinese: 有关英语姓氏的最权威著作

detailed_translations.english: an authoritative book, account etc is respected because the person who wrote it knows a lot about the subject

name: autonomy
trans: n. the quality or state of being self-governing 自治

sentences.english: campaigners who want greater autonomy for Corsica
sentences.chinese: 希望科西嘉有更多自治权的活动家

detailed_translations.english: freedom that a place or an organization has to govern or control itself

name: available
trans: adj. easy or possible to get or use 可获得的
adj. present and able or willing to talk to someone 有空的

sentences.english: Tickets are available from the box office.
sentences.chinese: 售票处有票出售。

sentences.english: Meetings were held to update employees as soon as new information became available .
sentences.chinese: 一有新的信息就开会告诉员工。

sentences.english: Further building can continue when money is made available .
sentences.chinese: 有了资金就可以继续进一步的施工。

sentences.english: Every available space on the wall was covered in pictures.
sentences.chinese: 墙上每一个可用的地方都挂上了画。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可利用的，现有的；可获得的
detailed_translations.english: something that is available is able to be used or can easily be bought or found

name: avaricious
trans: adj. excessively acquisitive especially in seeking to hoard riches 贪婪的

sentences.english: He sacrificed his own career so that his avaricious brother could succeed.
sentences.chinese: 他牺牲了自己的事业，其目的是让他贪婪的弟弟成功。

detailed_translations.english: An avaricious person is very greedy for money or possessions

name: aversion
trans: n. a strong feeling of not liking something 厌恶

sentences.english: Many people have a natural and emotional aversion to insects.
sentences.chinese: 很多人对昆虫有一种天生的厌恶之感。

detailed_translations.english: a strong dislike of something or someone

name: avert
trans: v. to turn away or aside 转移
v. to prevent from happening 防止

sentences.english: The tragedy could have been averted if the crew had followed safety procedures.
sentences.chinese: 如果乘务人员按照安全规则操作，这场悲剧是可以避免的。

sentences.english: Henry averted his eyes as she undressed.
sentences.chinese: 她脱衣服的时候，亨利把目光转向别处。

detailed_translations.chinese: 防止，避免；转移(目光、注意力等)
detailed_translations.english: to prevent something unpleasant from happening

name: awe
trans: n. an emotion variously combining dread, veneration, and wonder that is inspired by authority or by the sacred or sublime 敬畏

sentences.english: The girls were awed by the splendour of the cathedral.
sentences.chinese: 女孩们对大教堂的宏伟气势大为惊叹。

detailed_translations.english: if you are awed by someone or something, you feel great respect and liking for them, and are often slightly afraid of them
a feeling of great respect and liking for someone or something

name: awkward
trans: adj. lacking dexterity or skill 笨拙的
adj. lacking the right proportions, size, or harmony of parts 不合适的
adj. causing embarrassment 尴尬的
adj. not easy to handle or deal with 棘手的

sentences.english: I hoped he would stop asking awkward questions .
sentences.chinese: 我希望他不要再问令人难堪的问题。

sentences.english: There was an awkward moment when she didn’t know whether to shake his hand or kiss his cheek.
sentences.chinese: 她不知道是该跟他握手还是亲他的脸颊，一时很尴尬。

sentences.english: an awkward silence
sentences.chinese: 令人尴尬的沉默

sentences.english: A laugh can help people over an awkward situation.
sentences.chinese: 笑可以助人化解尴尬。

sentences.english: Philip’s remarks put her in an awkward position (=  made it difficult for her to know what to do  ) .
sentences.chinese: 菲利普的话使她很窘迫。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel embarrassed so that you are not sure what to do or say

name: awry
trans: adv. not working correctly or happening in the expected way 出错地
adj. not straight or neat 歪斜的

sentences.english: He rushed out, hat awry.
sentences.chinese: 他歪戴着帽子冲了出去。

detailed_translations.english: not in the correct position

name: badger
trans: v. to bother or annoy with many comments or questions 烦扰
v. to ask or tell someone again and again to do something 反复劝说

sentences.english: She badgered me for weeks until I finally gave in.
sentences.chinese: 她缠了我好几个星期，直到我最终答应了她。

detailed_translations.chinese: 獾；獾皮；（大写）獾州人（美国威斯康星州人的别称）；<动><澳>毛鼻袋熊
detailed_translations.english: an animal that has black and white fur, lives in holes in the ground, and is active at night
to try to persuade someone by asking them something several times

name: baffle
trans: v. to confuse completely 使困惑

sentences.english: The question baffled me completely.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题把我彻底难倒了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…困惑；使…受挫折；用挡板控制
detailed_translations.english: if something baffles you, you cannot understand or explain it at all

name: balanced
trans: adj. in a fair and reasonable way 公正的
adj. calm and thinks clearly, even in a difficult situation 沉着冷静的

name: balk at
trans: phrase. 回避

name: balloon
trans: v. to become bigger quickly 激增

sentences.english: The company’s debt has ballooned in the past year.
sentences.chinese: 在过去一年里，公司的债务激增。

detailed_translations.english: to suddenly become larger in amount
an object made of brightly coloured thin rubber, that is filled with air and used as a toy or decoration for parties

name: banal
trans: adj. lacking originality, freshness, or novelty 陈腐的，平凡的

sentences.english: conversations about the most banal subjects
sentences.chinese: 最无聊的谈话

detailed_translations.chinese: 陈腐的；平庸的；老一套的
detailed_translations.english: ordinary and not interesting, because of a lack of new or different ideas

name: baneful
trans: adj. causing destructive or serious damage 有害的

name: banish
trans: v. to send away 驱逐

sentences.english: John was banished from England.
sentences.chinese: 约翰被逐出英国。

detailed_translations.english: to not allow someone or something to stay in a particular place

name: banter
trans: n. good-natured and usually witty and animated joking 打趣

sentences.english: As she closed the door, she heard Tom exchanging good-natured banter with Jane.
sentences.chinese: 她关门时听见汤姆与简在开着善意的玩笑。

detailed_translations.english: Banter is teasing or joking talk that is amusing and friendly

name: bargain
trans: v. to discuss an agreement or price in order to make it more appealing
讨价还价

sentences.english: I’ve kept my side of the bargain and I expect you to keep yours.
sentences.chinese: 我履行了我的承诺，希望你也履行你的承诺。

sentences.english: women bargaining with traders
sentences.chinese: 和商贩讨价还价的女人

detailed_translations.english: an agreement, made between two people or groups to do something in return for something else
to discuss the conditions of a sale, agreement etc, for example to try and get a lower price

name: barrier
trans: n. something that prevents or blocks movement from one place to another 障碍

sentences.english: He advocated the removal of trade barriers.
sentences.chinese: 他提倡消除贸易壁垒。

sentences.english: Crowds burst through the barriers and ran onto the pitch.
sentences.chinese: 人群冲破围栏跑进球场。

sentences.english: The mountains form a natural barrier between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 群山构成了两国之间的天然屏障。

detailed_translations.english: a rule, problem etc that prevents people from doing something, or limits what they can do

name: baseless
trans: adj. not true and is not based on facts 无根据的

name: bedrock
trans: n. basis 基础

sentences.english: Marriage and children are the bedrock of family life.
sentences.chinese: 婚姻和子女是家庭生活的基础。

detailed_translations.chinese: 基础， 根基； 基岩
detailed_translations.english: the basic ideas, features, or facts on which something is based

name: beguile
trans: v. to trick or deceive 欺骗

sentences.english: I was beguiled by the romance and exotic atmosphere of the souks in Marrakech.
sentences.chinese: 我被马拉喀什剧场浪漫的异国情调迷住了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 欺骗；使着迷；轻松地消磨
detailed_translations.english: to persuade or trick someone into doing something

name: beholden
trans: adj. being under obligation for a favor or gift 欠…人情的

sentences.english: We feel really beholden to them for what they've done.
sentences.chinese: 我们真的很感激他们所做的一切。

detailed_translations.chinese: 因受恩惠而心存感激，感谢；欠人情
detailed_translations.english: If you are beholden to someone, you are in debt to them in some way or you feel that you have a duty to them because they have helped you

name: belabor
trans: v. to repeat or stress too much or too often 过分强调
v. to attack or criticize 抨击

detailed_translations.chinese: 痛打；抨击；过度说明；反复讨论

name: belie
trans: v. to show to be false or wrong 证明...是错误的
v. disguise 掩饰
v. to present an appearance not in agreement with 与...不符

sentences.english: Her pleasant manner belied her true character.
sentences.chinese: 她讨人喜欢的举止掩饰了她真实的个性。

detailed_translations.chinese: 掩饰；与…不符；使失望；证明…虚假错误
detailed_translations.english: to give someone a false idea about something

name: belligerent
trans: adj. feeling or showing readiness to fight 好战的

sentences.english: a belligerent attitude
sentences.chinese: 敌对的态度

detailed_translations.chinese: 交战的；好战的；交战国的
detailed_translations.english: a belligerent country is fighting a war against another country

detailed_translations.chinese: 交战国；参加斗殴的人或集团

name: bemoan
trans: v. to complain about 埋怨

sentences.english: He was bemoaning the fact that lawyers charge so much.
sentences.chinese: 他抱怨律师收费太高。

detailed_translations.english: to complain or say that you are disappointed about something

name: beneficence
trans: n. a charitable act or gift 慈善，善行

detailed_translations.english: the act of doing good; kindness

name: benevolent
trans: adj. organized to do good things for other people 仁慈的

sentences.english: A benevolent uncle paid for her to have music lessons.
sentences.chinese: 一位叔叔慷慨解囊，出钱供她上音乐课。

sentences.english: a benevolent smile
sentences.chinese: 慈祥的笑容

detailed_translations.english: kind and generous

name: benign
trans: adj. showing kindness and gentleness 和善的

sentences.english: He shook his head in benign amusement.
sentences.chinese: 他被逗乐了，和蔼地摇了摇头。

detailed_translations.chinese: 良性的；和蔼的，亲切的；吉利的
detailed_translations.english: kind and gentle

name: betoken
trans: v. to show 表示

sentences.english: The president alone betokened the national identity.
sentences.chinese: 总统一人就代表了国家形象。

detailed_translations.english: to be a sign of something

name: bias
trans: n. a tendency to believe that some people, ideas, etc., are better than others that usually results in treating some people unfairly 偏见
n. a strong interest in something or ability to do something 倾向

sentences.english: Students were evaluated without bias.
sentences.chinese: 对学生的评估都是公正的。

detailed_translations.english: an opinion about whether a person, group, or idea is good or bad that influences how you deal with it

name: blameless
trans: adj. has not done anything wrong 无可指责的

name: bland
trans: adj. not interesting or exciting 乏味的
adj. showing no emotion, concern, etc. 无动于衷的

sentences.english: a few bland comments
sentences.chinese: 不痛不痒的几句评语

detailed_translations.english: without any excitement, strong opinions, or special character

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…变得淡而无味；除掉…的特性
变得平淡无奇；丧失特性

name: blemish
trans: v. to spoil by a flaw 玷污
n. a mark that makes something imperfect or less beautiful 污点，缺点

sentences.english: Every piece is closely scrutinized, and if there is the slightest blemish on it, it is rejected.
sentences.chinese: 每一件都经过仔细检查，如果上面有哪怕最微小的瑕疵，都会被拒绝。

detailed_translations.english: a small mark, especially a mark on someone’s skin or on the surface of an object, that spoils its appearance
to spoil the beauty or appearance of something, so that it is not perfect

name: blighted
trans: adj. in a badly damaged or deteriorated condition 枯萎的

sentences.english: The dry spell blighted the crops.
sentences.chinese: 干旱期使农作物枯萎了。

sentences.english: The disease blighted oaks and elms.
sentences.chinese: 疾病使栎树和榆树枯萎。

name: blunt
trans: adj. having a thick edge or point 钝的
adj. being straight to the point 直言不讳的

sentences.english: Sharpen all your blunt knives.
sentences.chinese: 把你所有的钝刀子都磨一磨。

sentences.english: a blunt pencil
sentences.chinese: 钝铅笔

detailed_translations.chinese: 钝的；率直的，直言不讳的
detailed_translations.english: not sharp or pointed

detailed_translations.chinese: 使迟钝； 使减弱； 使钝
detailed_translations.english: to make a feeling less strong

name: boast
trans: n. a statement in which you express too much pride in yourself or in something you have, have done, or are connected to in some way 吹嘘，自夸

sentences.english: The city boasts two excellent museums.
sentences.chinese: 这个城市以拥有两个优秀的博物馆而自豪。

sentences.english: The Society boasts 3,000 members worldwide.
sentences.chinese: 这个协会以拥有3,000名来自世界各地的会员而自豪。

sentences.english: It is the charity's proud boast that it has never yet turned anyone away.
sentences.chinese: 该慈善机构自吹自擂，声称从来没有拒绝过任何人。

detailed_translations.english: if a place, object, or organization boasts something, it has something that is very good

detailed_translations.chinese: 自夸，吹嘘；以拥有…而自豪
detailed_translations.english: to talk too proudly about your abilities, achievements, or possessions

detailed_translations.chinese: 自吹自擂， 自夸的话
detailed_translations.english: Boast is also a noun

name: bogus
trans: adj. not real or genuine 伪造的

sentences.english: bogus insurance claims
sentences.chinese: 虚报的保险索赔

sentences.english: bogus applications for asylum
sentences.chinese: 虚假的避难申请

detailed_translations.english: not true or real, although someone is trying to make you think it is

name: bolster
trans: v. to give support to 支持

sentences.english: I'll bolster you up.
sentences.chinese: 我支持你。

sentences.english: More timbers are needed to bolster the roof of the mine.
sentences.chinese: 需要更多的木材支撑矿顶。

sentences.english: If you have a bolster or several pillows, place your lower back onto the support.
sentences.chinese: 如果你有一个支撑或者一些枕头，将你的下半身靠在这些支撑上。

detailed_translations.english: a long firm  pillow  , usually shaped like a tube

name: bookish
trans: adj. more interested in reading books and studying than doing more physical activities 书呆子气的

sentences.english: a shy bookish man
sentences.chinese: 一个腼腆的书呆子

detailed_translations.chinese: 书本上的；好读书的；书呆子气的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is bookish is more interested in reading and studying than in sports or other activities

name: boon
trans: n. something pleasant or helpful 好处，恩惠

sentences.english: It is for this reason that television proves such a boon to so many people.
sentences.chinese: 正是这个原因电视机成为这么多人的一大福音。

detailed_translations.english: You can describe something as a boon when it makes life better or easier for someone

name: boundary
trans: n. something that indicates or fixes a limit or extent 界限

sentences.english: National boundaries are becoming increasingly meaningless in the global economy.
sentences.chinese: 在全球经济中，国界已经变得越来越没有意义。

sentences.english: We would need their agreement to build outside the city boundary .
sentences.chinese: 我们在市界以外的地方建房需要他们批准。

sentences.english: The stream curves round to mark the boundary of his property.
sentences.chinese: 小河打了个弯，为他这块地划出了边界。

sentences.english: Anything that crosses the boundary of a black hole cannot get back.
sentences.chinese: 任何物质只要跨越黑洞的界线就再也无法出来。

sentences.english: We walked through the churchyard towards the boundary wall .
sentences.chinese: 我们穿过教堂墓地，向院墙走去。

sentences.english: The property’s boundary line is 25 feet from the back of the house.
sentences.chinese: 这块地产的边界线在屋后25英尺的地方。

sentences.english: boundary disputes between neighbouring countries
sentences.chinese: 邻国之间的边界争端

detailed_translations.english: the real or imaginary line that marks the edge of a state, country etc, or the edge of an area of land that belongs to someone

name: brake
trans: n. something used to slow down or stop movement or activity 阻碍，刹车

sentences.english: Test your brakes after driving through water.
sentences.chinese: 车子涉水之后要检验一下刹车。

sentences.english: I managed to put the brakes on just in time.
sentences.chinese: 我最终及时刹了车。

sentences.english: Moira slammed on the brakes (=  used them suddenly and with a lot of force  ) .
sentences.chinese: 莫伊拉猛踩刹车。

sentences.english: the screech of brakes
sentences.chinese: 刹车的刺耳噪音

sentences.english: He braked sharply to avoid the dog.
sentences.chinese: 他突然急刹车，想避开那条狗。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that makes a vehicle go more slowly or stop
to make a vehicle or bicycle go more slowly or stop by using its brake

name: brandish
trans: v. to exhibit in a ostentatious or aggressive manner 炫耀

sentences.english: A man leapt out, brandishing a kitchen knife.
sentences.chinese: 一个男人挥着一把菜刀跳了出来。

detailed_translations.english: to wave something around in a dangerous or threatening way, especially a weapon

name: breakthrough
trans: n. a sudden increase in knowledge, understanding, etc. 突破

sentences.english: The company looks poised to make a significant breakthrough in China.
sentences.chinese: 该公司看上去稳将在中国实现一次重大突破。

detailed_translations.english: an important new discovery in something you are studying, especially one made after trying for a long time

name: breathtaking
trans: adj. very exciting 令人激动的

sentences.english: The view from my bedroom window was absolutely breathtaking.
sentences.chinese: 我卧室窗外的景色美得令人窒息。

sentences.english: an act of breathtaking arrogance
sentences.chinese: 令人咋舌的傲慢举动

detailed_translations.chinese: 惊人的；惊险的；令人激动的
detailed_translations.english: very impressive, exciting, or surprising

name: brevity
trans: n. the use of few words to say something 简洁

sentences.english: Letters published in the newspaper are edited for brevity and clarity.
sentences.chinese: 报上刊登的来信都要编辑得简洁明了。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of expressing something in very few words

name: bridle
trans: v. to restrain, check, or control with or as if with a bridle 抑制

sentences.english: The metal mouthpiece of a bridle, serving to control, curb, and direct an animal.
sentences.chinese: 马勒， 嚼子放在嘴里的金属制马勒，用于控制约束和驾御牲畜。

sentences.english: Inadvertently the paper added a comma to the ad, which read instead:Horse, saddle and bridle for $50.
sentences.chinese: 无意中报纸在广告语中加了个逗号，读起来成这样了，50元卖马，马鞍和马缰绳。

sentences.english: These included a saddle, bridle, clay vase, wooden bowl, trough, iron kettle, the remains of an entire horse, and ancient clothing.
sentences.chinese: 这些物品包括一个鞍，缰绳，黏土花瓶，木碗，饲料槽，铁壶，一整匹马的遗骸以及一件古老的衣服。

detailed_translations.chinese: 上笼头； 昂首 ； 抑制
detailed_translations.english: to put a bridle on a horse
a set of leather bands put around a horse’s head and used to control its movements

name: brook
trans: v. to allow to exist or happen 容忍

sentences.english: He would brook no criticism, even from his beloved daughter.
sentences.chinese: 他不能容忍任何批评，哪怕是自己深爱的女儿也不行。

detailed_translations.english: to not allow or accept something
a small stream

name: bucolic
trans: adj. of or relating to the country or country life 乡村的

sentences.english: ...the bucolic surroundings of Chantilly.
sentences.chinese: ...尚蒂伊的田园景致。

detailed_translations.chinese: 牧歌的；牧羊的；乡下风味的
detailed_translations.english: Bucolic means relating to the countryside

name: budding
trans: adj. being in an early stage of development 萌芽期的

name: buoy
trans: v. to cause to feel happy or confident 使振奋

sentences.english: The party is buoyed up by the latest opinion poll results.
sentences.chinese: 该党因为最近一次民意测验的结果而受到鼓舞。

detailed_translations.chinese: [水运] 浮标；浮筒；救生圈；航标
detailed_translations.english: an object that floats on the sea, a lake etc to mark a safe or dangerous area
to keep something floating

name: burdensome
trans: adj. causing difficulty or worry 繁重的

sentences.english: ...a burdensome debt.
sentences.chinese: …一笔沉重的债务。

sentences.english: The load was too burdensome.
sentences.chinese: 负担太繁重了。

detailed_translations.english: If you describe something as burdensome, you mean it is worrying or hard to deal with

name: burgeon
trans: v. to grow or develop quickly 迅速生长

sentences.english: When spring is coming all trees begin to burgeon .
sentences.chinese: 当春天到来的时候，所有树开始发芽。

sentences.english: The brain-drain effect of studying abroad has started to burgeon due to flaws in the domestic academic environment.
sentences.chinese: 由于国内学术环境恶劣，出国留学造成人才外流的现象已经初显萌芽。

sentences.english: The seed of friendship and cooperation we sow today will burgeon and harvest in the future and China-US partnership of cooperation will definitely enjoy a better tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 我们今天播下的友好合作种子一定能够生根发芽、开花结果，中美合作伙伴关系一定能够迎来更加美好的明天。

name: businesslike
trans: adj. having or showing qualities that are considered good in business 高效率的

name: buttress
trans: v. to support, strengthen, or defend 支持

sentences.english: ...the neo-Gothic buttresses of Riverside Church in Manhattan.
sentences.chinese: …曼哈顿的里弗赛德教堂中的新哥特式扶璧。

detailed_translations.english: a brick or stone structure built to support a wall
to support a system, idea, argument etc, especially by providing money

name: bypass
trans: v. to avoid or ignore especially to get something done quicker 避开

sentences.english: a triple bypass operation
sentences.chinese: 接三通管的手术

sentences.english: Interstate 8 bypasses the town to the north.
sentences.chinese: 八号州际公路绕城向北而行。

detailed_translations.english: a tube that allows gas or liquid to flow around something rather than through it
to go around a town or other busy place rather than through it

name: callous
trans: adj. not feeling or showing any concern about the problems or suffering of other people 冷酷无情的

sentences.english: We were shocked at the callous disregard for human life.
sentences.chinese: 我们对这种无视人类生命的冷漠感到震惊。

sentences.english: a callous attitude
sentences.chinese: 冷漠的态度

sentences.english: the callous slaughter of seals
sentences.chinese: 对海豹的无情残杀

detailed_translations.chinese: 无情的；麻木的；硬结的；起老茧的
detailed_translations.english: not caring that other people are suffering

detailed_translations.chinese: 使冷酷无情；使硬结；使生茧

name: callow
trans: adj. lacking adult sophistication 不成熟的

sentences.english: ...a callow youth.
sentences.chinese: ...一个羽翼未丰的年轻人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 年轻而无经验的；羽毛未丰的
detailed_translations.english: A callow young person has very little experience or knowledge of the way they should behave as an adult

name: calumny
trans: n. an untrue statement that is made to damage someone’s reputation 诽谤

sentences.english: He was the victim of calumny.
sentences.chinese: 他曾是诽谤的受害者。

detailed_translations.english: when someone says things like this

name: camaraderie
trans: n. a feeling of good friendship among the people in a group 情谊，友情

sentences.english: the camaraderie of the women’s basketball team
sentences.chinese: 女子篮球队的队友情谊

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of friendship that a group of people have, especially when they work together

name: candid
trans: adj. expressing opinions and feelings in an honest and sincere way 真诚的

sentences.english: It struck me as an unusually candid confession for a politician.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得这对一个政治家来说是非常坦率的告白了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 公正的；坦白的；率直的；偷拍的
detailed_translations.english: telling the truth, even when the truth may be unpleasant or embarrassing

name: canned
trans: adj. not original or special 无新意的

name: canny
trans: adj. very clever and able to make intelligent 精明的

sentences.english: a canny political advisor
sentences.chinese: 精明的政治顾问

detailed_translations.english: clever, careful, and not easily deceived, especially in business or politics

name: capricious
trans: adj. changing often and quickly 变化无常的

sentences.english: She was as capricious as her mother had been.
sentences.chinese: 她和她母亲当初一样反复无常。

detailed_translations.english: likely to change your mind suddenly or behave in an unexpected way

name: captivate
trans: v. to attract and hold the attention of by being interesting, pretty, etc. 迷住

sentences.english: I was captivated by her brilliant mind.
sentences.chinese: 我为她的聪慧所迷。

detailed_translations.english: to attract someone very much, and hold their attention

name: capture
trans: v. to catch 俘获

sentences.english: Government troops have succeeded in capturing the rebel leader.
sentences.chinese: 政府军已经成功抓获叛乱分子的头目。

sentences.english: 40 captured French soldiers
sentences.chinese: 40名被俘虏的法国士兵

detailed_translations.english: to catch a person and keep them as a prisoner

name: caricature
trans: n. someone or something that is very exaggerated in a funny or foolish way 夸张的描述

sentences.english: The poster showed a caricature of Hitler with a devil's horns and tail.
sentences.chinese: 这张招贴漫画里的希特勒长着魔鬼一样的犄角和尾巴。

detailed_translations.english: a funny drawing of someone that makes them look silly
to draw or describe someone or something in a way that makes them seem silly

name: castigate
trans: v. to criticize harshly 严厉批评

sentences.english: Marx never lost an opportunity to castigate colonialism.
sentences.chinese: 马克思从不放过任何谴责殖民主义的机会。

detailed_translations.english: to criticize or punish someone severely

name: catalyst
trans: n. an agent that provokes or speeds significant change or action 催化剂，促进因素

sentences.english: I very much hope that this case will prove to be a catalyst for change.
sentences.chinese: 我非常希望这件事终将成为促成变化的催化剂。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that makes a chemical reaction happen more quickly without being changed itself

name: caterwaul
trans: v. to make a very loud and unpleasant sound 发出让人不爽的噪音

name: cede to
trans: phrase. 让与

name: celebrate
trans: v. to praise 赞美

sentences.english: It’s Dad’s birthday and we’re going out for a meal to celebrate.
sentences.chinese: 今天是爸爸的生日，我们打算出去吃饭庆祝一下。

sentences.english: My folks are celebrating their 50th anniversary.
sentences.chinese: 我父母正在庆祝他们结婚50周年。

sentences.english: poems that celebrate the joys of love
sentences.chinese: 赞美爱之喜悦的诗歌

detailed_translations.english: to show that an event or occasion is important by doing something special or enjoyable

name: celerity
trans: n. rapidity of motion or action 速度，迅速

sentences.english: It is an effective liquid separation tool with advantages such as simpleness, celerity and veracity.
sentences.chinese: 该量取器使用方法简单、快速，是一种准确、有效的液体分离工具。

sentences.english: It improves the celerity and accuracy of speed tracking.
sentences.chinese: 提高速度跟踪的快速性和精确性。

sentences.english: The results showed that series-determine method with merits of nicety and celerity has notable effects.
sentences.chinese: 研究结果表明，一次性连续测定法具有快速、准确等优点，效果显著。

detailed_translations.english: rapidity; swiftness; speed

name: censor
trans: v. to examine in order to suppress or delete anything considered objectionable 审查
n. a person who supervises conduct and morals 审查员

sentences.english: The information given to the press was carefully censored by the Ministry of Defence.
sentences.chinese: 发布给报界的信息经过了国防部的仔细审查。

detailed_translations.english: to examine books, films, letters etc to remove anything that is considered offensive, morally harmful, or politically dangerous etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 检查员；[心理] 潜意识压抑力；信件检查员
detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to examine books, films, letters etc and remove anything considered to be offensive, morally harmful, or politically dangerous

name: censure
trans: n. official strong criticism 谴责

sentences.english: The ethics committee may take a decision to admonish him or to censure him.
sentences.chinese: 道德规范委员会可能决定对他进行警告或批评。

detailed_translations.english: If you censure someone for something that they have done, you tell them that you strongly disapprove of it
the act of expressing strong disapproval and criticism

name: centralize
trans: v. to bring together at a single point or place 集中
v. to bring under the control of one authority 使集权

sentences.english: plans to centralize the company’s U.S. activities
sentences.chinese: 公司对在美国的业务活动进行统一管理的计划

detailed_translations.english: to organize the control of a country, organization, or system so that everything is done or decided in one place

detailed_translations.chinese: 集聚，集中；施行中央集权
detailed_translations.english: to organize the control of a country, organization, or system so that everything is done or decided in one place

name: cerebral
trans: adj. of or relating to the brain 大脑的
adj. intellectual and not emotional 理性的

sentences.english: a cerebral haemorrhage
sentences.chinese: 脑出[溢]血

detailed_translations.english: relating to or affecting your brain

name: chagrin
trans: n. a feeling of being frustrated or annoyed because of failure or disappointment 失望

sentences.english: To the chagrin of their parents, neither Phil nor Pam went to church anymore.
sentences.chinese: 令父母失望的是，菲尔和帕姆都再也不去教堂了。

detailed_translations.english: annoyance and disappointment because something has not happened the way you hoped
to feel annoyed and disappointed

name: challenging
trans: adj. arousing competitive interest, thought, or action 有挑战性的
adj. invitingly provocative 引起挑战兴趣的

sentences.english: Teaching young children is a challenging and rewarding job.
sentences.chinese: 幼儿教育是一项具有挑战性和有意义的工作。

sentences.english: a challenging problem
sentences.chinese: 具有挑战性的难题

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑战的；引起挑战性兴趣的
detailed_translations.english: difficult in an interesting or enjoyable way

detailed_translations.chinese: 要求；质疑；反对；向…挑战；盘问（challenge的ing形式）

name: champion
trans: v. to fight or speak publicly in support of 支持

sentences.english: the world heavyweight boxing champion
sentences.chinese: 世界重量级拳击冠军

sentences.english: the Olympic champion
sentences.chinese: 奥运会冠军

sentences.english: He passionately championed the poor.
sentences.chinese: 他曾热情地捍卫穷人。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that has won a competition, especially in sport
If you champion a person, a cause, or a principle, you support or defend them

name: chaotic
trans: adj. in a state of complete disorder and confusion 混乱的

sentences.english: a chaotic mixture of images
sentences.chinese: 杂乱无章的各种图像

detailed_translations.english: a chaotic situation is one in which everything is happening in a confused way

name: charity
trans: n. the act of giving money, food, or other kinks of help to people who are poor, sick, etc. 慈善

sentences.english: Several charities sent aid to the flood victims.
sentences.chinese: 有几家慈善机构已向洪灾灾民送去了救援物资。

detailed_translations.english: an organization that gives money, goods, or help to people who are poor, sick etc

name: chastise
trans: v. to criticize harshly for doing something wrong 严厉批评

sentences.english: ‘You’re a fool,’ she chastised herself.
sentences.chinese: “你真傻。”她自责道。

detailed_translations.english: to physically punish someone

name: check
trans: n. a sudden stoppage of a forward course or progress 阻止

sentences.english: Check the tiles carefully before you buy them.
sentences.chinese: 购买之前要把瓷砖仔细检查一下。

sentences.english: A first rule in solving any mystery is to check the facts.
sentences.chinese: 揭开谜团的第一条规则是核查事实。

sentences.english: The police are failing to take adequate measures to check the growth in crime.
sentences.chinese: 警方未能采取适当的措施来阻止犯罪率上升。

sentences.english: Conduct regular checks on your water quality.
sentences.chinese: 要经常检查水质。

detailed_translations.english: to do something in order to find out whether something really is correct, true, or in good condition
the process of finding out if something is safe, correct, true, or in the condition it should be

name: cheerless
trans: adj. not causing happiness or warm feelings 阴郁的

sentences.english: This is a cold cheerless place.
sentences.chinese: 这是个寒冷、阴郁的地方。

sentences.english: The day was grey and cheerless.
sentences.chinese: 天色灰暗阴沉。

detailed_translations.english: cheerless weather, places,or times make you feel sad, bored, or uncomfortable

name: cherish
trans: v. to feel or show great love for 珍爱
v. to remember or hold in a deeply felt way 怀有

sentences.english: In marriage, a man promises to cherish his wife.
sentences.chinese: 在婚姻中，男人承诺要爱护妻子。

sentences.english: his most cherished possession
sentences.chinese: 他最珍爱的物品

detailed_translations.english: to love someone or something very much and take care of them well

name: chic
trans: adj. following the current fashion or style 时髦的

sentences.english: ...French designer chic.
sentences.chinese: …法国设计师的特有风格。

detailed_translations.english: Chic is used to refer to a particular style or to the quality of being chic
very fashionable and expensive, and showing good judgement of what is attractive and good style

name: chimera
trans: n. something that exists only in the imagination and is not possible in reality 幻想

sentences.english: Religious unity remained as much a chimera as ever.
sentences.chinese: 宗教统一仍旧是一通幻想。

detailed_translations.english: A chimera is an unrealistic idea that you have about something or a hope that you have that is unlikely to be fulfilled

name: choreograph
trans: v. to arrange or direct the movements, progress, or detail of 精心安排

sentences.english: The show is very cleverly choreographed.
sentences.chinese: 这个节目的舞蹈动作设计得非常好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 设计舞蹈动作， 编舞
detailed_translations.english: to arrange how dancers should move during a performance

name: churlish
trans: adj. not polite 无礼的

sentences.english: She would think him churlish if he refused.
sentences.chinese: 如果他拒绝，她会觉得他不礼貌。

sentences.english: The room was so nice it seemed churlish to argue.
sentences.chinese: 这房间这么好，吵架的话就显得无礼了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 没有礼貌的；脾气暴躁的
detailed_translations.english: Someone who is churlish is unfriendly, bad-tempered, or impolite

name: circuitous
trans: adj. not straight, short, and direct 拐弯抹角的

sentences.english: a hard circuitous hike
sentences.chinese: 一次艰难曲折的徒步旅行

detailed_translations.chinese: 迂曲的；绕行的；迂回线路的
detailed_translations.english: going from one place to another in a way that is longer than the most direct way

name: circumscribe
trans: v. to limit the size or amount of 限制

sentences.english: The President’s power is circumscribed by Congress and the Supreme Court.
sentences.chinese: 总统的权力受到国会和最高法院的制约。

detailed_translations.chinese: 外切，外接；限制；在…周围画线
detailed_translations.english: to limit power, rights, or abilities

name: circumspect
trans: adj. thinking carefully about possible risks before doing or saying something 谨慎的

sentences.english: The banks should have been more circumspect in their dealings.
sentences.chinese: 银行在交易时应更加谨慎。

detailed_translations.english: If you are circumspect, you are cautious in what you do and say and do not take risks

name: circumstantial
trans: adj. belonging to, consisting in, or dependent on circumstances 依情况而定的

sentences.english: The book includes a long and circumstantial account of Empson’s conversation with the Queen.
sentences.chinese: 这本书以很长的篇幅详细记录了恩普森和女王的谈话。

detailed_translations.chinese: 依照情况的；详细的，详尽的；偶然的
detailed_translations.english: including all the details

name: circumvent
trans: v. to avoid being stopped by 避开

sentences.english: The company opened an account abroad, in order to circumvent the tax laws.
sentences.chinese: 为规避税法，这家公司在国外开设了账户。

detailed_translations.english: to avoid a problem or rule that restricts you, especially in a clever or dishonest way – used to show disapproval

name: civic
trans: adj. of or relating to a citizen, a city, citizenship, or community affairs 公民的

sentences.english: Jackson spent the day meeting with local religious and civic leaders.
sentences.chinese: 杰克逊那天与当地的宗教领袖和市领导会面。

detailed_translations.english: relating to a town or city

name: civility
trans: n. polite actions and words 礼貌

sentences.english: Please have the civility to knock before you enter next time.
sentences.chinese: 下次你进来之前要有点礼貌——先敲门。

detailed_translations.english: polite behaviour which most people consider normal

name: clandestine
trans: adj. marked by, held in, or conducted with secrecy 秘密的

sentences.english: a clandestine affair
sentences.chinese: 秘密关系

sentences.english: clandestine meetings
sentences.chinese: 秘密会议

detailed_translations.chinese: 秘密的，私下的；偷偷摸摸的
detailed_translations.english: done or kept secret

name: clerical
trans: adj. of or relating to a clerk or office worker 职员的，牧师的

name: cliquish
trans: adj. spend time only with other members of the group and seem unfriendly towards people who are not in the group 小集团的

name: cloak
trans: v. to hide or disguise 掩盖

sentences.english: She threw off her cloak with an abandoned gesture.
sentences.chinese: 她以一种放纵的姿势脱掉了斗篷。

detailed_translations.english: a warm piece of clothing like a coat without sleeves that hangs loosely from your shoulders
to deliberately hide facts, feelings etc so that people do not see or understand them – used especially in news reports

name: clot
trans: v. to become thick and partly solid 凝结

sentences.english: The patient's blood refused to clot.
sentences.chinese: 病人的血液无法凝结。

detailed_translations.english: if a liquid such as blood or milk clots, or if something clots it, it becomes thicker and more solid
a thick almost solid mass formed when blood or milk dries

name: clumsy
trans: adj. awkward or inefficient in use or construction 笨拙的

sentences.english: A clumsy waiter spilled wine all over her new skirt.
sentences.chinese: 一名笨手笨脚的服务员把葡萄酒洒得她新裙子上到处都是。

sentences.english: a clumsy attempt to catch the ball
sentences.chinese: 笨拙的接球动作

detailed_translations.english: moving or doing things in a careless way, especially so that you drop things, knock into things etc

name: cluster
trans: v. to come together to form a group 聚集

sentences.english: Do this for all nodes in the cluster.
sentences.chinese: 对集群中的所有节点都这样做。

sentences.english: This can be done on any server of the cluster.
sentences.chinese: 可以在集群的任何服务器中这样做。

sentences.english: However, there are some problems in the cluster environment.
sentences.chinese: 然而，在集群环境中却存在一些问题。

detailed_translations.english: a group of things of the same kind that are very close together
if a group of people or things cluster somewhere, or are clustered somewhere, they form a small group in that place

name: coalesce
trans: v. to come together to form one group or mass 合并

sentences.english: As the number of moisture droplets increases, they begin to coalesce into small rivulets of fluid.
sentences.chinese: 当水滴数量增加，它们会汇集成细流。

detailed_translations.english: if objects or ideas coalesce, they combine to form one single group

name: coherent
trans: adj. working closely and well together 连贯的
adj. able to talk or express yourself in a clear way that can be easily understood 条理清楚的

sentences.english: The three years of the course are planned as a coherent whole.
sentences.chinese: 这三年的课程是作为连贯的整体来安排的。

sentences.english: a coherent account of the incident
sentences.chinese: 对该事件条理分明的陈述

sentences.english: He's so calm when he answers questions in interviews. I wish I could be that coherent.
sentences.chinese: 他如此镇定地回答了访谈中的问题。我希望我也能那样有条不紊。

detailed_translations.chinese: 一致的，协调的；(话语等)条理清楚的
detailed_translations.english: if a piece of writing, set of ideas etc is coherent, it is easy to understand because it is clear and reasonable

name: collective
trans: adj. shared or done by a group of people 共同的，集体的

sentences.english: a collective decision made by all board members
sentences.chinese: 董事会所有成员作出的集体决定

sentences.english: our collective responsibility for the environment
sentences.chinese: 我们对环境的共同责任

detailed_translations.english: shared or made by every member of a group or society

name: collide
trans: v. to hit something or each other with strong force 碰撞

sentences.english: A car and a van collided on the motorway.
sentences.chinese: 一辆汽车和一辆小型货车在高速公路上相撞了。

sentences.english: Two trains collided head-on (= when they were moving directly towards each other ) .
sentences.chinese: 两辆火车迎头相撞。

detailed_translations.english: to hit something or someone that is moving in a different direction from you

name: collude
trans: v. conspire, plot 串通

sentences.english: Several local officials are in jail on charges of colluding with the Mafia.
sentences.chinese: 几位地方官员因涉嫌串通黑手党而锒铛入狱。

detailed_translations.english: to work with someone secretly, especially in order to do something dishonest or illegal

name: colossal
trans: adj. very large or great 巨大的

sentences.english: a colossal statue of the King
sentences.chinese: 国王的巨大雕像

sentences.english: This whole holiday was a colossal waste of money.
sentences.chinese: 这次度假浪费了大量的钱财。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something is extremely large

name: comity
trans: n. friendly social atmosphere 友谊

name: commendation
trans: n. the act of praising or approving of someone or something 称赞

sentences.english: Go through your files and look for letters of commendation, awards, etc. you earned in your industry.
sentences.chinese: 检查你所有的个人文件，寻找在你的行业中所获得的推荐信，奖励等等。

detailed_translations.english: an official statement praising someone, especially someone who has been brave or very successful

name: commensurate
trans: adj. equal or similar to something in size, amount, or degree 相称的

sentences.english: Employees are paid salaries commensurate with those of teachers.
sentences.chinese: 发给雇员的薪水与发给教师的薪水相当。

detailed_translations.chinese: 相称的；同量的；同样大小的
detailed_translations.english: matching something in size, quality, or length of time

name: commonplace
trans: n. something that happens or appears in many places and is not unusual 常见
n. an obvious or trite comment 陈词滥调

sentences.english: Car thefts are commonplace in this part of town.
sentences.chinese: 镇上的这个地段盗车案屡见不鲜。

sentences.english: It is a commonplace to say that Northern Ireland is a backwater in the modern Europe.
sentences.chinese: 说北爱尔兰是现代欧洲死气沉沉的落后地区已是陈词滥调了。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing in many places, and therefore not special or unusual
something that has been said so often that it is no longer interesting or original

name: comparable
trans: adj. used to say that two or more things are very similar and can be compared to each other 相似的

sentences.english: A car of comparable size would cost far more abroad.
sentences.chinese: 同样大小的汽车在国外要贵得多。

detailed_translations.english: similar to something else in size, number, quality etc, so that you can make a comparison

name: compartmentalize
trans: v. to divide into separate sections 分开

name: compelling
trans: adj. very interesting 激发兴趣的
adj. capable of causing someone to believe or agree 令人信服的
adj. strong and forceful 强大的

sentences.english: His life makes a compelling story .
sentences.chinese: 他的一生是个引人入胜的故事。

detailed_translations.english: very interesting or exciting, so that you have to pay attention

name: compensate
trans: v. to make up for some defect or weakness 补偿

sentences.english: the government’s promise to compensate victims of the flood
sentences.chinese: 政府对水灾灾民给予补偿的许诺

sentences.english: The firm will compensate workers for their loss of earnings.
sentences.chinese: 公司将补偿工人的收入损失。

detailed_translations.english: to pay someone money because they have suffered injury, loss, or damage

name: competing
trans: adj. used for ideas, requirements, or interests that cannot all be right or satisfied at the same time 相互矛盾的

sentences.english: Several people gave competing accounts of the accident.
sentences.chinese: 几个人对这一事件的说法互相矛盾。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有竞争性的； 不相上下的

name: complacent
trans: adj. satisfied with how things are and not wanting to change them 自满的

sentences.english: There’s a danger of becoming complacent if you win a few games.
sentences.chinese: 赢了几场比赛可能就会变得沾沾自喜。

sentences.english: a complacent attitude towards the problem
sentences.chinese: 对问题满不在乎的态度

detailed_translations.english: pleased with a situation, especially something you have achieved, so that you stop trying to improve or change things – used to show disapproval

name: complex
trans: adj. having parts that connect or go together in complicated ways 复杂的
adj. not easy to understand or explain 难懂的

sentences.english: a complex system of highways
sentences.chinese: 复杂的公路网

sentences.english: Photosynthesis is a highly complex process.
sentences.chinese: 光合作用是一个非常复杂的过程。

sentences.english: Peter seemed to have an instant understanding of the most complex issues.
sentences.chinese: 再复杂的问题彼得似乎也是一看就明白。

sentences.english: It was a very complex relationship between two complex people.
sentences.chinese: 这是两个复杂的人之间非常复杂的关系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 由许多部分组成的，复合的；复杂的，难懂的
detailed_translations.english: consisting of many different parts and often difficult to understand

detailed_translations.chinese: 综合体， 集合体； 情结， 夸大的情绪反应
detailed_translations.english: a group of buildings, or a large building with many parts, used for a particular purpose

name: complicated
trans: adj. hard to understand, explain, or deal with 复杂难懂的

sentences.english: a complicated pattern
sentences.chinese: 复杂的图案

sentences.english: The human brain is an incredibly complicated organ.
sentences.chinese: 人脑是一个结构极其复杂的器官。

detailed_translations.english: consisting of many closely connected parts

name: composed
trans: adj. calm and in control of your emotions 镇定的

sentences.english: He appeared very composed despite the stress he was under.
sentences.chinese: 尽管压力很大，他看起来仍十分镇定。

detailed_translations.english: seeming calm and not upset or angry

detailed_translations.chinese: 组成；作曲（compose的过去分词）；著作

name: comprehend
trans: v. to understand 理解

sentences.english: She cannot comprehend the extent of the disaster.
sentences.chinese: 她无法理解这场灾难的严重程度。

sentences.english: I did not fully comprehend what had happened.
sentences.chinese: 我没有完全理解发生了什么事。

detailed_translations.english: to understand something that is complicated or difficult

name: comprehensive
trans: adj. covering completely or broadly 全面的

sentences.english: We offer our customers a comprehensive range of financial products.
sentences.chinese: 我们为客户提供全面的金融产品。

sentences.english: a comprehensive guide to British hotels and restaurants
sentences.chinese: 一本介绍英国酒店和餐厅的详尽指南

sentences.english: The following guidelines do not aim to be totally comprehensive.
sentences.chinese: 以下指导原则并非想要面面俱到。

detailed_translations.english: including all the necessary facts, details, or problems that need to be dealt with

name: comprise
trans: v. to include or consist of 包含

sentences.english: The house comprises two bedrooms, a kitchen, and a living room.
sentences.chinese: 这座房子有两间卧室、一间厨房和一间起居室。

sentences.english: Women comprise a high proportion of part-time workers.
sentences.chinese: 兼职人员中妇女占了很大一部分。

detailed_translations.english: to consist of particular parts, groups etc

name: compromise
trans: n. a way of reaching agreement in which each person or group gives up something that was wanted in order to end an argument or dispute妥协
v. to damage or weaken 危害

sentences.english: She admitted that she was unable to compromise.
sentences.chinese: 她承认自己无法作出妥协。

detailed_translations.chinese: 妥协； 危及； 放弃
detailed_translations.english: to reach an agreement in which everyone involved accepts less than what they wanted at first
an agreement that is achieved after everyone involved accepts less than what they wanted at first, or the act of making this agreement

name: compulsory
trans: adj. mandatory, enforced 强迫的

sentences.english: the threat of compulsory redundancies
sentences.chinese: 强制性裁员的威胁

sentences.english: Car insurance is compulsory.
sentences.chinese: 汽车保险是强制性的。

detailed_translations.english: that must be done because of a law or a rule

name: compunction
trans: n. a feeling of guilt or regret 后悔

sentences.english: They used their tanks against the leftists without compunction .
sentences.chinese: 他们肆无忌惮地使用坦克来对付左派人士。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that you should not do something because it is bad or wrong

name: concede
trans: v. to say that you accept or do not deny the truth or existence of 承认

sentences.english: ‘That’s the only possible solution.’ ‘Yes, I suppose so,’ Charles conceded.
sentences.chinese: “那是唯一可行的解决办法。”“对，我想是。”查尔斯承认道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 承认， 承认…为真； 承认失败； 允许， 让予； 让步， 认输
detailed_translations.english: to admit that something is true or correct, although you wish it were not true

name: conceivable
trans: adj. imaginable or possible 可想象的

sentences.english: It is conceivable that you may get full compensation, but it’s not likely.
sentences.chinese: 你可能会得到全额赔偿，但可能性不大。

sentences.english: We were discussing the problems from every conceivable angle.
sentences.chinese: 我们正在从各个能想到的角度对问题进行讨论。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可能的；想得到的，可想像的
detailed_translations.english: able to be believed or imagined

name: conciliatory
trans: adj. willing to end a disagreement with someone 愿意和解的

sentences.english: Brooks felt in no mood to be conciliatory.
sentences.chinese: 布鲁克斯不想作出和解。

detailed_translations.english: doing something that is intended to make someone stop arguing with you

name: concoct
trans: v. to make by mixing different things together 混合而制
v. to invent or develop 编造

sentences.english: John concocted an elaborate excuse for being late.
sentences.chinese: 约翰为迟到编了一个巧妙的借口。

detailed_translations.chinese: 捏造；混合而制；调合；图谋
detailed_translations.english: to invent a clever story, excuse, or plan, especially in order to deceive someone

name: condemn
trans: v. to say in a strong and definitive way that someone or something is bad or wrong 谴责

sentences.english: Politicians were quick to condemn the bombing.
sentences.chinese: 政治家们立即对爆炸事件进行了谴责。

sentences.english: He was found guilty and condemned to death.
sentences.chinese: 他被裁定有罪，判了死刑。

detailed_translations.english: to say very strongly that you do not approve of something or someone, especially because you think it is morally wrong

name: condign
trans: adj. deserved, appropriate 适当的

detailed_translations.chinese: 罪有应得的 severe and well deserved)； 适宜的
detailed_translations.english: (esp of a punishment) fitting; deserved

name: conducive
trans: adj. making it easy, possible, or likely for something to happen or exist
有助于...的

sentences.english: an environment conducive to learning
sentences.chinese: 有助于学习的环境

detailed_translations.english: if a situation is conducive to something such as work, rest etc, it provides conditions that make it easy for you to work etc

name: confessional
trans: adj. telling private information about a person’s life 自白的

name: confine
trans: v. to keep within limits 限制

sentences.english: We confined our study to ten cases.
sentences.chinese: 我们把研究限定在十个案例以内。

sentences.english: Any soldier who leaves his post will be confined to barracks (= made to stay in the barracks ) .
sentences.chinese: 任何擅离职守的士兵都要受到在营房里关禁闭的处罚。

sentences.english: within the confines of the prison
sentences.chinese: 在监狱范围内

detailed_translations.english: to keep someone or something within the limits of a particular activity or subject
limits or borders

name: conform to
trans: v. to obey or agree with something 遵从
v. to be in agreement or harmony 与...一致

name: confound
trans: v. to surprise and confuse 使迷惑
v. to prove wrong 证明…有误

sentences.english: His amazing recovery confounded the medical specialists.
sentences.chinese: 他的神奇康复使医学专家感到惊讶。

name: confront
trans: v. to oppose or challenge especially in a direct and forceful way 与...对峙

sentences.english: The problems confronting the new government were enormous.
sentences.chinese: 新政府面临的难题是巨大的。

sentences.english: I confronted him with my suspicions, and he admitted everything.
sentences.chinese: 我当面向他提出我的怀疑，他什么都承认了。

detailed_translations.english: (of problems or a difficult situation) to appear and need to be dealt with by sb

name: confused
trans: adj. unable to understand or think clearly 迷惑的

name: conjecture
trans: n. an opinion or idea formed without proof or sufficient evidence 推测

sentences.english: What she said was pure conjecture .
sentences.chinese: 她所说的纯属猜测。

sentences.english: There has been some conjecture about a possible merger.
sentences.chinese: 有人猜测公司可能会合并。

detailed_translations.english: when you form ideas or opinions without having very much information to base them on
to form an idea or opinion without having much information to base it on

name: consensus
trans: n. a general agreement about something 一致意见

sentences.english: The EU Council of Finance Ministers failed to reach a consensus on the pace of integration.
sentences.chinese: 欧盟财政部长会议未能就一体化的进度达成共识。

sentences.english: the current consensus of opinion
sentences.chinese: 目前观点上的一致

sentences.english: The general consensus was that technology was a good thing.
sentences.chinese: 大家都认为科技是好东西。

sentences.english: the consensus politics of the fifties
sentences.chinese: 50年代的共识政治

detailed_translations.english: an opinion that everyone in a group agrees with or accepts

name: considerable
trans: adj. large in extent or degree 相当大的

sentences.english: Michael has already spent considerable time in Barcelona.
sentences.chinese: 迈克尔在巴塞罗那已经待了相当长的时间了。

sentences.english: issues of considerable importance
sentences.chinese: 相当重要的问题

sentences.english: The series has aroused considerable interest.
sentences.chinese: 这套系列节目引起了观众相当浓厚的兴趣。

detailed_translations.english: fairly large, especially large enough to have an effect or be important

name: consistent
trans: adj. continuing to happen or develop in the same way 始终如一的

sentences.english: We need to be consistent in our approach.
sentences.chinese: 我们在方法上要前后一致。

detailed_translations.english: always behaving in the same way or having the same attitudes, standards etc – usually used to show approval

name: conspicuous
trans: adj. very easy to see or notice 显眼的

sentences.english: The notice must be displayed in a conspicuous place.
sentences.chinese: 通告一定要贴在显眼的地方。

sentences.english: a bird with conspicuous white markings
sentences.chinese: 一种长有醒目白斑的鸟

sentences.english: I felt very conspicuous in my red coat.
sentences.chinese: 我穿着红外套，感觉自己十分显眼。

detailed_translations.english: very easy to notice

name: constitute
trans: v. to make up or form something 形成

sentences.english: We must redefine what constitutes a family.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须对家庭的构成重新定义。

detailed_translations.english: to be the parts that together form sth

name: constrain
trans: v. to limit or restrict 限制
v. to use pressure to force to do something 强迫

sentences.english: Poor soil has constrained the level of crop production.
sentences.chinese: 贫瘠的土地限制了农作物的产量。

sentences.english: Women’s employment opportunities are often severely constrained by family commitments.
sentences.chinese: 女性的就业机会常常受到家庭责任的严重限制。

detailed_translations.english: to limit something

name: construe
trans: v. to understand in a particular way 诠释，分析

sentences.english: What may seem helpful behaviour to you can be construed as interference by others.
sentences.chinese: 在你看来似乎有助益的行为会被他人看作干涉。

sentences.english: He may construe the approach as a hostile act.
sentences.chinese: 他可能把这种方法理解为一种不友善的行为。

detailed_translations.english: If something is construed in a particular way, its nature or meaning is interpreted in that way

name: consummate
trans: adj. complete in every detail 完美的

sentences.english: Factory with consummate skill, good reputation, good service, won the praise and trust of our customers, business across the country.
sentences.chinese: 本厂以精湛的技艺、良好的信誉、周到的服务，深得广大客户的好评和信赖，业务遍布全国各地。 %。

sentences.english: Combining with its practice, this article draws lessons from the experiences of Japanese examinational committee, and brings out some suggestions to consummate the system.
sentences.chinese: 本文结合人民监督员制度运行的实践，借鉴日本检察审查会制度的经验，就完善人民监督员制度提出构想。

detailed_translations.english: to make something complete, especially an agreement

name: consumption
trans: n. the use of something 消耗
n. the utilization of economic goods in the satisfaction of wants or in the process of production resulting chiefly in their destruction, deterioration, or transformation 消费

sentences.english: Vigorous exercise increases oxygen consumption.
sentences.chinese: 剧烈运动增加氧的消耗。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of energy, oil, electricity etc that is used

name: contagious
trans: adj. having a sickness that can be passed to someone else by touching 接触传染的
adj. capable of being easily spread to others 有感染力的

sentences.english: her contagious enthusiasm
sentences.chinese: 她那富有感染力的热情

detailed_translations.english: if a feeling, attitude, or action is contagious, other people are quickly affected by it and begin to have it or do it

name: contemplate
trans: v. to think deeply or carefully about 深入思考

sentences.english: He had even contemplated suicide.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至想过自杀。

sentences.english: Jack went on vacation to contemplate his future.
sentences.chinese: 杰克去度假，仔细思考一下他的未来。

sentences.english: He contemplated her with a faint smile.
sentences.chinese: 他微微含笑注视着她。

detailed_translations.chinese: 考虑；深思；细想；注视，凝视
detailed_translations.english: to think about something that you might do in the future

name: contemptuous
trans: adj. feeling or showing deep hatred or disapproval 轻蔑的

sentences.english: a contemptuous glance
sentences.chinese: 轻蔑的一瞥
