detailed_translations.english: showing that you think someone or something deserves no respect

name: contented
trans: adj. happy and satisfied 满足的

sentences.english: I felt warm, cosy, and contented.
sentences.chinese: 我感到暖和、舒适和满意。

sentences.english: They lapsed into a contented silence.
sentences.chinese: 他们沉默不语，沉浸在幸福之中。

detailed_translations.english: happy and satisfied because your life is good

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…满足；使…安心（content的过去式和过去分词）

name: contentious
trans: adj. likely to cause people to argue or disagree 引起争议的
adj. likely or willing to argue 好争议的

sentences.english: Sanctions are expected to be among the most contentious issues.
sentences.chinese: 制裁预计位居最具有争议的问题之列。

detailed_translations.chinese: 诉讼的；有异议的，引起争论的；爱争论的
detailed_translations.english: causing a lot of argument and disagreement between people

name: contingent
trans: adj. depending on something else that might or might not happen 取决于

sentences.english: Has the Scottish contingent arrived yet?
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰代表团到了没有？

detailed_translations.chinese: 因情况而异的；不一定的；偶然发生的；可能的；依情况而定的；偶然的；[逻]有条件的
detailed_translations.english: depending on something that may happen in the future

detailed_translations.chinese: 分遣队；偶然事件；分得部分；代表团
detailed_translations.english: a group of people who all have something in common, such as their nationality, beliefs etc, and who are part of a larger group

name: contract
trans: v. to become smaller 收缩
n. a legal agreement between people, companies, etc. 合同
v. to become affected with 感染

sentences.english: Employees who refuse to relocate are in breach of contract (= have done something not allowed by their contracts ) .
sentences.chinese: 员工拒绝调动岗位是违反合约的。

detailed_translations.english: an official agreement between two or more people, stating what each will do

name: contradictory
trans: adj. involving or having information that disagrees with other information
矛盾的

sentences.english: Customs officials have made a series of contradictory statements about the equipment.
sentences.chinese: 海关官员们对于这种设备做出了一系列相互矛盾的陈述。

detailed_translations.chinese: 矛盾的；反对的；反驳的；抗辩的
detailed_translations.english: two statements, beliefs etc that are contradictory are different and therefore cannot both be true or correct

name: contravene
trans: v. to fail to do what is required by 触犯

sentences.english: Some portions of the bill may contravene state law.
sentences.chinese: 这项议案中的一些部分可能与州法律相抵触。

detailed_translations.english: to do something that is not allowed according to a law or rule

name: controversial
trans: adj. relating to or causing much discussion, disagreement, or argument
有争议的

sentences.english: the controversial issue of welfare reform
sentences.chinese: 福利改革这一有争议的话题

sentences.english: a highly controversial (= very controversial ) plan to flood the valley in order to build a dam
sentences.chinese: 一个把山谷淹掉来建造水坝的极具争议的计划

sentences.english: He is a controversial figure (= person who does controversial things ) in the art world.
sentences.chinese: 他是艺术界极具争议的人物。

detailed_translations.english: causing a lot of disagreement, because many people have strong opinions about the subject being discussed

name: conundrum
trans: n. a confusing or difficult problem 复杂难解的问题

sentences.english: the conundrum of our purpose on Earth
sentences.chinese: 我们为何目的活在世上这一难题

detailed_translations.english: a confusing and difficult problem

name: convoluted
trans: adj. very complicated and difficult to understand 复杂难解的

sentences.english: long paragraphs and convoluted sentences
sentences.chinese: 冗长的段落和费解的句子

sentences.english: The argument is rather convoluted.
sentences.chinese: 这一论点令人颇为费解。

detailed_translations.english: complicated and difficult to understand

name: convulsion
trans: n. a sudden change or disturbance that affects a country, organization, etc. 动乱

name: cooperate
trans: v. to associate with another or others for mutual benefit 合作

sentences.english: They agreed to co-operate with Brazil on a programme to protect the rain forests.
sentences.chinese: 他们同意和巴西合作进行一个保护热带雨林的项目。

sentences.english: I advised my client to cooperate fully with the police.
sentences.chinese: 我建议我的当事人要全力与警方配合。

detailed_translations.english: to work with someone else to achieve something that you both want

name: corroborate
trans: v. to support with evidence or authority 证实

sentences.english: We now have new evidence to corroborate the defendant’s story.
sentences.chinese: 我们现在有新的证据来证实被告人的说法。

sentences.english: Experiments elsewhere corroborate these results.
sentences.chinese: 其他地方的试验也证实了这些结果。

detailed_translations.english: to provide information that supports or helps to prove someone else’s statement, idea etc

name: corrupt
trans: v. to cause to become dishonest, immoral, etc. 使...败坏
adj. doing things that are dishonest or illegal in order to make money or to gain or keep power 贪污的

sentences.english: Young prisoners are being corrupted by the older, long-term offenders.
sentences.chinese: 年轻的囚犯正在被年纪较大、刑期长的犯人带坏。

sentences.english: Corrupt judges have taken millions of dollars in bribes.
sentences.chinese: 腐败的法官接受了几百万美元的贿赂。

detailed_translations.english: to encourage someone to start behaving in an immoral or dishonest way
using your power in a dishonest or illegal way in order to get an advantage for yourself

name: counterforce
trans: n. a contrary or opposing force 反作用力

name: counterintuitive
trans: adj. not agreeing with what seems right or natural 违反直觉的

name: counterpart
trans: n. someone or something that has the same job or purpose as another
对应的人或物

sentences.english: As soon as he heard what was afoot, he telephoned his German and Italian counterparts to protest.
sentences.chinese: 他一听到在进行中的事，马上就给德国和意大利相应人员打电话抗议。

detailed_translations.chinese: 副本；配对物；极相似的人或物
detailed_translations.english: Someone's or something's counterpart is another person or thing that has a similar function or position in a different place

name: counterproductive
trans: adj. tending to hinder the attainment of a desired goal 事与愿违的

sentences.english: In practice, however, such an attitude is counterproductive.
sentences.chinese: 然而在实际中，这种态度会适得其反。

detailed_translations.chinese: 反生产的；使达不到预期目标的
detailed_translations.english: Something that is counterproductive achieves the opposite result from the one that you want to achieve

name: courteous
trans: adj. very polite in a way that shows respect 有礼貌的

sentences.english: The staff are always courteous and helpful.
sentences.chinese: 员工们总是彬彬有礼、乐于帮助。

sentences.english: a courteous reply
sentences.chinese: 恭敬有礼的回答

detailed_translations.english: polite and showing respect for other people

name: covert
trans: adj. made, shown, or done in a way that is not easily seen or notices 秘密的

sentences.english: covert operations
sentences.chinese: 秘密行动

detailed_translations.chinese: 隐藏处；树丛；蔽覆羽翮基部的羽毛
detailed_translations.english: a group of thick bushes where animals can hide

detailed_translations.chinese: 隐蔽的；隐密的；偷偷摸摸的；在丈夫保护下的
detailed_translations.english: secret or hidden

name: covet
trans: v. to want very much 贪求

sentences.english: The Michelin Awards are coveted by restaurants all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 米其林评级是全世界所有餐厅的渴望。

detailed_translations.english: to have a very strong desire to have something that someone else has

name: cower
trans: v. to shrink away or crouch 畏缩

sentences.english: The hostages cowered in their seats.
sentences.chinese: 这些人质蜷缩在其座位上。

detailed_translations.chinese: 退缩；抖缩；蜷缩；弯腰屈膝
detailed_translations.english: to bend low and move back because you are frightened

name: crab
trans: v. to complain about peevishly 抱怨

sentences.english: crab meat
sentences.chinese: 蟹肉

detailed_translations.english: a sea animal with a hard shell, five legs on each side, and two large claws
to hunt or catch crabs

name: craft
trans: n. skill in planning, making, or executing 工艺，手艺

sentences.english: traditional rural crafts
sentences.chinese: 传统的乡村手工艺

sentences.english: arts and crafts
sentences.chinese: 手工艺

detailed_translations.english: a job or activity in which you make things with your hands, and that you usually need skill to do
to make something using a special skill, especially with your hands

name: crass
trans: adj. having or showing no understanding of what is proper or acceptable 愚钝的

sentences.english: a crass remark
sentences.chinese: 粗鲁的言语

sentences.english: an act of crass stupidity
sentences.chinese: 愚蠢的行为

detailed_translations.english: behaving in a stupid and offensive way which shows that you do not understand or care about other people’s feelings

name: credit
trans: n. a record of how well you have paid your bills in the past 信用
v. to give honor or recognition to for doing something or for making something happen 赞扬

sentences.english: We found his statement hard to credit.
sentences.chinese: 我们觉得他的说法令人难以信服。

sentences.english: The witness’s story gained credit with the jury.
sentences.chinese: 证人的陈述被陪审团采信了。

detailed_translations.english: to believe that something is true
the belief that something is true or correct

name: credulous
trans: adj. too ready to believe things 轻信的

sentences.english: Quinn charmed credulous investors out of millions of dollars.
sentences.chinese: 奎因花言巧语从轻信的投资者那里骗取了数百万美元。

detailed_translations.chinese: 轻信的；因轻信而产生的
detailed_translations.english: always believing what you are told, and therefore easily deceived

name: crestfallen
trans: adj. very sad and disappointed 不高兴的

sentences.english: He came back looking crestfallen .
sentences.chinese: 他回来时看上去垂头丧气的。

detailed_translations.english: looking disappointed and upset

name: crumble
trans: v. to break into small pieces 崩溃，破碎

sentences.english: The fall leaves crumbled in my fingers.
sentences.chinese: 秋叶在我指间碎裂了。

sentences.english: 1/4 cup crumbled goat’s cheese
sentences.chinese: 四分之一杯山羊奶酪碎

detailed_translations.english: to break apart into lots of little pieces, or make something do this

name: cryptic
trans: adj. difficult to understand 难解的

sentences.english: This thrilling story will keep you on the edge of your seat as you explore the house, collect items and unravel cryptic secrets.
sentences.chinese: 这惊心动魄的故事，将让你在你的座位边，为您探索的房子，收集物品和解开神秘的秘密。

sentences.english: It was the cryptic first sign of a cyberespionage and information-warfare campaign devised to disrupt the 2016 presidential election, the first such attempt by a foreign power in American history.
sentences.chinese: 这是一场网络间谍—信息战行动的第一个神秘迹象，该行动旨在干扰2016年的总统大选，在美国的历史上，这还是第一次有外国势力有这样的举动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 神秘的； 含义模糊的
detailed_translations.english: having a meaning that is mysterious or not easily understood

name: cumbersome
trans: adj. hard to handle or manage because of size or weight 笨重的
adj. complicated and hard to do 复杂难做的

sentences.english: Doctors are complaining that the system is cumbersome and bureaucratic.
sentences.chinese: 医生抱怨说该体制复杂繁琐，很官僚。

sentences.english: cumbersome procedures
sentences.chinese: 繁琐的程序

detailed_translations.chinese: 笨重的；累赘的；难处理的
detailed_translations.english: a process or system that is cumbersome is slow and difficult

name: cunning
trans: adj. getting what is wanted in a clever and often deceptive way 狡猾的

sentences.english: a cunning opponent
sentences.chinese: 狡猾的对手

detailed_translations.english: someone who is cunning is clever and good at deceiving people in order to get what they want
the ability to achieve what you want by deceiving people in a clever way

name: cure-all
trans: n. a cure or solution for any illness or problem 万灵药

name: cursory
trans: adj. done or made quickly 草率的

sentences.english: Burke cast a cursory glance at the menu, then flapped it shut.
sentences.chinese: 伯克粗略瞥了眼菜单，然后啪地合上了。

detailed_translations.english: done very quickly without much attention to details

name: curt
trans: adj. sparing of words 话少的
adj. marked by rude or peremptory shortness 唐突无礼的

sentences.english: With a curt nod, he turned away and sat down.
sentences.chinese: 他简慢地点点头就转身坐下了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 简略的；简要的；草率的；简单粗暴的
(Curt)人名；(法)屈尔；(英)柯特；(德、西、芬、罗、瑞典)库尔特

name: curtail
trans: v. to reduce or limit 缩减

sentences.english: The new law will curtail police powers.
sentences.chinese: 这条新法规将削弱警方的权力。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce or limit something

name: damp
trans: v. to make less strong or active 使减弱

sentences.english: Damp had stained the walls.
sentences.chinese: 墙上留下了潮湿的痕迹。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使潮湿；使阻尼；使沮丧，抑制
detailed_translations.english: to dampen something
water in walls or in the air that causes things to be slightly wet
slightly wet, often in an unpleasant way

name: darken
trans: v. to make dark or to become dark or darker in color 使变暗
v. to make less happy or to become less happy 使忧郁

sentences.english: The sky darkened and a few drops of rain fell.
sentences.chinese: 天色变暗，落下几滴雨来。

sentences.english: a darkened theater
sentences.chinese: 变暗了的剧院

sentences.english: The evening shadows darkened the room.
sentences.chinese: 夜幕使房间暗了下来。

detailed_translations.english: to become dark, or to make something dark

name: dated
trans: adj. coming from or belonging to a time in the past 陈旧的

sentences.english: That dress looks a bit dated now.
sentences.chinese: 那件连衣裙现在看起来有点过时了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 陈旧的；过时的；有日期的
detailed_translations.english: old-fashioned

detailed_translations.chinese: 注有日期（date的过去式和过去分词）

name: daunting
trans: adj. tending to make people afraid or less confident 使人畏惧的

name: dearth
trans: n. the state or condition of not having enough of something 缺乏

sentences.english: EXCEPT as Pearl, in the dearth of human playmates, was thrown more upon the visionary throng which she created.
sentences.chinese: 只不过是由于缺乏玩伴，她同自己创造出来的幻想中的人群更加接近而己。

sentences.english: So for now, this dearth of data means that scientists must rely on climate models to estimate the effects of large-scale burning by aborigines.
sentences.chinese: 所以现在数据的缺乏也就意味着科学家必须依靠气候模型来估计土著大规模焚烧对于气候的影响。

sentences.english: See there is no dearth of knowledge and entrepreneurial skills in we Indians. The only question is that shall we be considered while opting for technology from abroad?
sentences.chinese: 看到没有，我们印度人并不缺乏知识与创业技能。唯一的问题在于我们在追求外国技术的同时有没有考虑去挖掘自身的能力。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which there are very few of something that people want or need

name: debacle
trans: n. a great disaster or complete failure 彻底失败

sentences.english: the debacle of the 1994 elections
sentences.chinese: 1994年大选的惨败

detailed_translations.english: an event or situation that is a complete failure

name: debase
trans: v. to lower the value or reputation of 贬低

sentences.english: The medical profession has been debased by these revelations.
sentences.chinese: 这些事被披露后，医学界的声誉受到了损害。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone or something lose its value or people’s respect

name: debunk
trans: v. to show that something is not true 揭露…为假

sentences.english: Historian Michael Beschloss debunks a few myths.
sentences.chinese: 历史学家迈克尔·贝斯切罗斯揭露了一些神话的真相。

detailed_translations.english: If you debunk a widely held belief, you show that it is false. If you debunk something that is widely admired, you show that it is not as good as people think it is.

name: decay
trans: n. the process or result of being slowly destroyed by natural precesses
腐朽

sentences.english: Her body was already starting to decay.
sentences.chinese: 她的尸体已经开始腐烂。

sentences.english: Most archaeological finds are broken, damaged, or decayed.
sentences.chinese: 大部分考古发现物都已破裂、损坏或腐烂。

sentences.english: decaying organic matter
sentences.chinese: 腐烂的有机物

sentences.english: In Orthodox Europe, mass religion seems to have decayed less.
sentences.chinese: 在正教会流行的欧洲地区，集体宗教信仰的影响力似乎衰退得没那么严重。

sentences.english: tooth decay
sentences.chinese: 蛀牙

detailed_translations.english: to be slowly destroyed by a natural chemical process, or to make something do this
the natural chemical change that causes the slow destruction of something

name: decisive
trans: adj. resolute, determined 果断的
adj. unmistakable, unquestionable 毋庸置疑的

sentences.english: a decisive factor/victory/battle
sentences.chinese: 决定性的因素 / 胜利 / 战役

sentences.english: a decisive leader
sentences.chinese: 果断的领袖

detailed_translations.english: very important for the final result of a particular situation

name: decline
trans: v. to become worse in condition or quality 衰落
v. to say that you will not or cannot do something 拒绝

sentences.english: Offered the position of chairman, Smith declined, preferring to keep his current job.
sentences.chinese: 对担任主席的邀约，史密斯拒绝了，他宁愿留在现在的职位上。

sentences.english: Mary declined a hot drink and went to her room.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽谢绝了热饮料，到自己的房间去了。

sentences.english: The minister declined to comment (= refused to speak to people who report the news ) about the progress of the peace talks.
sentences.chinese: 部长拒绝就和谈进程发表评论。

detailed_translations.english: to say no politely when someone invites you somewhere, offers you something, or wants you to do something

name: decouple
trans: v. to eliminate the interrelationship of 使...没有联系

name: decrepitude
trans: n. the state of being old and in bad condition or poor health 衰老，老朽

name: decry
trans: v. to say publicly and forcefully that you regard as bad, wrong, etc. 公开谴责

sentences.english: It may be tempting for some to decry incentives as nothing but a poisonous fruit of Con-Lib responsibility thinking.
sentences.chinese: 对一些人谴责激励机制只是作为“新政治”责任思考的毒果这样的结论本身是很冒险的。

sentences.english: I know ‘tis the season to decry all things materialistic, but just as we’re inspired by people we are also inspired by things.
sentences.chinese: 我想这是谴责所有事情物质化的时候了，然而正如我们被人所激励一样，我们也受事物的激励。

sentences.english: All of that is grist for the mill for the Russian media, which is popular in the east of the country and uses every opportunity to decry "fascism" in Ukraine.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些都像谷物被放进研磨机中一样，被俄国媒体粉碎，后者在这个国家的东部地区广受欢迎，并利用一切机会谴责乌克兰国内的“法西斯主义”。

detailed_translations.english: to state publicly that you do not approve of something

name: defame
trans: v. to hurt the reputation of especially by saying things that are false or unfair 诽谤

sentences.english: Sgt. Norwood complained that the article defamed him.
sentences.chinese: 诺维德中士抱怨这篇文章诽谤他。

detailed_translations.english: to write or say bad or untrue things about someone or something, so that people will have a bad opinion of them

name: defect
trans: n. an imperfection that impairs worth or utility 缺陷

sentences.english: All the cars are tested for defects before they leave the factory.
sentences.chinese: 所有汽车在出厂前都经过品质检验。

sentences.english: a genetic defect
sentences.chinese: 遗传缺陷

detailed_translations.english: a fault or a lack of something that means that something or someone is not perfect
to leave your own country or group in order to go to or join an opposing one

name: defend
trans: v. to drive danger or attack away from 保护
v. to maintain or support in the face of argument or hostile criticism
为…争辩

sentences.english: She was always defending her husband in front of their daughter.
sentences.chinese: 她在女儿面前总是为丈夫辩解。

sentences.english: Students should be ready to explain and defend their views.
sentences.chinese: 学生应该勇于为自己的观点进行解释和辩护。

detailed_translations.english: to use arguments to protect something or someone from criticism, or to prove that something is right

name: deferential
trans: adj. showing or expressing deference 恭敬的

sentences.english: They like five-star hotels and deferential treatment.
sentences.chinese: 他们喜欢五星级酒店和谦恭的礼遇。

detailed_translations.english: Someone who is deferential is polite and respectful toward someone else

name: defiant
trans: adj. refusing to obey something or someone 蔑视的，挑战的

sentences.english: The players are in a defiant mood as they prepare for tomorrow's game.
sentences.chinese: 在准备明天的比赛时，球员们态度挑衅。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑衅的；目中无人的，蔑视的；挑战的
detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone is defiant, you mean they show aggression or independence by refusing to obey someone

name: defining
trans: adj. 起决定性作用的

name: definite
trans: adj. said or done in such a way that others know exactly what you mean 明确的
adj. not likely to change 不能更改的

sentences.english: It’s impossible for me to give you a definite answer.
sentences.chinese: 我不可能给你明确的答复。

sentences.english: We need to record sufficient data to enable definite conclusions to be reached.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要记录足够的数据，才能得出明确的结论。

sentences.english: He’d shown definite signs of resigning himself to the situation.
sentences.chinese: 他明显表现出安于这种状况的样子。

sentences.english: Fix a definite date for the delivery of your computer.
sentences.chinese: 请为你的电脑定个确切的交货日期。

detailed_translations.english: clearly known, seen, or stated

name: deflate
trans: v. to reduce or cause to contract 使减少

sentences.english: She was deflated when Fen made no comment on her achievement.
sentences.chinese: 芬对她的成就没作任何评论，她很泄气。

detailed_translations.chinese: 放气；使缩小；紧缩通货；打击；使泄气
detailed_translations.english: if a tyre,  balloon  etc deflates, or if you deflate it, it gets smaller because the gas inside it comes out

name: deflect
trans: v. to cause to change direction 使转向

sentences.english: He deflected the blow with his forearm.
sentences.chinese: 他用前臂挡开了打来的一拳。

detailed_translations.english: if someone or something deflects something that is moving, or if it deflects, it turns in a different direction

name: deft
trans: adj. skillful and clever 灵巧的

sentences.english: He sketched her with quick, deft strokes.
sentences.chinese: 他给她画素描，下笔又快又熟练。

sentences.english: deft footwork
sentences.chinese: 敏捷的步法

detailed_translations.chinese: 灵巧的；机敏的；敏捷熟练的
detailed_translations.english: a deft movement is skilful, and often quick

name: defy
trans: v. to confront with assured power of resistance 蔑视

sentences.english: This was the first (and last) time that I dared to defy my mother.
sentences.chinese: 这是我第一次（也是最后一次）胆敢违抗我母亲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 藐视；公然反抗；挑衅；使落空
detailed_translations.english: If you defy someone or something that is trying to make you behave in a particular way, you refuse to obey them and behave in that way

name: degenerative
trans: adj. causing the body or part of the body to become weaker or less able to function as time passes 退化的

sentences.english: ...degenerative diseases of the brain, like Alzheimer's.
sentences.chinese: ... 大脑退化的疾病，就像老年痴呆症一样。

detailed_translations.chinese: 衰退的， 堕落的； 变性的
detailed_translations.english: a degenerative illness gradually gets worse and cannot be stopped

name: degrade
trans: v. to lower in grade, rank, or status 贬低
v. to make the quality of worse 恶化
v. to wear down by erosion 腐蚀

sentences.english: a movie that degrades women
sentences.chinese: 贬损女性的影片

sentences.english: How can you degrade yourself by writing such trash?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么能写这种垃圾作品来自贬身份呢？

detailed_translations.english: to treat someone without respect and make them lose respect for themselves

name: deify
trans: v. to treat like a god or goddess 神化

sentences.english: Valentino was virtually deified by legions of female fans.
sentences.chinese: 华伦天奴实际上被女性粉丝团神化了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…奉若神明；把…神化；崇拜
detailed_translations.english: to treat someone or something with extreme respect and admiration

name: delegate
trans: v. to give (control, responsibility, authority, etc.) to someone     托

sentences.english: Around 350 delegates attended the conference.
sentences.chinese: 大约有350名代表参加了大会。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has been elected or chosen to speak, vote, or take decisions for a group

detailed_translations.chinese: 委派…为代表； 授 ， 把…委托给
detailed_translations.english: to choose someone to do a particular job, or to be a representative of a group, organization etc

name: deleterious
trans: adj. damaging or harmful 有害的，有毒的

sentences.english: the deleterious effects of smoking
sentences.chinese: 吸烟的害处

detailed_translations.english: damaging or harmful

name: deliberate
trans: v. to think about or discuss something very carefully in order to make a decision 深思熟虑
adj. done or said in a way that is planned or intended 故意的
adj. done or decided after careful thought 谨慎的

sentences.english: a deliberate attempt to humiliate her
sentences.chinese: 对她的故意羞辱

sentences.english: The attack on him was quite deliberate.
sentences.chinese: 对他的袭击完全是有预谋的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 故意的， 蓄意的； 慎重的， 深思熟虑的
detailed_translations.english: intended or planned
to think about something very carefully

name: delight
trans: n. a strong feeling of happiness 高兴
v. to make very happy 使高兴

sentences.english: The kids were screaming with delight.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们在高兴地尖叫。

sentences.english: He is delighting audiences with his wit and humour.
sentences.chinese: 他在用自己的智慧和幽默娱乐观众。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of great pleasure and satisfaction
to give someone great satisfaction and enjoyment

name: demanding
trans: adj. requiring much time, effort, or attention 苛求的

sentences.english: a demanding job
sentences.chinese: 高要求的工作

detailed_translations.chinese: 苛求的；要求高的；吃力的
detailed_translations.english: needing a lot of ability, effort, or skill

name: demarcation
trans: n. the establishment of boundaries or limits separating two areas, groups, or things 界限

name: demise
trans: n. the end of something that is thought of as being like a death 终止，死亡

sentences.english: the mystery surrounding Elena’s untimely demise
sentences.chinese: 埃琳娜猝然早逝之谜

detailed_translations.english: the end of something that used to exist

name: demur
trans: v. to disagree politely with another person’s statement or suggestion 表示反对

sentences.english: They demurred politely, but finally agreed to stay.
sentences.chinese: 他们礼貌地推却，但最后还是同意留下。

detailed_translations.english: to express doubt about or opposition to a plan or suggestion
disagreement or disapproval

name: denounce
trans: v. to publicly state that someone or something is bad or wrong 谴责

sentences.english: The group denounced the failure by the authorities to take action.
sentences.chinese: 该团体谴责当局没有采取行动。

sentences.english: She denounced him to the police.
sentences.chinese: 她向警方告发了他。

detailed_translations.english: to express strong disapproval of someone or something, especially in public

name: deplete
trans: v. to empty of a principal substance 耗尽

sentences.english: ...substances that deplete the ozone layer.
sentences.chinese: …消耗臭氧层的物质。

detailed_translations.chinese: 耗尽，用尽；使衰竭，使空虚
detailed_translations.english: To deplete a stock or amount of something means to reduce it

name: deplorable
trans: adj. lamentable 可悲的
adj. deserving censure or contempt 应受谴责的

sentences.english: The prisoners were held in deplorable conditions .
sentences.chinese: 囚犯被关押在极其恶劣的环境里。

sentences.english: His conduct was deplorable.

name: deprecatory

name: depressing

sentences.english: It’s a depressing thought.
sentences.chinese: 这是个令人沮丧的想法。

sentences.english: The whole experience was very depressing.
sentences.chinese: 整个经历非常令人沮丧。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel very sad

trans: v. to laugh at or insult contemptuously 鄙视

sentences.english: You shouldn’t deride their efforts.
sentences.chinese: 你不应该嘲笑他们的努力。

detailed_translations.english: to make remarks or jokes that show you think someone or something is silly or useless

trans: n. the feeling that people express when they criticize and laugh at someone or something in an insulting way 嘲笑

sentences.english: His speech was greeted with derision by opposition leaders.
sentences.chinese: 他的演讲遭到反对党领袖的讥笑。

name: derivative
trans: adj. not new or original 非原创的

sentences.english: the derivatives market
sentences.chinese: 金融衍生品市场

detailed_translations.chinese: [化学] 衍生物，派生物；导数
detailed_translations.english: something that has developed or been produced from something else

name: derive from
trans: phrase. to take, receive, or obtain especially from a specific source 源于

name: design
trans: n. deliberate purposive planning 故意
n. the process of planning how something will look, happen, be made
设计

sentences.english: The tower was designed by Gilbert Scott.
sentences.chinese: 这座塔楼是吉尔伯特·斯科特设计的。

name: despair
trans: v. to no longer have any hope or belief that a situation will improve or change 绝望

sentences.chinese: 令工人们感到绝望的是，公司宣布关闭工厂了。

sentences.chinese: 尽管疾病缠身，罗恩却从不绝望。

to feel that there is no hope at all

name: destructive
trans: adj. causing a very large amount of damage 破坏的

detailed_translations.english: causing damage to people or things

name: detached
trans: adj. not influenced by emotions or personal interest 公正客观的

sentences.chinese: 他想尽力保持对囚犯们不掺杂个人感情，却做不到。

name: detect
trans: v. to discover or notice the presence of 发现

sentences.chinese: 如果发现得早，许多种癌症都可以治愈。

sentences.english: ...a sensitive piece of equipment used to detect radiation.
sentences.chinese: …一台探测辐射的敏感仪器。

detailed_translations.english: to notice or discover something, especially something that is not easy to see, hear etc

name: deter
trans: v. to prevent from happening 阻止
v. to cause to decide not to do something 威慑

trans: n. the act or process of becoming worse 恶化

sentences.chinese: 但潜在的通胀压力仍是非常微弱，特别是考虑到迅速而持续恶化的就业市场，这种状况很可能会持续下去。

name: detestation
trans: n. extreme hatred or dislike 憎恶

name: detract
trans: v. to speak ill of 贬低
v. to take away 减损

sentences.chinese: 他们担心围绕他的宣传会有损他们自已的竞选活动。

name: detrimental
trans: adj. causing damage or injury 有害的

sentences.english: the detrimental effect of pollution on the environment

sentences.chinese: 迂回的路线

name: dexterous
trans: adj. having or showing great skills or cleverness 机敏的

sentences.chinese: 灵巧的针法

sentences.chinese: 该书是对学术左派的抨击。

detailed_translations.english: a long speech or piece of writing that criticizes someone or something very severely

name: dichotomous
trans: adj. dividing into two parts 二分的
adj. relating to, involving, or proceeding from dichotomy 矛盾的

trans: adj. designed or intended to teach people something 说教的

sentences.english: His novel has a didactic tone.
sentences.chinese: 他的小说有一种道德说教的口吻。

trans: adj. lacking confidence 缺乏自信的
adj. very careful about acting or speaking 言行谨慎的

sentences.chinese: 约翰活泼、热情；而海伦却羞怯、矜持。

detailed_translations.chinese: 羞怯的；缺乏自信的；谦虚谨慎的
detailed_translations.english: shy and not wanting to make people notice you or talk about you

name: diffuse
trans: adj. spread out over a large space 分散的
adj. to spread out 传播
adj. being at once verbose and ill-organized 话多的

sentences.english: The pollutants diffuse into the soil.
sentences.chinese: 污染物渗进了土壤。

sentences.english: Their ideas diffused quickly across Europe.
sentences.chinese: 他们的观点很快在欧洲传播开来。

sentences.english: His writing is diffuse and difficult to understand.
sentences.chinese: 他写的东西冗长难懂。

using a lot of words and not explaining things clearly and directly

name: dilatory
trans: adj. characterized by procrastination 拖延的

sentences.english: You might expect politicians to smooth things out when civil servants are being dilatory.
sentences.chinese: 当公务员办事拖拉时，你可能期望政治家们能够把事情顺利解决。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拖拉的；缓慢的，不慌不忙的
detailed_translations.english: slow in doing something

name: dilemma
trans: n. a situation in which you have to make a difficult choice 困境

sentences.chinese: 道德上进退两难的窘境

sentences.english: This placed Robert Kennedy in a dilemma.
sentences.chinese: 这让罗伯特·肯尼迪陷入了两难的境地。

sentences.english: Many women are faced with the dilemma of choosing between work and family commitments.
sentences.chinese: 许多女性面临着出去工作还是照顾家庭的两难境地。

trans: adj. characterized by steady, earnest, and energetic effort 勤奋的

sentences.chinese: 勤勉的学生

sentences.english: in the dim light of the early dawn
sentences.chinese: 在微弱的晨曦里

sentences.english: a dim glow
sentences.chinese: 昏暗的微光

sentences.english: I could see a dim shape in the doorway.
sentences.chinese: 我模模糊糊看见门口有个人影。

trans: v. to make less or cause to appear less 减少

sentences.chinese: 支持这个政党的选民比例持续下降。

detailed_translations.english: to become or make something become smaller or less

detailed_translations.chinese: 减少， 减小， 降低
detailed_translations.english: to become or make something become smaller or less

name: diminutive
trans: adj. very small 极小的

sentences.chinese: 一个腼腆的矮个子男人

detailed_translations.english: a word formed by adding a diminutive suffix

sentences.chinese: 对严重后果的警告，尽管这些后果常常不会出现

sentences.english: Lily: : But the interviewers don't think so, they discredit the unmarried women above the normal age have mentality defects, although they are turly bright people.
sentences.chinese: 但是面试官却认为年龄这么大了还没结婚也没男朋友，怀疑她们有心理缺陷，尽管她们确实是人才。 。

sentences.chinese: 法庭的酌情决定权

name: disenchant

sentences.english: she is disenchanted with the marriage

detailed_translations.english: to make disappointed or disillusioned

name: disgorge

name: disinclination

sentences.chinese: 农场工人的子女越来越不愿意务农的趋势

detailed_translations.english: a lack of willingness to do something

name: disinformation

trans: adj. not truly honest or sincere 不真诚的

sentences.english: Keeping the details of the tax changes vague is disingenuous.
sentences.chinese: 对税收变革的细节含糊其词并不光明正大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 虚伪的；不诚实的；不老实的；狡猾的

trans: v. to break apart into many small parts or pieces 瓦解

sentences.chinese: 飞机就在半空中解体了。

name: disinterested
trans: adj. not influenced by personal feelings, opinions, or concerns 公正的
adj. not interested 没有兴趣的

sentences.english: A lawyer should provide disinterested advice.
sentences.chinese: 律师应该提供客观公正的建议。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无私的；公正的；冷漠的；廉洁的
detailed_translations.english: able to judge a situation fairly because you are not concerned with gaining any personal advantage from it

detailed_translations.chinese: 使不再有利害关系；使无兴趣（disinterest的过去分词）

name: dismantle
trans: v. to take apart so that it is in separate pieces 拆除

sentences.english: He asked for immediate help from the United States to dismantle the warheads.
sentences.chinese: 他向美国请求即时援助，拆除弹头。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拆除；取消；解散；除掉…的覆盖物
detailed_translations.english: If you dismantle a machine or structure, you carefully separate it into its different parts

name: dismiss
trans: v. to decide not to think about or consider 不考虑
v. to permit or cause to leave 清除
v. to remove from position or service 解雇
v. to reject serious consideration of 驳回

sentences.english: He just laughed and dismissed my proposal as unrealistic.
sentences.chinese: 他只是笑了笑，认为我的建议不切实际，拒绝考虑。

sentences.english: Bryant was unfairly dismissed from his post.
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩特被无理免职了。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to consider someone’s idea, opinion etc, because you think it is not serious, true, or important

name: disorganize
trans: v. to destroy or interrupt the orderly structure or function of 扰乱

name: disparage
trans: v. to describe as unimportant, weak, bad, etc. 贬低

sentences.english: ...Larkin's tendency to disparage literature.
sentences.chinese: …拉金诋毁文学的倾向。

detailed_translations.english: If you disparage someone or something, you speak about them in a way which shows that you do not have a good opinion of them

name: disparate
trans: adj. different from each other 不同的

sentences.english: a meeting covering many disparate subjects
sentences.chinese: 涉及许多不同议题的会议

sentences.english: the difficulties of dealing with disparate groups of people

detailed_translations.chinese: 不同的；不相干的；全异的
detailed_translations.english: consisting of things or people that are very different and not related to each other

name: dispassionate
trans: adj. not affected by personal or emotional involvement 公正客观的，冷静客观的

sentences.english: We, as prosecutors, try to be dispassionate about the cases we bring.
sentences.chinese: 我们作为公诉人尽量在经手的案件上不带偏见。

detailed_translations.english: Someone who is dispassionate is calm and reasonable, and not affected by emotions

name: dispatch
trans: v. to send quickly to a particular place for a particular purpose 派遣

sentences.english: Goods are normally dispatched within 24 hours.
sentences.chinese: 货物一般在24小时内派送。

sentences.english: I was carrying dispatches from the ambassador.
sentences.chinese: 我正拿着大使的急件。

name: dispel
trans: v. to make go away or end 消除
v. to drive away by or as if by scattering 驱散

sentences.english: We want to dispel the myth that you cannot eat well in Britain.
sentences.chinese: 我们要消除在英国吃不好的误解。

sentences.english: Light poured into the hall, dispelling the shadows.
sentences.chinese: 阳光洒进大厅，驱散了阴影。

detailed_translations.english: to make something go away, especially a belief, idea, or feeling

name: displace
trans: v. to take the job or position of 取代
v. to force to leave the area where they live 迫使离开

sentences.english: Coal has been displaced by natural gas as a major source of energy.
sentences.chinese: 作为一种主要能源，煤的地位已为天然气所取代。

sentences.english: immigrants who displace US workers in the job market
sentences.chinese: 在就业市场上取代美国工人的移民

detailed_translations.english: to take the place or position of something or someone

name: disproportionate
trans: adj. being out of proportion 不成比例的

sentences.english: the disproportionate amount of money being spent on defence
sentences.chinese: 比例失衡的国防开支

detailed_translations.english: too much or too little in relation to something else

name: dispute
trans: v. to engage in argument 争吵
v. to call into question 质疑

sentences.english: It is beyond dispute that advances in medicine have enabled people to live longer.
sentences.chinese: 医学的发展使人们更加长寿，这是无可置疑的。

sentences.english: What happened next is hotly disputed .
sentences.chinese: 关于后来发生了什么，争论很激烈。

detailed_translations.english: a serious argument or disagreement
to argue or disagree with someone

name: disregard
trans: v. to pay no attention to 忽视
v. to ignore or treat as unimportant 贬低

sentences.english: He ordered the jury to disregard the witness’s last statement.
sentences.chinese: 他指示陪审团忽略证人的最后一句话。

sentences.english: his disregard for her feelings
sentences.chinese: 他对她情感的忽略

detailed_translations.english: to ignore something or treat it as unimportant

name: dissemble
trans: v. to hide your true feelings, opinions, etc. 伪装

sentences.english: Henry was not slow to dissemble when it served his purposes.
sentences.chinese: 形势一对他有利，亨利就马上开始隐瞒。

name: dissimilar
trans: adj. different or unalike 不同的

sentences.english: His methods were not dissimilar to those used by Freud.
sentences.chinese: 他用的方法和弗洛伊德用的没有什么不同。

detailed_translations.english: not the same

sentences.english: Blood vessels in the lungs are filled and distend. Capillary changes have been observed in the animal model of simulated microgravity.
sentences.chinese: 肺血管充盈、扩张，并在模拟微重力动物模型中观察到肺微血管损伤。

sentences.english: The primary role of AM is to distend blood vessel and decrease blood pressure, and it can also restrain the migration of vessel smooth muscle cells.
sentences.chinese: AM在休克发生发展过程的作用主要是扩张血管，降低血压，还具有抑制血管平滑肌细胞迁移等作用。

sentences.english: Conclusion:Nifedipine could distend ophthalmic artery and has similar function on other micro-cerebral vessels.
sentences.chinese: 结论：硝苯地平可扩张眼动脉，对脑部其它小动脉可能有相似作用。

name: distinctive
trans: adj. having a quality or characteristic that makes a person or thing different from others 特别的

sentences.english: a rock band with a distinctive sound
sentences.chinese: 音色独特的摇滚乐队

name: distribution
trans: n. the act of giving or delivering something to people 分配
n. the position, arrangement, or frequency of occurrence over an area or through a space or unit of time 分布

sentences.english: a distribution centre
sentences.chinese: 经销中心

detailed_translations.english: the act of sharing things among a large group of people in a planned way

name: divergent
trans: adj. differing from each other or from a standard 不同的

sentences.english: Two people who have divergent views on this question are George Watt and Bob Marr.
sentences.chinese: 在这个问题上意见相左的两个人是乔治·瓦特和鲍勃·马尔。

detailed_translations.english: Divergent things are different from each other

name: diversity
trans: n. the quality or state of having many different forms, types, ideas, etc.
多样性，差异化

sentences.english: ...the cultural diversity of Latin America.
sentences.chinese: …拉丁美洲文化的多样性。

detailed_translations.english: the fact of including many different types of people or things

name: diverting
trans: adj. providing amusement or entertainment 有趣的

name: divest
trans: v. to deprive or dispossess 剥夺

sentences.english: The company divested itself of its oil interests.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司从石油生意中抽身。

detailed_translations.english: If you divest yourself of something that you own or are responsible for, you get rid of it or stop being responsible for it

name: divided
trans: adj. separated by different opinions 有分歧的

name: divorced
trans: adj. very different and separate from each other 分离的

name: doctrinaire
trans: adj. of, relating to, or characteristic of a person inflexibly attached toa practice or theory 教条主义的

sentences.english: The party followed an increasingly doctrinaire course.
sentences.chinese: 该政党走的是一条越来越教条的路线。

detailed_translations.chinese: 教条主义的；空谈理论的
detailed_translations.english: certain that your beliefs or opinions are correct and unwilling to change them

detailed_translations.chinese: 教条主义者；空论家，纯理论家

name: documentary
trans: adj. consisting of documents: written down 纪实的

sentences.english: One of the most useful sources of documentary evidence is maps.
sentences.chinese: 最有价值的文献证据之一就是地图。

sentences.english: ...a TV documentary on homelessness.
sentences.chinese: …一部关于无家可归现象的电视记录片。

detailed_translations.english: consisting of or written on documents
a film or television or a radio programme that gives detailed information about a particular subject

name: dogmatic
trans: adj. expressing personal opinions or beliefs as if they are certainly correct and cannot be doubted 武断的，教条主义的

sentences.english: Her staff find her bossy and dogmatic.
sentences.chinese: 她的员工认为她爱指挥别人而且自以为是。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is dogmatic is completely certain of their beliefs and expects other people to accept them without arguing

name: doom
trans: n. very bad events or situations that cannot be avoided 厄运
v. to make certain to fail, suffer, die, etc. 使...在劫难逃

sentences.english: A sense of impending doom (= coming very soon ) gripped her.
sentences.chinese: 她心头被一种大难临头的感觉所笼罩。

sentences.english: The plan was doomed from the start.
sentences.chinese: 这个计划一开始就注定要失败。

detailed_translations.english: something very bad that is going to happen, or the fact that it is going to happen
to make someone or something certain to fail, die, be destroyed etc

name: douse
trans: v. extinguish 熄灭

sentences.english: The pumps were started and the crew began to douse the fire with water.
sentences.chinese: 抽水机启动了，船员们开始用水将火浇灭。

detailed_translations.english: to stop a fire from burning by pouring water on it

name: dovish
trans: adj. in favor of using peaceful and diplomatic methods to achieve something, rather than using force and violence 和平主义的

name: downplay
trans: v. to make seem smaller or less important 不予重视

sentences.english: White House officials attempted to downplay the President’s role in the affair.
sentences.chinese: 白宫官员试图为总统在这一事件中的责任开脱。

detailed_translations.english: to make something seem less important than it really is

name: drag
trans: n. someone or something that makes action or progress slower or more difficult 拖累
v. to pull (someone or something that is heavy or difficult to move) 拖拉

sentences.english: He grabbed her arm and dragged her into the room.
sentences.chinese: 他抓住她的手臂把她拖进房间。

sentences.english: He took a drag on his cigarette, and exhaled the smoke.
sentences.chinese: 他咂了口烟，然后吐出烟雾。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拖，拉；迫使，硬拉；拖着脚步走
detailed_translations.english: to pull something along the ground, often because it is too heavy to carry

detailed_translations.chinese: 累赘； 一吸， 一抽
detailed_translations.english: If you take a drag on a cigarette or pipe that you are smoking, you take in air through it

name: dramatic
trans: adj. sudden and extreme 剧烈的
adj. attracting attention 引人注目的

sentences.english: A superb goal by Owen earned United a dramatic victory yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 昨天欧文的一个超级入球为联队赢得了激动人心的胜利。

sentences.english: Some of the most dramatic events in American history happened here.
sentences.chinese: 美国历史上一些最震撼人心的事件发生在这里。

sentences.english: the dramatic scenery of the Grand Canyon
sentences.chinese: 大峡谷的壮丽景致

detailed_translations.chinese: 引人注目的， 激动人心的； 戏剧的
detailed_translations.english: exciting or impressive

name: draw
trans: v. to cause to come 吸引

sentences.english: Katie had drawn a cottage with a little stream running next to it.
sentences.chinese: 凯蒂画了一间小茅舍，旁边流淌着一条小溪。

sentences.english: She asked the little girl to draw a picture of the man she’d spoken to.
sentences.chinese: 她让小女孩把刚才和她说话的那个男人画出来。

sentences.english: Keith was drawing a complicated-looking graph.
sentences.chinese: 基思在画一张看上去很复杂的图表。

sentences.english: I’ve never been able to draw very well.
sentences.chinese: 我从来就画不好图画。

detailed_translations.english: to produce a picture of something using a pencil, pen etc

name: dreary
trans: adj. causing unhappiness or sad feelings 枯燥乏味的

sentences.english: the same dreary routine
sentences.chinese: 一成不变的、乏味的日常事务

sentences.english: a dreary winter’s day
sentences.chinese: 沉闷的冬日

detailed_translations.english: dull and making you feel sad or bored

name: droll
trans: adj. having an odd and amusing quality 滑稽的

sentences.english: Evelyn is entertaining company, with droll and sardonic observations on nearly everything.
sentences.chinese: 伊芙琳以其对几乎每件事情都冷嘲式的方式和离奇可笑的见解娱乐伙伴。

detailed_translations.english: amusing in an unusual way

name: dubious
trans: adj. unsure or uncertain 不确定的
adj. causing doubt, uncertainty, or suspicion 可疑的

sentences.english: The firm was accused of dubious accounting practices.
sentences.chinese: 该公司被指控有不诚实的会计行为。

sentences.english: Many critics regard this argument as dubious or, at best, misleading.
sentences.chinese: 许多批评家认为这一论点靠不住，或者说至少有误导性。

sentences.english: The assumption that growth in one country benefits the whole world is highly dubious .
sentences.chinese: 一国的经济增长会对全世界有益的假设是很值得怀疑的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 怀疑的， 犹豫不决的， 无把握的； 有问题的； 靠不住的
detailed_translations.english: probably not honest, true, right etc

name: dull
trans: adj. not exciting or interesting 乏味的

sentences.english: Life is never dull when Elizabeth is here.
sentences.chinese: 有伊丽莎白在这里生活绝不会无聊。

sentences.english: a dull movie
sentences.chinese: 一部沉闷的电影

sentences.english: It sounded pretty dull to me.
sentences.chinese: 在我听来，这很无聊。

sentences.english: The weekly meeting tends to be deadly dull (= very dull ) .
sentences.chinese: 每周一次的会议总是十分无聊。

sentences.english: The bird is dull brown and gray in colour.
sentences.chinese: 这只鸟是暗淡的棕灰色。

detailed_translations.english: not interesting or exciting

name: dump
trans: v. to leave or get rid of quickly or without concern 倾倒，丢下

sentences.english: We dumped our bags at the nearby Grand Hotel and hurried toward the market.
sentences.chinese: 我们把包扔在附近的格兰德旅馆，急匆匆地向市场赶去。

sentences.english: a campaign to stop cheap European beef being dumped in West Africa
sentences.chinese: 阻止在西非倾销廉价欧洲牛肉的运动

detailed_translations.english: If you dump something somewhere, you put it or unload it there quickly and carelessly.

name: duplicate
trans: v. to make an exact copy of 复制

sentences.english: A duplicate copy should be made for the county record office.
sentences.chinese: 应该制作一个副本呈交县档案室。

sentences.english: a duplicate key
sentences.chinese: 配制的钥匙

detailed_translations.chinese: 完全一样的， 复制的
detailed_translations.english: exactly the same as something, or made as an exact copy of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 完全一样的东西，复制品
detailed_translations.english: an exact copy of something that you can use in the same way

detailed_translations.chinese: 复制， 复印； 重复
detailed_translations.english: to copy something exactly

name: duplicity
trans: n. dishonest behavior that is meant to trick someone 欺骗

sentences.english: Strange I was stubborn like duplicity said every word is the public taste.
sentences.chinese: 怪我生性倔强喜欢口是心非说的每一句话都不合大众口味。

sentences.english: Since the promotion of a new era is more focused on inner beauty why duplicity of people to meet others vanity and so praised it?
sentences.chinese: 既然新时代提倡的是更加注重于内在美，那为什么口是心非的人为了满足他人的虚荣心而如此称赞呢？

name: durable
trans: adj. staying strong and in good condition over a long period of time 持久的

sentences.english: Wood is a durable material.
sentences.chinese: 木头是耐用材料。

detailed_translations.english: staying in good condition for a long time, even if used a lot

name: dwindle
trans: v. to gradually become smaller 逐渐减少，逐渐变小

sentences.english: The elephant population is dwindling.
sentences.chinese: 大象的数量在减少。

sentences.english: His money had dwindled away.
sentences.chinese: 他的钱在逐渐变少。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually become less and less or smaller and smaller

name: easygoing
trans: adj. relaxed and casual in style or manner 悠闲的

sentences.english: They thought she would be popular, warm and easygoing, but not demanding and difficult.
sentences.chinese: 他们认为她会是受人欢迎的，温情的，随和的，而非挑三拣四难以追求的。

sentences.english: "My first impression was that he was an honest guy, easygoing, apologizing and apologizing," Chen said. "And he bowed.
sentences.chinese: “他给我的第一印象是觉得他是个老实人，挺随和的，一直在道歉，”老陈说，“而且他还鞠了躬。

sentences.english: You bet I am proud, but what really matters to me is that she grew up to be warm and kind, with an easygoing, unassuming demeanor.
sentences.chinese: 你一定会说我骄傲，但对我来说，真正重要的是，我的孩子长大了，有一颗热情善良的心，为人随和，不装模作样。

name: ebb
trans: v. to get worse 衰退

sentences.english: His confidence is at a low ebb.
sentences.chinese: 他的信心很低落。

detailed_translations.english: the flow of the sea away from the shore, when the tide goes out
if the tide ebbs, it flows away from the shore

name: eclipse
trans: n. a loss of power, success, popularity, etc. 衰退
v. to make less important or popular 使…不重要，胜过

sentences.english: The economy had eclipsed the environment as an election issue.
sentences.chinese: 经济作为竞选话题已经盖过环境问题。

detailed_translations.english: to become more important, powerful, famous etc than someone or something else, so that they are no longer noticed
an occasion when the sun or the moon cannot be seen, because the Earth is passing directly between the moon and the sun, or because the moon is passing directly between the Earth and the sun

name: economic
trans: adj. profitable 有利可图的

sentences.english: Economic growth is slow.
sentences.chinese: 经济增长缓慢。

sentences.english: the government’s economic policy
sentences.chinese: 政府的经济政策

sentences.english: Economic reform is needed.
sentences.chinese: 经济改革势在必行。

sentences.english: In the current economic climate (= conditions ), we must keep costs down.
sentences.chinese: 在当前的经济形势下，我们一定要控制好成本。

detailed_translations.english: relating to trade, in-dustry, and the management of money

name: economy
trans: n. careful use of money, resources, etc. 节约

sentences.english: a successful economy
sentences.chinese: 发展成功的经济

sentences.english: the slowdown in the Japanese economy
sentences.chinese: 日本经济的减缓

sentences.english: The gas fire was turned low for reasons of economy.
sentences.chinese: 为了节省，把煤气取暖器开小了。

detailed_translations.english: the system by which a country’s money and goods are produced and used, or a country considered in this way

name: ecstasy
trans: n. a state of very great happiness 狂喜

sentences.english: ...a state of almost religious ecstasy.
sentences.chinese: …一种近乎宗教极乐的状态。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of extreme happiness

name: efficacy
trans: n. the power to produce a desired result or effect 功效

sentences.english: Recent medical studies confirm the efficacy of a healthier lifestyle.
sentences.chinese: 近来的医学研究证实了更健康的生活方式的功效。

detailed_translations.english: the ability of something to produce the right result

name: effusive
trans: adj. expressing a lot of emotion 溢于言表的，感情丰富的

sentences.english: Our host gave us an effusive welcome.
sentences.chinese: 主人热情地欢迎我们。

detailed_translations.english: showing your good feelings in a very excited way

name: egalitarian
trans: adj. aiming for equal wealth, status, etc. 平等主义的

sentences.english: an egalitarian society
sentences.chinese: 人人平等的社会

detailed_translations.english: based on the belief that everyone is equal and should have equal rights

name: egregious
trans: adj. very bad and easily noticed 臭名昭著的

sentences.english: ...the most egregious abuses of human rights.
sentences.chinese: ...最恶劣的人权侵犯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 惊人的；过分的；恶名昭彰的

name: elate
trans: v. to make very happy and excited 使...高兴

sentences.english: His eye, elate with happiness, was reading eagerly the tearful gaze of Haidée, when suddenly the door opened .
sentences.chinese: 当他那洋溢着幸福的眼睛正在急切地探索海黛那一对润湿眼睛里的所表达的意思的时候，房门突然打开了。

sentences.english: Don't let your sober face elate you, however;
sentences.chinese: 不过，别因为你那张清醒的面孔而得意。

name: elegiac
trans: adj. written in or consisting of elegiac couplets 哀悼的

sentences.english: He spoke of her in elegiac tones.
sentences.chinese: 他以悲伤的口吻谈到了她。

detailed_translations.english: showing that you feel sad about someone who has died or something that no longer exists

name: elemental
trans: adj. of, relating to, or being the basic or essential constituent of something 基本的

sentences.english: Love and fear are two of the most elemental human emotions.
sentences.chinese: 爱和恐惧是人类最基本的两种情感。

sentences.english: the elemental fury of the storm
sentences.chinese: 暴风雨的肆虐

detailed_translations.english: simple, basic, and important

name: elicit
trans: v. to call forth or draw out 引出

sentences.english: My letters to her have elicited no response.
sentences.chinese: 我写给她的信没有得到回应。

detailed_translations.english: If you elicit a piece of information, you get it by asking the right questions

name: eliminate
trans: v. to remove (something that is not wanted or needed) 消除
v. to defeat and remove from a competition 淘汰

sentences.english: a ruthless dictator who eliminated all his rivals
sentences.chinese: 铲除所有异己的残酷独裁者

detailed_translations.english: to completely get rid of something that is unnecessary or unwanted

name: elite
trans: n. the people who have the most wealth and status in a society 精英

sentences.english: a struggle for power within the ruling elite
sentences.chinese: 统治阶层内部的争权夺利

detailed_translations.english: a group of people who have a lot of power and influence because they have money, knowledge, or special skills

name: elongate
trans: v. to make longer or to grow longer 拉长

sentences.english: Her legs were elongated by the very high heels which she wore.
sentences.chinese: 她穿的高跟鞋非常高，使她的腿显得长了。

detailed_translations.english: to become longer, or make something longer than normal

name: eloquent
trans: adj. marked by forceful and fluent expression 雄辩的

sentences.english: an eloquent appeal for support
sentences.chinese: 极具说服力的求助呼吁

detailed_translations.english: able to express your ideas and opinions well, especially in a way that influences people

name: elude
trans: v. to avoid or escape by being quick, skillful, or clever 避开
v. to fail to be understood or remembered by 不能被...理解

sentences.english: He eluded his pursuers by escaping into a river.
sentences.chinese: 他逃到河里，甩掉了追踪他的人。

detailed_translations.english: to escape from someone or something, especially by tricking them

name: elusive
trans: adj. hard to find or capture 难抓住的
adj. hard to understand, define, or remember 难理解的

sentences.english: She enjoys a firm reputation in this country but wider international success has been elusive.
sentences.chinese: 她在这个国家享有稳固的声誉，但却一直难以在国际上取得更大的成功。

detailed_translations.chinese: 难懂的；易忘的；逃避的；难捉摸的
detailed_translations.english: an elusive result is difficult to achieve

name: embed
trans: v. to place or set firmly in something else 嵌入

sentences.english: Feelings of guilt are deeply embedded in her personality.
sentences.chinese: 负罪感在她的性格里根深蒂固。

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…嵌入， 扎牢； 使深留脑中
detailed_translations.english: to put something firmly and deeply into something else, or to be put into something in this way

name: emblematic
trans: adj. representing something that cannot be seen by itself 象征的

sentences.english: Dogs are emblematic of faithfulness.
sentences.chinese: 狗象征着忠诚。

detailed_translations.english: seeming to represent or be a sign of something

name: embody
trans: v. to represent in a clear and obvious way 象征
v. to include as a part of feature 包括

sentences.english: She embodies everything I admire in a teacher.
sentences.chinese: 她具备了我所钦佩的教师该具备的一切素质。

detailed_translations.chinese: 体现，使具体化；具体表达
detailed_translations.english: to be a very good example of an idea or quality

name: embrace
trans: v. to accept readily or gladly 欣然接受

sentences.english: We hope these regions will embrace democratic reforms.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望这些地区会乐意接受民主改革。

sentences.english: Most West European countries have embraced the concept of high-speed rail networks with enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 大多数西欧国家都表现出极大的兴趣，欣然接受修建高速铁路网的想法。

detailed_translations.english: to eagerly accept a new idea, opinion, religion etc

name: embryonic
trans: adj. being in an early stage of development 萌芽期的

sentences.english: embryonic development
sentences.chinese: 胚胎的发育

sentences.english: embryonic cells
sentences.chinese: 胚胎细胞

detailed_translations.english: relating to an embryo

name: emendation
trans: n. an alteration designed to correct or improve 修订

name: emergent
trans: adj. arising unexpectedly 意外的
adj. newly formed or prominent 新兴的

sentences.english: Discovering these patterns is the key to emergent design.
sentences.chinese: 发现这些模式是紧急设计的关键。

sentences.english: The real trick in emergent design is discovering these patterns.
sentences.chinese: 紧急设计的真正诀窍就是发现这些模式。

name: eminent
trans: adj. successful, well-known and respected 杰出的

sentences.english: an eminent lawyer
sentences.chinese: 杰出的律师

detailed_translations.english: an eminent person is famous, important, and respected

name: empirical
trans: adj. based on testing or experience 根据实证或经验的

sentences.english: empirical evidence
sentences.chinese: 实验证据

detailed_translations.english: based on scientific testing or practical experience, not on ideas

name: employ
trans: v. to use for a particular purpose or to do something 使用
v. to use or get the services of to do a particular job 雇用

sentences.english: The factory employs over 2,000 people.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂雇用了2,000多名员工。

sentences.english: The report examines teaching methods employed in the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 这个报告探讨了课堂教学方法。

sentences.english: Her days are employed in gardening and voluntary work.
sentences.chinese: 她的时间都花在搞园艺和做义工上。

detailed_translations.english: to pay someone to work for you

name: empower
trans: v. to give official authority or legal power to 授权

sentences.english: The Voting Rights Act was needed to empower minority groups.
sentences.chinese: 《选举权法案》对于赋予少数民族自主权是必不可少的。

detailed_translations.english: to give a person or organization the legal right to do something

name: emulate
trans: v. to try to be like 模仿
v. to strive to equal or excel 努力赶超

sentences.english: He hoped to emulate the success of Wilder.
sentences.chinese: 他希望效仿怀尔德的成功。

detailed_translations.chinese: 仿真；模仿；尽力赶上；同…竞争
detailed_translations.english: to do something or behave in the same way as someone else, especially because you admire them

name: enamor
trans: v. to cause to be loved or admired 使迷恋

detailed_translations.english: to inspire with love; captivate; charm

name: encomium
trans: n. glowing and warmly enthusiastic praise 赞美

name: encumber
trans: v. to impede or hamper the function or activity of 妨碍

sentences.english: He died in 1874, heavily encumbered by debt.
sentences.chinese: 他于1874年去世，负债累累。

detailed_translations.english: to make it difficult for you to do something or for something to happen

name: encyclopedic
trans: adj. dealing with or knowing a subject thoroughly or completely 广博的，全面的

sentences.english: an encyclopedic knowledge of medieval literature
sentences.chinese: 广博的中世纪文学知识

detailed_translations.chinese: 广博的， 知识渊博的
detailed_translations.english: having a lot of knowledge or information about a particular subject

name: endemic
trans: adj. restricted or peculiar to a locality or region 地方性的

sentences.english: Violent crime is now endemic in parts of Chicago.
sentences.chinese: 芝加哥一些地区暴力犯罪成患。

detailed_translations.english: an endemic disease or problem is always present in a particular place, or among a particular group of people

name: endorse
trans: v. to publicly or officially say that you support or approve of 支持

sentences.english: I can endorse their opinion wholeheartedly.
sentences.chinese: 我可以全心全意地支持他们的观点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 背书；认可；签署；赞同；在背面签名
detailed_translations.english: to express formal support or approval for someone or something

name: endowment
trans: n. the act of providing money to create or support a school, organization, etc. 捐赠
n. a person’s natural ability or talent 天赋

sentences.english: ...the National Endowment for the Arts.
sentences.chinese: …美国艺术基金会。

detailed_translations.english: a sum of money given to a college, hospital etc to provide it with an income, or the act of giving this money

name: enduring
trans: adj. lasting, durable 持久的

sentences.english: the enduring appeal of Shakespeare’s plays
sentences.chinese: 莎士比亚戏剧经久不衰的感染力

sentences.english: enduring hatred
sentences.chinese: 宿仇

detailed_translations.english: continuing for a very long time

name: energize
trans: v. to give energy or excitement to 使...活跃

sentences.english: He helped energize and mobilize millions of people around the nation.
sentences.chinese: 他参与激励并动员了全国数百万人。

sentences.english: I am completely energized and feeling terrific.
sentences.chinese: 我现在充满了活力，感觉棒极了。

detailed_translations.english: To energize someone means to give them the enthusiasm and determination to do something

name: enfeeble
trans: v. deprive of strength 使衰弱

detailed_translations.english: to make weak; deprive of strength

name: engaging
trans: adj. very attractive or pleasing in a way that holds your attention 迷人的

sentences.english: an engaging smile
sentences.chinese: 迷人的微笑

detailed_translations.chinese: 迷人的， 美丽动人的
detailed_translations.english: pleasant and attracting your interest

name: engender
trans: v. to cause to exist or to develop 导致

sentences.english: In such circumstances, governments must do all they can to create and engender trust among its nation’s constituents and institutions.
sentences.chinese: 在这种情况下，政府必须尽其所能在它的国家选民和公共机构之间创造和产生信任。

sentences.english: Retrospectives on the process and working practices regularly capture the lessons learned by the project and engender a culture of continuous process improvement within the project.
sentences.chinese: 对过程和工作实践的回顾有规律地捕捉从项目中得到的经验，并在项目中造成一个持续的过程改进的文化。

name: enhance
trans: v. to increase or improve 提高，改善

sentences.english: Good lighting will enhance any room.
sentences.chinese: 良好的照明能给房间增色不少。

sentences.english: The publicity has enhanced his reputation.
sentences.chinese: 这次宣传提高了他的声誉。

detailed_translations.english: to improve something

name: enigmatic
trans: adj. full of mystery and difficult to understand 神秘难懂的

sentences.english: She starred in one of Welles's most enigmatic films.
sentences.chinese: 她主演了威尔斯最神秘的电影当中的一部。

detailed_translations.chinese: 神秘的；高深莫测的；谜一般的
detailed_translations.english: Someone or something that is enigmatic is mysterious and difficult to understand

name: enrich
trans: v. to make rich or richer especially by the addition or increase of some desirable quality, attribute, or ingredient 使丰富

sentences.english: Add fertilizer to enrich the soil.
sentences.chinese: 施上肥料使土壤肥沃。

sentences.english: Education can greatly enrich your life.
sentences.chinese: 教育可以大大充实生活。

detailed_translations.english: to improve the quality of something, especially by adding things to it

name: ensue
trans: v. to happen as a result 随即发生

sentences.english: If the Europeans did not reduce subsidies, a trade war would ensue.
sentences.chinese: 如果欧洲不减少补贴，贸易战将随即爆发。

detailed_translations.english: If something ensues, it happens immediately after another event, usually as a result of it

name: entailed by
trans: v. to impose, involve, or imply as a necessary accompaniment or result
使需要，导致

name: entangle
trans: v. to cause to get caught in or twisted with something else 使纠缠

sentences.english: Bureaucracy can entangle applications for months.
sentences.chinese: 官僚主义会使申请耽搁数月之久。

detailed_translations.english: to involve someone in an argument, a relationship, or a situation that is difficult to escape from

name: enterprising
trans: adj. having or showing the ability or desire to do new and difficult things
有进取心的

sentences.english: Some enterprising students are designing software.
sentences.chinese: 一些有创业精神的学生在设计软件。

sentences.english: an enterprising scheme to provide interest-free loans
sentences.chinese: 一项提供无息贷款的创业计划

detailed_translations.chinese: 有事业心的, 有进取心的
detailed_translations.english: having the ability to think of new activities or ideas and make them work

name: entreat
trans: v. to ask in a serious and emotional way 恳求

sentences.english: His friends entreated him not to go.
sentences.chinese: 他的朋友们恳求他不要去。

sentences.english: He entreated them to delay their departure.
sentences.chinese: 他恳求他们晚些再走。

detailed_translations.english: to ask someone, in a very emotional way, to do something for you

name: entrench
trans: v. to place in a very strong position that cannot easily be changed 使…牢固，确立

sentences.english: ...a series of measures designed to entrench democracy and the rule of law.
sentences.chinese: …一系列旨在巩固民主和法制的举措。

detailed_translations.chinese: 确立，牢固；用壕沟围住；挖掘
detailed_translations.english: If something such as power, a custom, or an idea is entrenched, it is firmly established, so that it would be difficult to change it

name: enviable
trans: adj. causing envy: very desirable 令人羡慕的

sentences.english: Now he was in the enviable position of not having to work for a living.
sentences.chinese: 现在他已不必为生计而工作，着实令人羡慕。

detailed_translations.english: an enviable quality, position, or possession is good and other people would like to have it

name: ephemeral
trans: adj. lasting a very short time 短暂的

sentences.english: Fashion is by nature ephemeral.
sentences.chinese: 从本质上说，时尚不过是一时的潮流。

detailed_translations.english: existing or popular for only a short time

name: equable
trans: adj. tending to remain calm 平静的

sentences.english: a young man with a naturally equable temperament
sentences.chinese: 生性温和的年轻人

detailed_translations.chinese: 稳定的， 不变的； 温和的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is equable remains calm and happy and does not often get annoyed

name: equanimity
trans: n. calm emotions when dealing with problems or pressure 镇定

sentences.english: He received the news with surprising equanimity.
sentences.chinese: 他得到消息时显得异常镇静。

detailed_translations.english: calmness in the way that you react to things, which means that you do not become upset or annoyed

name: equivalent
trans: adj. having the same value, use, meaning, etc. 相同的，等价的

sentences.english: I had no dollars, but offered him an equivalent amount of sterling.
sentences.chinese: 我没有美金，但给了他等值的英镑。

detailed_translations.english: having the same value, purpose, job etc as a person or thing of a different kind
something that has the same value, purpose, job etc as something else

name: equivocal
trans: adj. not easily understood or explained 模棱两可的

sentences.english: His answer was equivocal.
sentences.chinese: 他的回答模棱两可。

sentences.english: She was rather equivocal about her work.
sentences.chinese: 她谈到她的工作时有点含糊其词。

detailed_translations.english: if you are equivocal, you are deliberately unclear in the way that you give information or your opinion

name: erode
trans: v. to diminish or destroy by degrees 腐蚀

sentences.english: The cliffs are being constantly eroded by heavy seas.
sentences.chinese: 悬崖正不断受到汹涌海浪的侵蚀。

sentences.english: The rocks have gradually eroded away.
sentences.chinese: 岩石逐渐风化。

detailed_translations.english: if the weather erodes rock or soil, or if rock or soil erodes, its surface is gradually destroyed

name: errant
trans: adj. moving about aimlessly or irregularly 不定的
adj. behaving wrongly 行为错误的

sentences.english: Usually his cases involved errant husbands and wandering wives.
sentences.chinese: 通常他接手的案子都涉及出轨的丈夫和离家出走的妻子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不定的；周游的；错误的；偏离正路的
detailed_translations.english: Errant is used to describe someone whose actions are considered unacceptable or wrong by other people. For example, an errant husband is unfaithful to his wife.

name: erratic
trans: adj. acting, moving, or changing in ways that are not expected or usual
难以预测的

sentences.english: His breathing was becoming erratic.
sentences.chinese: 他的呼吸越来越不均匀。

sentences.english: his erratic behaviour
sentences.chinese: 他难以捉摸的行为

detailed_translations.english: something that is erratic does not follow any pattern or plan but happens in a way that is not regular

detailed_translations.chinese: 漂泊无定的人；古怪的人

name: erroneous
trans: adj. not correct 错误的

sentences.english: His economic predictions are based on some erroneous assumptions.
sentences.chinese: 他的经济预测是基于错误假设之上的。

detailed_translations.english: erroneous ideas or information are wrong and based on facts that are not correct

name: erstwhile
trans: adj. in the past 过去的

name: erudite
trans: adj. having or showing knowledge that is learned by studying 博学的

sentences.english: There’s also the intrinsic pleasure you get from boosting your knowledge and becoming more erudite.
sentences.chinese: 这也有利于你发自内心地努力奋进获得更多学识变得更博学。

sentences.english: The supreme symbol for the author is the word; the erudite Hirst in The Voyage Out has the forename St John recalling the evangelist whose opening line was ‘In the beginning was the Word’.
sentences.chinese: 文字是作家最有力的表达符号，《远航》中博学的赫斯特的教名为圣·约翰，取自感召福音的传教士之名。 他在小说中的开场白为：“语言是世界的初始”。

detailed_translations.english: showing a lot of knowledge based on careful study

name: eschew
trans: v. to avoid especially because you do not think it is right, proper, etc. 避免

sentences.english: I had eschewed politics in favour of a life practising law.
sentences.chinese: 我选择从事律师职业，有意避开了政治。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately avoid doing or using something

name: esoteric
trans: adj. hard to understand 深奥难懂的

sentences.english: ...esoteric knowledge.
sentences.chinese: …深奥难懂的知识。

detailed_translations.chinese: 秘传的；限于圈内人的；难懂的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe something as esoteric, you mean it is known, understood, or appreciated by only a small number of people

name: espouse
trans: v. to express support for 拥护

sentences.english: She ran away with him to Mexico and espoused the revolutionary cause.
sentences.chinese: 她与他一起逃到了墨西哥，支持革命事业。

detailed_translations.english: to support an idea, belief etc, especially a political one

name: essential
trans: adj. extremely important and necessary 完全必要的
adj. very basic 基本的

sentences.english: Window locks are fairly cheap and absolutely essential.
sentences.chinese: 窗锁相当便宜，绝对有必要安装。

sentences.english: Even in small companies, computers are an essential tool.
sentences.chinese: 即使在小公司里，计算机也是不可或缺的工具。

detailed_translations.english: extremely important and necessary
something that is necessary to do something or in a particular situation

name: established
trans: adj. well known because it has existed for a long time 老牌的，已经确立的

name: estrange
trans: v. to cause someone to be no longer friendly or close to another person or group 使疏远

sentences.english: The more the physical causes incline mankind to inaction, the more the moral causes should estrange them from it.
sentences.chinese: 所以，物质的因素越使他们趋于懈怠时，精神的因素就越使他们远离物质的因素。

sentences.english: Their specific treatment of volume, apertures, and overall geometry interested us as tools to estrange conventional ideas of residential housing.
sentences.chinese: 该建筑在体量、孔径和整体几何形状上的处理手法都激发我们有了远离传统住宅的想法。

name: eternal
trans: adj. lasting forever 永恒的

sentences.english: the Christian promise of eternal life
sentences.chinese: 基督教承诺的永生

sentences.english: She’s an eternal optimist (= she always expects that good things will happen ).
sentences.chinese: 她永远是个乐观主义者。

detailed_translations.english: continuing for ever and having no end

name: eulogize
trans: v. to speak or write in high praise of 赞美

sentences.english: The poem does not eulogize the dead soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 这首诗并未歌颂阵亡的士兵。

sentences.english: Commentators are eulogizing about the 17-year-old left-hander.
sentences.chinese: 解说员都在夸赞这位17岁的左撇子选手。

detailed_translations.english: to praise someone or something very much

name: euphoria
trans: n. a feeling of great happiness and excitement 狂喜

sentences.english: There was a general atmosphere of pessimism after the euphoria of last year.
sentences.chinese: 去年的狂喜过后出现了普遍的悲观气氛。

detailed_translations.chinese: 精神欢快，[临床] 欣快；兴高采烈；欣快症；幸福愉快感

name: evanescent
trans: adj. lasting a very short time 短暂的

sentences.english: ...the evanescent scents of summer herbs.
sentences.chinese: ...夏季香草逐渐消散的味道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 容易消散的；逐渐消失的；会凋零的
detailed_translations.english: Something that is evanescent gradually disappears from sight or memory

name: evangelist
trans: n. an enthusiastic advocate 热情的推动者

detailed_translations.chinese: 福音传道者；圣经新约福音书的作者
detailed_translations.english: one of the four writers of the books in the Bible called the Gospels

name: evasive
trans: adj. tending or intended to evade: equivocal 逃避的，闪烁其词的

sentences.english: an evasive reply
sentences.chinese: 模棱两可的答复

detailed_translations.english: not willing to answer questions directly

name: evenhanded
trans: adj. not favoring one side or group over another 公平的

sentences.english: ...an evenhanded approach to the war on drugs.
sentences.chinese: ...反毒品战中公正无私的做法。

detailed_translations.chinese: 公平的， 不偏不倚的
detailed_translations.english: If someone is evenhanded, they are completely fair, especially when they are judging other people or dealing with two groups of people

name: evolve
trans: v. to change or develop slowly often into a better, more complex, or more advanced state 逐渐发展

sentences.english: The school has evolved its own style of teaching.
sentences.chinese: 学校逐步形成了自己的教学风格。

sentences.english: Businesses need to evolve rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 各项业务需要快速发展。

detailed_translations.english: to develop and change gradually over a long period of time

name: exacerbate
trans: v. to make more violent, bitter, or severe 使恶化

sentences.english: The recession has exacerbated this problem.
sentences.chinese: 经济衰退使这个问题更加严重。

sentences.english: I don’t want to exacerbate the situation.
sentences.chinese: 我不想使情况变得更糟。

detailed_translations.english: to make a bad situation worse

name: exacting
trans: adj. requiring much time, attention, or effort from someone 严格的

sentences.english: She was an exacting woman to work for.
sentences.chinese: 她是一位对下属要求严格的女性。

detailed_translations.english: demanding a lot of effort, careful work, or skill

name: exactitude
trans: n. the quality or state of being accurate and correct 精确性

sentences.english: ...the precision and exactitude of current genetic mapping.
sentences.chinese: ...现代基因图谱的精密和严谨。

detailed_translations.chinese: 正确， 精确， 严格
detailed_translations.english: the state of being exact

name: exaggerate
trans: v. to think of or describe something as larger or greater than it really is
夸大

sentences.english: I couldn’t sleep for three days – I’m not exaggerating.
sentences.chinese: 我三天没睡觉了——一点不夸张。

detailed_translations.english: to make something seem better, larger, worse etc than it really is

name: exalt
trans: v. to praise highly 赞扬

sentences.english: But it can also inspire and uplift and exalt, because power can be used to help people accomplish marvelous things.
sentences.chinese: 但是，权力也可以激励人、振奋人和提升人，因为它可以帮助人们成就非同寻常的事业。

detailed_translations.english: to put someone or something into a high rank or position

name: exasperation
trans: n. the state of being very annoyed or upset 恼怒

sentences.english: Carol sighed in exasperation.
sentences.chinese: 卡罗尔恼怒地叹了口气。

detailed_translations.english: when you feel annoyed because someone continues to do something that is upsetting you

name: exceptional
trans: adj. not usual 不寻常的
adj. much better than average 杰出的

sentences.english: an exceptional student
sentences.chinese: 出类拔萃的学生

sentences.english: A review panel concluded that there were no exceptional circumstances that would warrant a lesser penalty for him.
sentences.chinese: 一个评估小组作出结论：没有什么例外情况可使他获得从轻惩罚。

detailed_translations.english: unusually good

name: excoriate
trans: v. to criticize very harshly 严厉指责

sentences.english: He proceeded to excoriate me in front of the nurses.
sentences.chinese: 他继续在这些护士们面前指责我。

detailed_translations.chinese: 严厉的责难；擦破的皮肤
detailed_translations.english: To excoriate a person or organization means to criticize them severely, usually in public

name: exculpate
trans: v. to prove that someone is not guilty of doing something wrong 开脱罪行

sentences.english: These causes, however, never served to exculpate "ordinary Germans" who shared in the guilt either for participating in or not resisting Nazi rule in Germany.
sentences.chinese: 但这些原因，都不足以证明所谓“德国平民”是无罪的，因为他们有些也参与了这场罪行，至少并没有反抗纳粹在德国的统治。

detailed_translations.chinese: 开脱； 申明无罪， 证明无罪
detailed_translations.english: to prove that someone is not guilty of something

name: exemplary
trans: adj. extremely good and deserving to be admired and copied 楷模的
adj. serving as an example of something 典型的

sentences.english: a company with an exemplary record on environmental issues
sentences.chinese: 在处理环境问题方面可作为楷模的公司

detailed_translations.chinese: 可作楷模的， 典范的
detailed_translations.english: excellent and providing a good example for people to follow

name: exhaustive
trans: adj. very thorough 全面的

sentences.english: an exhaustive investigation
sentences.chinese: 彻底的调查

sentences.english: The list is by no means exhaustive.
sentences.chinese: 清单一点也不详尽。

detailed_translations.english: extremely thorough and complete

name: exhilarate
trans: v. to make cheerful and excited 使兴奋

sentences.english: This dangerous task exhilarate his spirits.
sentences.chinese: 这项危险的任务使他精神振奋。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel very excited and happy

name: exigent
trans: adj. requiring immediate attention 迫切的

sentences.english: To explain the current tense physician-patient relationship is an exigent social problem.
sentences.chinese: 解读目前紧张的医患关系是一个迫切的社会课题。

sentences.english: Along with advance of space and time resolution and betterment of physical process in the modeling pattern, the need for a high precision, high speed module of radiation grows more and more exigent.
sentences.chinese: 随着模式空间和时间分辨率的增加和物理过程的改进，气候模拟对一个高精度、高速度的辐射模块的需求显得越来越迫切。

detailed_translations.english: an exigent situation is urgent, so that you must deal with it very quickly

name: exiguous
trans: adj. excessive scanty 稀少的

sentences.english: exiguous earnings
sentences.chinese: 微薄的收入

detailed_translations.english: very small in amount

name: exonerate
trans: v. to prove that someone is not guilty of a crime or responsible for a problem, bad situation, etc. 免罪

sentences.english: The official report basically exonerated everyone.
sentences.chinese: 该官方报告基本洗脱了所有人的干系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 证明…无罪；  免受指控
detailed_translations.english: to state officially that someone who has been blamed for something is not guilty

name: expansion
trans: n. the act of becoming bigger or of making something bigger 扩张，增加

sentences.english: The industry underwent a period of rapid expansion.
sentences.chinese: 该产业经历了一轮快速扩张。

detailed_translations.english: when something increases in size, range, amount etc

name: expel
trans: v. to officially force to leave a place or organization 开除，驱逐

sentences.english: Two girls were expelled from school for taking drugs.
sentences.chinese: 两名女生因吸毒而被学校开除。

sentences.english: Foreign priests were expelled from the country.
