sentences.chinese: 外国牧师被驱逐出境。

sentences.english: As the lungs exhale this waste, gas is expelled into the atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 当肺呼出这股废气，气体就被排到空气中。

detailed_translations.english: to officially force someone to leave a school or organization

name: experimental
trans: adj. relating to a scientific experiment or to scientific experiments in general 实验的
adj. using a new way of doing or thinking about something 创新的

sentences.english: experimental teaching methods
sentences.chinese: 试验性教学方法

detailed_translations.english: based on new ideas, forms or methods that are used to find out what effect they have

name: explicit
trans: adj. fully revealed or expressed without vagueness, implication, or ambiguity 直截了当的
adj. fully developed or formulated 详述的

sentences.english: The contrast could not have been made more explicit.
sentences.chinese: 这个对比再清楚不过了。

sentences.english: explicit knowledge of grammar
sentences.chinese: 清楚易懂的语法知识

sentences.english: The kidnappers gave us explicit instructions not to involve the police.
sentences.chinese: 绑匪明确告诉我们不许报警。

sentences.english: Be explicit when you talk about money with your family.
sentences.chinese: 与家人谈钱的问题要直截了当。

detailed_translations.english: expressed in a way that is very clear and direct

name: exploit
trans: v. to get value or use form 利用
v. to use in a way that helps you unfairly 剥削

sentences.english: the urgent need to exploit the resources of the Irish Sea
sentences.chinese: 开发爱尔兰海资源的迫切需要

detailed_translations.english: to develop and use minerals, forests, oil etc for business or industry

name: external
trans: adj. coming from outside 外部的

sentences.english: The open cities will be testing grounds for our external policies.
sentences.chinese: 使开放城市成为对外政策的窗口。

sentences.english: The ear canal also named middle ear splays out at the external position.
sentences.chinese: 耳道亦称中耳，内小外大呈喇叭状。

sentences.english: Riddled with a thousand gaping wounds, this reactionary clique is now beset with difficulties and contradictions both in internal and external affairs.
sentences.chinese: 今天， 这个反动集团百孔千疮， 内外交困， 矛盾重重。

name: extinguish
trans: v. to cause to stop burning 熄灭
v. to cause the end or death of 毁灭

sentences.english: Please extinguish all cigarettes.
sentences.chinese: 请把香烟都熄灭了。

sentences.english: Firemen were called to extinguish the blaze.
sentences.chinese: 有人打电话叫消防队员来扑灭大火。

sentences.english: All hope was almost extinguished.
sentences.chinese: 所有的希望都快要破灭了。

detailed_translations.english: to make a fire or light stop burning or shining

name: extirpate
trans: v. to destroy or remove completely 根除

name: extol
trans: v. to praise highly 赞扬

sentences.english: Now experts are extolling the virtues of the humble potato.
sentences.chinese: 现在专家们在颂扬粗陋的马铃薯的种种好处。

detailed_translations.english: to praise something very much

name: extraneous
trans: adj. not forming a necessary part of something 无关的

sentences.english: extraneous noises
sentences.chinese: 外面传来的噪声

detailed_translations.chinese: 外来的；没有关联的；来自体外的
detailed_translations.english: coming from outside

name: extrapolate
trans: n. to form an opinion or to make an estimate about something from known facts 推断

sentences.english: Extrapolating from his latest findings, he reckons about 80% of these deaths might be attributed to smoking.
sentences.chinese: 从他最近的发现推断，他估计大约80%的这类死亡可能归因于吸烟。

detailed_translations.english: to use facts about the present or about one thing or group to make a guess about the future or about other things or groups

name: extravagant
trans: adj. more than is usual, necessary, or proper 过度的，浪费的

sentences.english: Would it be too extravagant to buy both?
sentences.chinese: 把两个都买下会不会太奢侈了？

sentences.english: an extravagant lifestyle
sentences.chinese: 奢侈的生活方式

sentences.english: an extravagant display of loyalty
sentences.chinese: 过分表露忠诚

sentences.english: Don’t be too extravagant with the wine.
sentences.chinese: 不要酗酒。

detailed_translations.english: spending or costing a lot of money, especially more than is necessary or more than you can afford

name: extremist
trans: n. people who use violent or extreme methods 极端分子

sentences.english: The bomb was planted by right-wing extremists.
sentences.chinese: 炸弹是右翼极端分子放置的。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has extreme political opinions and aims, and who is willing to do unusual or illegal things in order to achieve them

name: exuberant
trans: adj. very lively, happy, or energetic 热情洋溢的
adj. existing in large amounts 过度的

sentences.english: exube-rant carvings
sentences.chinese: 充满生气的雕刻品

detailed_translations.chinese: 繁茂的；生气勃勃的，充溢的
detailed_translations.english: exuberant decorations, patterns etc are exciting and complicated or colourful

name: eye-catching
trans: adj. very noticeable 引人注目的

name: facile
trans: adj. not showing enough thought or effort 肤浅的，轻率的

sentences.english: facile generalizations
sentences.chinese: 肤浅的概括

detailed_translations.english: a facile remark, argument etc is too simple and shows a lack of careful thought or understanding

name: facilitate
trans: v. help bring about 促进，加快

sentences.english: The new trade agreement should facilitate more rapid economic growth.
sentences.chinese: 新贸易协定应当会加快经济发展。

sentences.english: Structured teaching facilitates learning.
sentences.chinese: 有条理的教导有利于学习。

detailed_translations.english: to make an action or a process possible or easier

name: factious
trans: adj. of or relating to faction 宗派的，派系的

detailed_translations.chinese: 好捣乱的；好搞派系的；源于派别的
detailed_translations.english: given to, producing, or characterized by faction

name: fairness
trans: n. the act of treating people in a way that does not favor some over others 公平

sentences.english: the basic fairness of the judicial system
sentences.chinese: 司法制度的基本公正性

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being fair

name: fallacious
trans: adj. containing a mistake 谬误的

sentences.english: Such an argument is misleading, if not wholly fallacious.
sentences.chinese: 这种论点即使不完全是谬误，也是误导人的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 谬误的；骗人的；靠不住的；不合理的
detailed_translations.english: containing or based on false ideas

name: fanciful
trans: adj. coming from the imagination 想象的
adj. existing in fancy only 不切实际的

sentences.english: a fanciful story
sentences.chinese: 想象出来的故事

sentences.english: The suggestion that there was a conspiracy is not entirely fanciful.
sentences.chinese: 说有人在搞阴谋，这并不完全是臆想。

detailed_translations.english: imagined rather than based on facts – often used to show disapproval

name: fascinate
trans: v. to cause to be very interested in 使着迷

sentences.english: Politics fascinated Franklin's father.
sentences.chinese: 政治让富兰克林的父亲着迷。

detailed_translations.english: If something fascinates you, it interests and delights you so much that your thoughts tend to concentrate on it

name: fastidious
trans: adj. showing or demanding excessive delicacy or care 挑剔的，极其注重细节的

sentences.english: people who are fastidious about personal hygiene
sentences.chinese: 十分讲究个人卫生的人

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑剔的；苛求的，难取悦的；（微生物等）需要复杂营养地
detailed_translations.english: very careful about small details in your appearance, work etc

name: fathom
trans: v. to penetrate and come to understand 理解

sentences.english: I still can’t fathom out what she meant.
sentences.chinese: 我还是弄不清她的意思。

detailed_translations.chinese: 看穿；彻底了解；测量…的深度
detailed_translations.english: to understand what something means after thinking about it carefully

detailed_translations.chinese: 英寻（测量水深的长度单位）
detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring the depth of water, equal to six feet or about 1.8 metres

name: faultless
trans: adj. irreproachable 无可挑剔的

sentences.english: a faultless performance
sentences.chinese: 完美的表现

detailed_translations.english: having no mistakes

name: favorable
trans: adj. showing approval 赞同的
adj. marked by success 有利的

sentences.english: favourable film reviews
sentences.chinese: 正面的影评

sentences.english: The response has been overwhelmingly favorable.
sentences.chinese: 回应是一边倒的肯定。

detailed_translations.english: a favourable report, opinion, or reaction shows that you think that someone or something is good or that you agree with them

name: fealty
trans: n. loyalty to a person, group, etc. 忠诚

sentences.english: When they act with predictability, restraint, and fealty to the rule of law, ordinary people gain faith in their government.
sentences.chinese: 当警察的行为有规可循、有节制并忠诚于法治时，会加深普通人民对政府的信任。

sentences.english: Whether a 17th-century swordsman in the service of a local warlord or a 21st-century turbine engineer, Japanese are brought up with a strong sense of fealty and duty.
sentences.chinese: 无论是一个17世纪的剑客服务于当地军阀，或是一个21世纪的涡轮工程师，日本养成了一种强烈的忠诚和责任意识。

sentences.english: Inside that circle a wholesome, tacit emotional feudalism develops: you give me protection, I’ll give you fealty.
sentences.chinese: 在这个圈子里一个有益健康的、心照不宣的传统情感的建立:你给我保护，我回报忠诚。

detailed_translations.english: loyalty to a king, queen etc

name: feckless
trans: adj. having or resulting from a weak character or nature 软弱的

sentences.english: Alice’s feckless younger brother
sentences.chinese: 艾丽斯那个没出息的弟弟

detailed_translations.chinese: 无效的；软弱的；没精神的；不负责任的；无气力的
detailed_translations.english: lacking determination, and not achieving anything in your life

name: feeble
trans: adj. markedly lacking in strength 虚弱的

sentences.english: His voice sounded feeble and far away.
sentences.chinese: 他的声音听上去既无力又遥远。

sentences.english: She was too feeble to leave her room.
sentences.chinese: 她身体虚弱，无法走出自己的房间。

detailed_translations.chinese: 虚弱的， 衰弱的， 无力的； 无效的， 无益的
detailed_translations.english: extremely weak

name: feedback
trans: n. helpful information or criticism that is given to someone to say what can be done to improve a performance, product, etc. 反馈

sentences.english: How can I provide feedback without making someone angry?
sentences.chinese: 我怎样才能提出反馈意见又不会得罪人呢？

detailed_translations.english: advice, criticism etc about how successful or useful something is

name: feigned
trans: adj. not genuine or real 假的

detailed_translations.chinese: 假装的； 假的； 不真诚的

name: fervor
trans: n. a strong feeling of excitement and enthusiasm 热忱

sentences.english: He took up the cause with evangelical fervor .
sentences.chinese: 他以传道者般的热情投身于这一事业。

sentences.english: The cathedral at Chartres is an expression of the religious fervor of the Middle Ages.
sentences.chinese: 在查特雷斯的大教堂是中世纪时期宗教热情的表现之一。

sentences.english: As social conflicts continue tosharpen, the party needs to divert attention, and of course a parade is a goodway to do that by whipping up nationalist fervor.
sentences.chinese: 随着社会冲突继续深化，中共需要转移人们的注意力，而阅兵就是实现这一点的好办法，可以激起人们的民族主义热情。

name: fester
trans: v. to become worse as time passes 恶化

sentences.english: festering sores
sentences.chinese: 溃烂的疮

detailed_translations.english: if a wound festers, it becomes infected

name: fickle
trans: adj. changing often 善变的

sentences.english: an unpredictable and fickle lover
sentences.chinese: 一个捉摸不透、三心二意的情人

detailed_translations.chinese: 浮躁的；易变的；变幻无常的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is fickle is always changing their mind about people or things that they like, so that you cannot depend on them – used to show disapproval

name: fiery
trans: adj. full of or exuding emotion or spirit 热烈的
adj. easily provoked 暴躁的

sentences.english: He has a fiery temper .
sentences.chinese: 他脾气火爆。

detailed_translations.chinese: 热烈的，炽烈的；暴躁的；燃烧般的
detailed_translations.english: becoming angry or excited very quickly

name: figurative
trans: adj. showing people and things in a way that resembles how they really look 比喻的，象征的

sentences.english: He’s my son, in the figurative sense of the word.
sentences.chinese: 打个比方，他就像是我的儿子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比喻的；修饰丰富的；形容多的
detailed_translations.english: a figurative word or phrase is used in a different way from its usual meaning, to give you a particular idea or picture in your mind

name: filter
trans: n. a device that is used to remove something unwanted from a liquid or gas that passes through it 过滤器

sentences.english: The water in the tank is constantly filtered.
sentences.chinese: 鱼缸里的水在不停地被过滤。

sentences.english: The ozone layer filters harmful UV rays from the sun.
sentences.chinese: 臭氧层过滤掉有害的太阳紫外线。

sentences.english: coffee filter papers
sentences.chinese: 咖啡滤纸

sentences.english: filter cigarettes (= with a filter at the end )
sentences.chinese: 过滤嘴香烟

detailed_translations.english: to remove unwanted substances from water, air etc by passing it through a special substance or piece of equipment
something that you pass water, air etc through in order to remove unwanted substances and make it clean or suitable to use

name: fitting
trans: adj. of a kink that is appropriate for the situation or purpose 合适的

sentences.english: I thought the memorial was a fitting tribute to the President.
sentences.chinese: 我认为这座纪念碑恰如其分地表达了对总统的敬意。

sentences.english: new light fittings
sentences.chinese: 新款灯具配件

detailed_translations.english: right for a particular situation or occasion
an outside part of a piece of equipment that makes it possible to use or handle it

name: fixated
trans: adj. arrested in development or adjustment 过分迷恋的

name: flagrant
trans: adj. conspicuously offensive 明目张胆的

sentences.english: His failure to turn his attention to flagrant wastes of public money is inexcusable.
sentences.chinese: 他未能注意到公共资金的公然浪费，这是不可原谅的。

sentences.english: In a world flagrant with the failures of civilization, what is there particularly immortal about our own?~G. K. Chesterton.
sentences.chinese: 在一个世界公然与文明的失败，有什么特别的不朽的自己?~G.K。切斯特顿。

detailed_translations.chinese: 罪恶昭彰的； 公然的
detailed_translations.english: a flagrant action is shocking because it is done in a way that is easily noticed and shows no respect for laws, truth etc

name: fleeting
trans: adj. lasting for only a short time 短暂的

sentences.english: Time is fleeting.; Time flies.
sentences.chinese: 时光飞逝。

sentences.english: I watched, smiling, knowing how fleeting these moments when they are small are.
sentences.chinese: 我微笑的看着这一切，我知道这个时刻是多么的短暂。

sentences.english: Most touches were only about five seconds, but in these fleeting moments, we’re capable of communicating distinct emotions, just as we are with the face.
sentences.chinese: 大部分触摸只有五秒左右，然而就是在这么短暂的时间里，我们有能力传达明确的情绪，正像我们通过表情所做的那样。

name: flexibility
trans: n. the state of being easily changed 灵活性，适应性

sentences.english: Employees expect flexibility in the workplace.
sentences.chinese: 员工们盼望工作安排有弹性。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to change or be changed easily to suit a different situation

name: flourish
trans: v. to grow well 繁茂
v. to be very successful 兴旺
v. to hold up and show in an excited or proud way 炫耀

sentences.english: He took his cap from under his arm with a flourish and pulled it low over his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他挥手从腋下取出帽子，拉低帽檐盖住眼睛。

sentences.english: He flourished the glass to emphasize the point.
sentences.chinese: 他挥舞着杯子来强调这一点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 兴旺；茂盛；挥舞；炫耀；华饰
detailed_translations.english: a curved line that you use to decorate writing
If you flourish an object, you wave it about in a way that makes people notice it

name: flout
trans: v. to break or ignore without hiding what you are doing or showing fear of shame 公然藐视

sentences.english: ...illegal campers who persist in flouting the law.
sentences.chinese: …一向无视法律的非法露营者。

detailed_translations.english: If you flout something such as a law, an order, or an accepted way of behaving, you deliberately do not obey it or follow it

name: fluctuate
trans: v. to change level, strength, or value frequently 波动，摇摆不定

sentences.english: Insect populations fluctuate wildly from year to year.
sentences.chinese: 昆虫的数量每年变化很大。

sentences.english: Prices were volatile, fluctuating between 20 and 40.
sentences.chinese: 价格不稳定，在20至40美元之间波动。

detailed_translations.english: to change frequently in size, amount, quality, etc., especially from one extreme to another

name: flummery
trans: n. mummery, mumbo jumbo 假恭维，胡言乱语

name: flummox
trans: v. confuse 使困惑

name: flush with
trans: v. 由于...而脸红

name: forbear
trans: v. to choose not to do 克制

sentences.english: I forbore to comment on this.
sentences.chinese: 我不欲评论它

detailed_translations.english: to not do something you could or would like to do because you think it is wiser not to
a  forebear

name: foreground
trans: v. to make more important 使重要，使显眼
n. an important position 重要位置

sentences.english: There were three figures in the foreground.
sentences.chinese: 前景有三个人。

detailed_translations.english: the part of the view in a picture or a photograph that is closest to you when you are looking at it

name: forerunner
trans: n. someone or something that comes before another 先驱
n. a sign of something that is going to happen 预兆

sentences.english: ...a machine which, in some respects, was the forerunner of the modern helicopter.
sentences.chinese: …一台在某些方面是现代直升飞机的前身的机器。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that existed before something similar that developed or came later

name: foresee
trans: v. to see beforehand 预见

sentences.english: I’ve put your name on the list and I don’t foresee any problems.
sentences.chinese: 我把你的名字写在名单上了，估计不会有什么问题。

sentences.english: The disaster could not have been foreseen.
sentences.chinese: 这场灾难是始料未及的。

detailed_translations.english: to think or know that something is going to happen in the future

name: foresight
trans: n. the ability to see what will or might happen in the future 先见之明

sentences.english: It was an example of the authorities’ lack of foresight .
sentences.chinese: 这是当权者缺乏远见的一个例证。

detailed_translations.chinese: 先见，远见；预见；深谋远虑
detailed_translations.english: the ability to imagine what is likely to happen and to consider this when planning for the future

name: forestall
trans: v. to stop from happening or to cause to happen at a later time 预先阻止
v. to act before in order to prevent something 提前行动

sentences.english: a measure intended to forestall further attacks
sentences.chinese: 意在预先阻止进一步攻击的措施

detailed_translations.chinese: 先发制人，预先阻止；垄断，屯积；领先；占先一步
detailed_translations.english: to prevent something from happening or prevent someone from doing something by doing something first

name: forge
trans: v. to form by heating and hammering 锻造
v. to make or imitate falsely especially with intent to defraud 伪造

sentences.english: Someone stole my credit card and forged my signature.
sentences.chinese: 有人偷了我的信用卡，并假冒我的签名。

sentences.english: a forged passport
sentences.chinese: 假护照

detailed_translations.english: to move somewhere or continue doing something in a steady determined way
to illegally copy something, especially something printed or written, to make people think that it is real
a place where metal is heated and shaped into objects

name: forgo
trans: v. to give up the use or enjoyment of 放弃

sentences.english: I had to forgo lunch.
sentences.chinese: 我只得放弃午餐。

detailed_translations.english: to not do or have something pleasant or enjoyable

name: formidable
trans: adj. causing fear, dread, or apprehension 可怕的
adj. tending to inspire awe or wonder 令人敬畏的
adj. very difficult to deal with 难对付的

sentences.english: The building is grey, formidable, not at all picturesque.
sentences.chinese: 那幢建筑呈灰色，气势凛然，与漂亮沾不上边。

sentences.english: The new range of computers have formidable processing power.
sentences.chinese: 该系列的新型计算机处理能力惊人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可怕的；令人敬畏的，令人惊叹的
detailed_translations.english: very powerful or impressive, and often frightening

name: formulaic
trans: adj. being not original and having been used many times before in similar situations 老套的，公式化的

sentences.english: Children love jokes and riddles that are heavily formulaic.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子喜欢一些充满套语的笑话和谜语。

detailed_translations.english: containing or made from ideas or expressions that have been used many times before and are therefore not very new or interesting

name: forsake
trans: v. to give up or leave entirely 抛弃

sentences.english: She will never forsake her vegetarian principles.
sentences.chinese: 她绝不会放弃自己的素食主义原则。

detailed_translations.english: to stop doing, using, or having something that you enjoy

name: foster
trans: v. affording, receiving, or sharing nurture or parental care though not related by blood or legal ties 养育
v. to help grow or develop 促进

sentences.english: The bishop helped foster the sense of a community embracing all classes.
sentences.chinese: 主教鼓励一种包容各个阶层的社区精神。

sentences.english: The couple wanted to adopt a black child they had been fostering.
sentences.chinese: 那对夫妇想收养他们代养的一个黑人小孩。

detailed_translations.english: to help a skill, feeling, idea etc develop over a period of time

name: foundation
trans: n. the act of founding 创建
n. a basis upon which something stands or is supported 基础，根据

sentences.english: It took the builders three weeks to lay the foundations .
sentences.chinese: 建筑工人花了三星期的时间打地基。

sentences.english: The earthquake shook the foundations of the house.
sentences.chinese: 地震动摇了那幢房子的地基。

sentences.english: the British Heart Foundation
sentences.chinese: 英国心脏病基金会

detailed_translations.english: the solid layer of  cement  , bricks, stones etc that is put under a building to support it

name: founder
trans: v. to experience failure 失败
n. one founds or establishes 创建人

sentences.english: Their marriage began to founder soon after the honeymoon.
sentences.chinese: 他们的婚姻在蜜月之后不久便触礁了。

detailed_translations.english: to fail after a period of time because something has gone wrong
someone who establishes a business, organization, school etc

name: fractious
trans: adj. full of anger and disagreement 易怒的
adj. hard to manage or control 难对付的

sentences.english: Children become fractious when they are tired.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子累了就容易发脾气。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易怒的；倔强的，难以对待的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is fractious becomes angry very easily

name: fraudulent
trans: adj. done to trick someone for the purpose of getting something valuable 欺骗性的

sentences.english: a fraudulent insurance claim
sentences.chinese: 欺诈性保险索赔

sentences.english: a fraudulent statement
sentences.chinese: 骗人的声明

detailed_translations.english: intended to deceive people in an illegal way, in order to gain money, power etc

name: fringe
trans: n. edge, periphery 边缘

sentences.english: a tall girl with straight brown hair and a fringe
sentences.chinese: 一头棕色直发、留着刘海的高个子女孩

sentences.english: The monarchists are a small fringe group who quarrel fiercely among themselves.
sentences.chinese: 君主制拥护者们是个边缘性小团体，内部争吵激烈。

detailed_translations.english: if you have a fringe, your hair is cut so that it hangs down over your forehead
Fringe groups or events are less important or popular than other related groups or events

name: frugal
trans: adj. simple and plain 简朴的

sentences.english: As children we were taught to be frugal and hard-working.
sentences.chinese: 我们小时候被教育要节俭和勤劳。

sentences.english: He led a remarkably frugal existence.
sentences.chinese: 他过着极其节俭的生活。

detailed_translations.chinese: 节俭的；朴素的；花钱少的
detailed_translations.english: careful to buy only what is necessary

name: frustrating
trans: adj. causing feelings of anger and annoyance 令人沮丧的

sentences.english: My job can be very frustrating sometimes.
sentences.chinese: 有时候我的工作令人很沮丧。

sentences.english: This is an immensely frustrating experience for the student.
sentences.chinese: 对于学生来说，这是非常令人沮丧的经历。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel annoyed, upset, or impatient because you cannot do what you want to do

name: fund
trans: n. an amount of money that is used for a special purpose 资金
v. to provide money for 为…提供资金

sentences.english: The fund was set up to try to save the cathedral.
sentences.chinese: 设立基金以挽救大教堂。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that is collected and kept for a particular purpose
to provide money for an activity, organization, event etc

name: fundamental
trans: adj. forming or relating to the most important part of something 基本的，根本的

sentences.english: We have to tackle the fundamental cause of the problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须解决问题的根本原因。

sentences.english: the fundamental principles of liberty and equality
sentences.chinese: 自由和平等这两个基本原则

detailed_translations.english: relating to the most basic and important parts of something

name: fungible
trans: adj. interchangeable 可取代的

sentences.english: Oil is a globally traded and fully fungible commodity making it difficult for a producer to reliably cut off a customer.
sentences.chinese: 石油是全球交易、并完全可替代的大宗商品，产油国很难有效孤立某一家顾客。

sentences.english: Where the depository keeps any other fungible item it may return any item of the same type quality and quantity in accordance with the contract.
sentences.chinese: 保管其他可替代物的，可以按照约定返还相同种类、品质、数量的物品。

sentences.english: Goods which are not fungible shall be deemed fungible for the purposes of this act to the extent that under a particular agreement or document unlike units are treated as equivalents.
sentences.chinese: 为本法的目的，并使在一项特定协议或档中的不相似单位也可被视为相等物，则非可替代货物应被视为可替代的。

name: fusion
trans: n. a combination or mixture of things 融合

sentences.english: Her work is a fusion of several different styles.
sentences.chinese: 她的作品是几种不同风格的融合。

sentences.english: the best fusion cuisine in the whole of Vancouver
sentences.chinese: 全温哥华最好的混合料理

detailed_translations.chinese: 融合；熔化；熔接；融合物；[物] 核聚变
detailed_translations.english: a combination of separate qualities or ideas

name: fusty
trans: adj. full of dust and unpleasant smells 霉臭的
adj. very old-fashioned 守旧的

sentences.english: fusty old academics
sentences.chinese: 古板的老学究

detailed_translations.chinese: 霉臭的； 陈腐的， 过时的
detailed_translations.english: if rooms, clothes, buildings etc are fusty, they have an unpleasant smell, because they have not been used for a long time

name: futile
trans: adj. pointless or useless 无用的

sentences.english: My efforts to go back to sleep proved futile.
sentences.chinese: 我努力想再次入睡，但怎么也睡不着。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无用的；无效的；没有出息的；琐细的；不重要的
detailed_translations.english: actions that are futile are useless because they have no chance of being successful

name: futurity
trans: n. time to come: future 未来

name: gaffe
trans: n. a mistake made in a social situation 失礼

sentences.english: The consul’s comments were a major diplomatic gaffe.
sentences.chinese: 领事的评论是一次重大的外交失言。

detailed_translations.english: an embarrassing mistake made in a social situation or in public

name: gainsay
trans: v. to declare to be untrue or invalid 否认

sentences.english: No one dared to gainsay him.
sentences.chinese: 没有人敢反驳他。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something is not true, or to disagree with someone

name: galvanize
trans: v. to stimulate or excite as if by an electric shock 激励

sentences.english: The report galvanized world opinion.
sentences.chinese: 这篇报道一出，世界舆论一片哗然。

detailed_translations.english: to shock or surprise someone so that they do something to solve a problem, improve a situation etc

name: garrulous
trans: adj. tending to talk a lot 喋喋不休的

sentences.english: Ian isn’t normally this garrulous!
sentences.chinese: 伊恩一般不这么唠叨！

detailed_translations.chinese: 唠叨的；喋喋不休的；多嘴的
detailed_translations.english: always talking a lot

name: gauge
trans: v. to measure exactly 估计，判断
n. an instrument that is used for measuring something 衡量仪器

sentences.english: Retail sales are a gauge of consumer spending.
sentences.chinese: 零售额是衡量消费支出的一个标准。

detailed_translations.chinese: 计量器；标准尺寸；容量规格
detailed_translations.english: an instrument for measuring the size or amount of something
to measure or calculate something by using a particular instrument or method

name: general
trans: adj. involving, applicable to, or affecting the whole 普遍的
adj. not specific 笼统的

sentences.english: There has been a general decline in standards.
sentences.chinese: 道德水准普遍下降。

sentences.english: ways to improve your general health
sentences.chinese: 全面提高身体素质的方法

sentences.english: There is one exception to this general principle.
sentences.chinese: 这个一般性原则有一例外

sentences.english: a four-star general
sentences.chinese: 四星上将

detailed_translations.english: affecting all or most people, places or things
an officer of very high rank in the army or air force

name: generate
trans: v. to produce or cause to be produced 产生

sentences.english: a useful technique for generating new ideas
sentences.chinese: 能产生新创意的有用技术

sentences.english: The program would generate a lot of new jobs.
sentences.chinese: 这个项目将创造许多新的就业岗位。

detailed_translations.english: to produce or cause something

name: generic
trans: adj. of or relating to a whole group or class 通用的

sentences.english: With this generic list node structure, you can now define lists and list operations that work regardless of the type of data stored in them.
sentences.chinese: 使用这个通用的列表节点结构，您现在可以定义列表和不需要考虑存储在列表中的数据类型的列表操作。

sentences.english: If your client code needs this kind of specific functionality, then this generic layer is not enough -- at least as it has been described so far.
sentences.chinese: 如果您的客户机代码需要这种特定的功能，那么这个一般层是不够的 ― 至少从迄今对它描述来看是不够的。

name: genial
trans: adj. kind and friendly 友善的

sentences.english: a genial smile
sentences.chinese: 亲切的微笑

detailed_translations.chinese: 亲切的，友好的；和蔼的；适宜的
detailed_translations.english: friendly and happy

name: genius
trans: n. a very smart or talented person 天才
n. great natural ability 天赋

sentences.english: The film reveals Fellini’s genius.
sentences.chinese: 这部影片展现了费里尼的天赋。

sentences.english: a work of pure genius
sentences.chinese: 天才之作

detailed_translations.english: a very high level of intelligence, mental skill, or ability, which only a few people have

name: germane
trans: adj. relating to a subject in an appropriate way 密切相关的

sentences.english: ...the suppression of a number of documents which were very germane to the case.
sentences.chinese: ...对几份与本案密切相关的文件的隐瞒。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有密切关系的；贴切的；恰当的
detailed_translations.english: an idea, remark etc that is germane to something is related to it in an important and suitable way

name: given
trans: adj. specified, fixed 特定的，固定的

sentences.english: On any given day in the Houston area, half the hospital beds are empty.
sentences.chinese: 在休斯敦地区，任何一天医院的床位都有一半是空的。

sentences.english: The rules are to be followed in any given situation.
sentences.chinese: 这些规则在任何情况下都要遵守。

detailed_translations.chinese: 规定的，特定的；假设的；已知的；有癖好的，有倾向的
detailed_translations.english: any particular time, situation, amount etc that is being used as an example
taking something into account

name: glean
trans: v. to gather or collect in a gradual way 搜集，获取

sentences.english: At present we're gleaning information from all sources.
sentences.chinese: 目前我们正从所有渠道慢慢收集信息。

detailed_translations.english: to collect grain that has been left behind after the crops have been cut

name: gloat
trans: v. to show in an improper or selfish way that you are happy with you own success or another person’s failure 幸灾乐祸

sentences.english: Don't gloat,the same misfortune may happen to you one day.
sentences.chinese: 不要幸灾乐祸，说不定同样的不幸会落到你的头上。

sentences.english: Yet, in announcing the news to the United States and the world, Obama was careful not to gloat, as his predecessor George W Bush might well have done had the killing taken place under his watch.
sentences.chinese: 然而，在向美国和世界宣布这个消息时，奥巴马却显的小心谨慎，没有表现出一点幸灾乐祸，因为他的前任乔治·布什任期内没有完成的事情被他完成了。

sentences.english: It is easy to gloat when the cool jock with the hot girlfriend wrecks his sweet car, especially if he seems kind of smug.
sentences.chinese: 当酷酷的大学运动员和热辣的女友坐他的爱车失事后，特别是这人有些自以为是，那么幸灾乐祸的想法是很自然会产生的。

name: gloomy
trans: adj. sad or depressed 忧郁的

sentences.english: The report paints a gloomy picture of the economy.
sentences.chinese: 这篇报告描绘了一幅惨淡的经济现状。

detailed_translations.chinese: 忧郁的， 沮丧的； 令人沮丧的； 昏暗的， 阴沉的
detailed_translations.english: making you feel that things will not improve

name: glut
trans: n. too much of something 过量

name: goose bumps
trans: n. small bumps on your skin that are caused by cold, fear, or a sudden feeling of excitement 鸡皮疙瘩

name: govern
trans: v. to exercise continuous sovereign authority over 治理
v. to control or guide the actions of 决定

sentences.english: the leaders who govern the country
sentences.chinese: 治理这个国家的领导人

sentences.english: The party had been governing for seven months.
sentences.chinese: 该党执政已经有七个月了。

sentences.english: The universe is governed by the laws of physics.
sentences.chinese: 宇宙受到物理法则的支配。

detailed_translations.english: to officially and legally control a country and make all the decisions about taxes, laws, public services etc

name: grandiose
trans: adj. characterized by affectation of grandeur or splendor or by absurd exaggeration 浮夸的
adj. impressive because of uncommon largeness, scope, effect, or grandeur 宏伟的

sentences.english: The lack of such leaders may also be the hallmark of a largely post-ideological era in which far less need is felt for unifying doctrines or the grandiose figures who provide them.
sentences.chinese: 这种领袖人物的缺乏可能也是一个大后意识形态时代的重要象征，在这个时代，人们更少需要一个统一的教义或是一个提供给大众的浮夸形象。

detailed_translations.chinese: 宏伟的；堂皇的；浮夸的；宏大的
detailed_translations.english: grandiose plans sound very important or impressive, but are not practical

name: gratify
trans: v. to make happy or satisfied 使满足，使高兴

sentences.english: He was gratified by Lucy’s response.
sentences.chinese: 他对露西的回答很满意。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel pleased and satisfied

name: gregarious
trans: adj. marked by or indicating a liking for companionship 爱交际的
adj. growing in a cluster or colony 群居的

sentences.english: She is such a gregarious and outgoing person.
sentences.chinese: 她就是这样一个爱社交而且外向的人。

detailed_translations.english: friendly and preferring to be with other people

name: groundless
trans: adj. not based on facts 无根据的

sentences.english: Fortunately my suspicions proved groundless .
sentences.chinese: 幸好我的猜疑后来证明是没有根据的。

sentences.english: Mr Kay’s lawyer said the accusations were groundless.
sentences.chinese: 凯先生的律师说这是无端的指控。

detailed_translations.english: not based on facts or reason

name: guardian
trans: n. someone or something that washes or protects something 保护人

sentences.english: Destiny's legal guardian was her grandmother.
sentences.chinese: 德斯蒂妮的法定监护人是她的祖母。

detailed_translations.chinese: [法] 监护人，保护人；守护者
detailed_translations.english: someone who is legally responsible for looking after someone else’s child, especially after the child’s parents have died

name: guile
trans: n. deceitful cunning 奸诈

sentences.english: With a little guile she might get what she wanted.
sentences.chinese: 她略施小计，也许就能得到自己想要的东西。

detailed_translations.english: the use of clever but dishonest methods to deceive someone

name: hail
trans: v. to greet with enthusiastic approval 称赞

sentences.english: heavy showers of rain and hail
sentences.chinese: 夹着冰雹的阵阵大雨

detailed_translations.english: frozen raindrops which fall as hard balls of ice

detailed_translations.chinese: 致敬；招呼；向欢呼；猛发；使像下雹样落下（过去式hailed，过去分词hailed，现在分词hailing，第三人称单数hails）
detailed_translations.english: to call to someone in order to greet them or try to attract their attention

name: half-formulated
trans: adj. 半成品的

name: halfhearted
trans: adj. feeling or showing a lack of interest or enthusiasm 不热情的

sentences.english: ...a halfhearted apology.
sentences.chinese: …一个半心半意的道歉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不认真的， 不热心的

name: hallmark
trans: n. a quality, ability, etc., that is typical of a particular person or thing 特点

detailed_translations.english: an idea, method, or quality that is typical of a particular person or thing

detailed_translations.chinese: 给…盖上品质证明印记；使具有…标志
detailed_translations.english: to put a hallmark on silver, gold, or platinum

name: hallow
trans: v. to respect greatly 极其崇敬

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…视为神圣； 尊敬， 敬畏
detailed_translations.english: to consecrate or set apart as being holy

name: hamper
trans: v. to slow the movement, progress, or action of 阻碍

sentences.english: She tried to run, but was hampered by her heavy suitcase.
sentences.chinese: 她想跑，但沉重的旅行箱拖累了她。

sentences.english: An attempt to rescue the men has been hampered by bad weather.
sentences.chinese: 对那几名男子的营救行动受到恶劣天气的阻碍。

detailed_translations.english: to make it difficult for someone to do something
a basket with a lid, which is used for carrying food or sending it to someone as a present

name: hamstring
trans: v. to damage or ruin the force or effectiveness of 使无能为力

sentences.english: Meanwhile, work on strengthening and stretching your hip, hamstring and lower-back muscles.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时还要拉伸和增强你臀部、腿筋和腰背部的肌肉。

sentences.english: Far more telling was the correlation between the various runners’ tight or loose hamstring muscles and their running economy, a measure of how much oxygen they used while striding.
sentences.chinese: 进一步讲，不同跑步者腿筋肌的松紧和步伐频率是有联系的，这是一种对他们在跨步行进时耗氧量的评估。

sentences.english: For stretching, focus on the hamstring stretch, the hip &lower-back stretch, and the hamstring &back stretch.
sentences.chinese: 拉伸方面——特别要关注腿筋拉伸、髋关节和腰背部拉伸、腿筋和背部锻炼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 切断腿筋使成跛腿；使残废

name: haphazard
trans: adj. having no plan, order, or direction 随意的

sentences.english: It was strings of words borrowed from the different languages around them and put together in sort of haphazard ways.
sentences.chinese: 它只不过是从身边的不同语言当中,借用了一些单词串,以随意的方式将它们放在一起

sentences.english: All the master had to do was shake the tree a little and the garden was full of leaves again, spread out in haphazard patterns.
sentences.chinese: 大师什么都没有做，只是摇了摇树。 花园又重新被凋落的树叶覆盖了，整个花园展现出随意的样式。

name: harmonize
trans: v. to bring into consonance or accord 使一致

sentences.english: the proposal to harmonize tax levels throughout the EU
sentences.chinese: 统一欧盟税率水平的提议

detailed_translations.chinese: 使和谐；使一致；以和声唱
detailed_translations.english: if two or more things harmonize, they work well together or look good together

name: harsh
trans: adj. having a coarse uneven surface that is rough or unpleasant to the touch 粗糙的
adj. unduly exacting 严厉的
adj. severe or cruel 残酷的

sentences.english: The hostages are being held in harsh conditions.
sentences.chinese: 人质被拘押在恶劣环境中。

sentences.english: a young girl suddenly exposed to the harsh realities of life
sentences.chinese: 骤然暴露于残酷现实生活中的小女孩

detailed_translations.english: harsh conditions are difficult to live in and very uncomfortable

name: hasty
trans: adj. fast and typically superficial 匆忙的，草率的

sentences.english: He soon regretted his hasty decision.
sentences.chinese: 他很快就对自己仓促作出的决定感到后悔了。

sentences.english: a hasty breakfast
sentences.chinese: 匆忙吃下的一顿早餐

detailed_translations.chinese: 轻率的；匆忙的；草率的；懈怠的
detailed_translations.english: done in a hurry, especially with bad results

name: heartless
trans: adj. very cruel 残酷的

sentences.english: How can you be so heartless?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么能如此无情呢？

detailed_translations.english: cruel and not feeling any pity

name: hedge
trans: v. to avoid giving a promise or direct answer 回避

sentences.english: You’re hedging again - have you got the money or haven’t you?
sentences.chinese: 你又在闪烁其词了，你究竟有没有钱？

sentences.english: ‘That depends on my partner,’ she hedged.
sentences.chinese: “那取决于我的合伙人。”她避重就轻地答道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 避免直接回答；   套头交易； 以套期保值避免损失
detailed_translations.english: to avoid giving a direct answer to a question

detailed_translations.chinese: 保值措施；套期保值；树篱；防备；障碍物；套头，两面下注以避免损失
detailed_translations.english: a row of small bushes or trees growing close together, usually dividing one field or garden from another

name: heed
trans: v. to pay attention to 注意，留心

sentences.english: The government was taking little heed of these threats.
sentences.chinese: 政府对这些威胁几乎不当回事。

sentences.english: Tom paid no heed to her warning.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆根本没有理会她的警告。

detailed_translations.english: to pay attention to something, especially something someone says, and seriously consider it
to pay attention to someone’s advice or warning

name: helter-skelter
trans: adj. marked by a lack of order or plan 杂乱的

name: heterodox
trans: adj. not agreeing with established beliefs or standards 异端的

detailed_translations.english: heterodox beliefs, practices etc are not approved of by a particular group, especially a religious one

name: heterogeneous
trans: adj. made up of parts that are different 各种各样的

sentences.english: a heterogeneous collection of buildings
sentences.chinese: 风格各异的一组建筑

detailed_translations.chinese: [化学] 多相的；异种的；[化学] 不均匀的；由不同成分形成的
detailed_translations.english: consisting of parts or members that are very different from each other

name: hew to
trans: phrase. 遵守

name: hidebound
trans: adj. not willing to accept new or different ideas 迂腐守旧的

sentences.english: hidebound reactionaries
sentences.chinese: 古板的反动分子

detailed_translations.chinese: 死板的；保守的；顽固的；墨守成规的
detailed_translations.english: having old-fashioned attitudes and ideas – used to show disapproval

name: hierarchical
trans: adj. of, relating to, or arranged in a hierarchy 等级制度的

sentences.english: ...the traditional hierarchical system of military organization.
sentences.chinese: …军事组织内的传统等级制度。

detailed_translations.english: if a system, organization etc is hierarchical, people or things are divided into levels of importance

name: high-minded
trans: adj. having strong moral principles 高尚的

name: hinder
trans: v. to make slow or difficult 妨碍

sentences.english: His career has been hindered by injury.
sentences.chinese: 由于受伤，他的事业受到了阻碍。

sentences.english: policies that will hinder rather than help families
sentences.chinese: 对家庭有害无益的政策

detailed_translations.english: to make it difficult for something to develop or succeed

name: hitch
trans: n. a hidden problem that makes something more complicated or difficult to do 故障

sentences.english: The whole show went without a hitch .
sentences.chinese: 整场演出进行得非常顺利。

detailed_translations.english: a small problem that makes something difficult or delays it for a short time

detailed_translations.chinese: 搭便车；钩住；套住；猛拉；使结婚
detailed_translations.english: to get free rides from the drivers of passing cars by standing at the side of the road and putting a hand out with the thumb raised

name: hodgepodge
trans: n. a mixture of different things 大杂烩

sentences.english: Your last paragraph made it very clear to me that Benjamin's work is basically a hodgepodge from Kantian rationality through to more updated theories.
sentences.chinese: 你最后一段话让它很清楚的告诉我，本雅明的工作是基本上一个大杂烩，从康德的批判理性一直到更新的理论。

sentences.english: When it comes to spreading ridicule, the Web is now a hodgepodge of celebrity takedowns and videos of ugly brides or of kids who can't sing in the school play.
sentences.chinese: 网络已经成为传播尴尬事情的主渠道，其内容堪比大杂烩，既有名人的露丑记录，又有难看的新娘，还有在学校表演中唱不出歌的小孩子。

sentences.english: Singapore is an extraordinary hodgepodge of health care principles, but it's also a city-state whose health care system is comprised of fewer than 30 hospitals.
sentences.chinese: 新加坡的医疗体系不仅仅是一个各种医疗政策的大杂烩，可惜新加坡本身只是一个仅有30家医院的城市国家。

name: homogeneity
trans: n. the state of having identical cumulative distribution function or values
同质

sentences.english: The theory is based on the assumption of labor homogeneity.
sentences.chinese: 劳动价值论是建立在劳动同质性假设基础上的。

sentences.english: Differentiation to general meaning is referring things transmit from homogeneity to heterogeneity.
sentences.chinese: 分化在一般意义上是指事物从同质性向异质性的转变。

sentences.english: But it responded to a hostility to Islam and a craving for security and cultural homogeneity that is finding adherents across the western world — and not just on the far right.
sentences.chinese: 不过，它回应了对伊斯兰的敌意和对安全及文化同质的渴望，而这两者在整个西方世界——而不仅仅是在极右翼人群中——的支持者越来越多。

name: hone
trans: v. to make more acute, intense, or effective 磨砺，提升

sentences.english: Leading companies spend time and money on honing the skills of senior managers.
sentences.chinese: 龙头公司会花费时间和金钱提高高层管理人员的技能。

detailed_translations.english: a fine whetstone, esp for sharpening razors
to make knives, swords etc sharp

name: honor
trans: n. respect that is given to someone who is admired 荣誉
v. to regard or treat with respect and admiration 尊敬

sentences.english: For the French team, winning tomorrow’s game is a matter of national honor.
sentences.chinese: 对法国队来说，打赢明天的比赛事关国家荣誉。

detailed_translations.english: the respect that you, your family, your country etc receive from other people, which makes you feel proud

name: hortatory
trans: adj. hortative, exhortatory 劝告的

name: hubris
trans: n. a great or foolish amount of pride or confidence 傲慢自大

sentences.english: ...a tale of how an honourable man pursuing honourable goals was afflicted with hubris and led his nation toward catastrophe.
sentences.chinese: ...一个有关追求崇高目标的磊落君子如何因自高自大、而将自己的国家引向灾难的故事。

detailed_translations.english: too much pride

name: humdrum
trans: adj. dull, boring, and ordinary 单调的，乏味的

sentences.english: ...her lawyer husband, trapped in a humdrum but well-paid job.
sentences.chinese: ...她整天做着单调乏味的工作但收入颇丰的律师丈夫。

detailed_translations.english: boring and ordinary, and having no variety or interest

name: humility
trans: n. the quality or state of not thinking you are better than other people 谦逊

sentences.english: ...a deep sense of humility.
sentences.chinese: …深深的谦卑感。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of not being too proud about yourself – use this to show approval

name: hyperbole
trans: n. language that describes something as better or worse than it really is
夸大

sentences.english: It was not hyperbole to call it the worst storm in twenty years.
sentences.chinese: 称它是20年来最大的风暴并不为过。

detailed_translations.english: a way of describing something by saying it is much bigger, smaller, worse etc than it actually is

name: hypocrisy
trans: n. a feigning to be what one is not or to believe what one does not 伪善

sentences.english: It would be sheer hypocrisy to pray for success, since I’ve never believed in God.
sentences.chinese: 我从不相信上帝，因此为获成功而祈祷是纯粹的虚伪之举。

detailed_translations.english: when someone pretends to have certain beliefs or opinions that they do not really have – used to show disapproval

name: iconoclast
trans: n. a person who criticizes or opposes beliefs and practices that are widely accepted 反传统者

detailed_translations.chinese: 偶像破坏者；提倡打破旧习的人

name: idealistic
trans: adj. of or relating to idealists or idealism 空想的

sentences.english: idealistic young doctors
sentences.chinese: 充满理想主义的年轻医生

sentences.english: the idealistic values of the 1960s
sentences.chinese: 20世纪60年代的理想主义价值观

detailed_translations.chinese: 理想主义的；唯心论的；唯心主义者的；空想家的
detailed_translations.english: believing that you should live according to high standards and principles, even if they cannot really be achieved, or showing this belief

name: ideologue
trans: n. someone who very strongly supports and is guided by the ideology of a particular group 狂热支持某种理念的人

name: idiosyncratic
trans: adj. characteristic peculiarity 怪异的

sentences.english: ...a highly idiosyncratic personality.
sentences.chinese: ...一种非常另类的个性。

detailed_translations.chinese: 特殊物质的， 特殊的， 异质的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe someone's actions or characteristics as idiosyncratic, you mean that they are somewhat unusual

name: ignorance
trans: n. a lack of knowledge, understanding, or education 无知

sentences.english: Excuse my ignorance, but how does it actually work?
sentences.chinese: 请原谅我的无知，它究竟是如何运作的？

detailed_translations.english: lack of knowledge or information about something

name: illusory
trans: adj. base one something that is not true or real 虚假的

sentences.english: First impressions can often prove illusory.
sentences.chinese: 第一印象往往被证明是不真实的。

detailed_translations.english: false but seeming to be real or true

name: imbibe
trans: v. to drink alcohol 饮酒
v. to receive into the mind and retain 吸收，接受

sentences.english: Both men imbibed considerable quantities of gin.
sentences.chinese: 这两个男人都喝了大量的杜松子酒。

detailed_translations.english: to drink something, especially alcohol – sometimes used humorously

name: imitate
trans: v. to follow as a pattern, model, or example 模仿

sentences.english: She was a splendid mimic and loved to imitate Winston Churchill.
sentences.chinese: 她是个出色的模仿者，喜欢模仿温斯顿·丘吉尔。

sentences.english: The Japanese have no wish to imitate Western social customs and attitudes.
sentences.chinese: 日本人无意仿效西方的社会习俗和处事态度。

detailed_translations.english: to copy the way someone behaves, speaks, moves etc, especially in order to make people laugh

name: immaterial
trans: adj. not important or significant 不重要的

sentences.english: If you sign a document, it is wholly immaterial whether you have read it carefully or not.
sentences.chinese: 文件一经签署，是否仔细阅读过文件就完全无关紧要了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 非物质的；无形的；不重要的；非实质的
detailed_translations.english: not important in a particular situation

name: immense
trans: adj. very great in size or amount 巨大的

sentences.english: People who travel by rail still read an immense amount.
sentences.chinese: 人们坐火车旅行时仍然会读很多书。

sentences.english: Regular visits from a social worker can be of immense value to old people living alone.
sentences.chinese: 对于独居老人来说社工的经常探望很重要。

detailed_translations.english: extremely large

name: imminent
trans: adj. happening very soon 即将发生的

sentences.english: A new trade agreement is imminent.
sentences.chinese: 一项新的贸易协定即将签署。

detailed_translations.english: an event that is imminent, especially an unpleasant one, will happen very soon

name: immortality
trans: n. the quality or state of someone or something that will never die or be forgotten 不朽

sentences.english: the immortality of the soul
sentences.chinese: 灵魂的不朽

detailed_translations.english: the state of living for ever or being remembered for ever

name: immutable
trans: adj. unable to be changed 不可改变的

sentences.english: This decision should not be seen as immutable.
sentences.chinese: 不该把这个决定看成是不可改变的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不变的；不可变的；不能变的
detailed_translations.english: never changing or impossible to change

name: impair
trans: v. to make weaker or worse 损害

sentences.english: The illness had impaired his ability to think and concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病损害了他的思维能力和注意力。

detailed_translations.english: to damage something or make it not as good as it should be

name: impartial
trans: adj. treating all people and groups equally 公正的

sentences.english: We offer impartial advice on tax and insurance.
sentences.chinese: 我们就税收和保险问题提供公充的建议。

sentences.english: an impartial inquiry into the deaths
sentences.chinese: 对死亡事件的公正调查

sentences.english: an impartial observer
sentences.chinese: 公正的观察员

detailed_translations.chinese: 公平的，公正的；不偏不倚的
detailed_translations.english: not involved in a particular situation, and therefore able to give a fair opinion or piece of advice

name: impassioned
trans: adj. showing or feeling very strong emotions 热情的

sentences.english: She appeared on television to make an impassioned plea for help.
sentences.chinese: 她在电视上恳切地请求人们帮助。

sentences.english: an impassioned speech
sentences.chinese: 激昂的演讲

detailed_translations.english: full of strong feeling and emotion

detailed_translations.chinese: 使充满激情（impassion的过去式和过去分词）

name: impassive
trans: adj. not showing emotion 冷漠的

sentences.english: Her impassive face showed no reaction at all.
sentences.chinese: 她表情冷淡，毫无反应。

detailed_translations.english: not showing any emotion

name: impecunious
trans: adj. having little or no money 贫穷的

sentences.english: He came from a respectable if impecunious family.
sentences.chinese: 他来自一个没钱但受人尊重的家庭。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不名一文的， 没钱的
detailed_translations.english: having very little money, especially over a long period – sometimes used humorously

name: impede
trans: v. to slow the movement, progress, or action of 阻碍

sentences.english: Storms at sea impeded our progress.
sentences.chinese: 海上风暴阻碍了我们的航程。

detailed_translations.english: to make it difficult for someone or something to move forward or make progress

name: impenetrable
trans: adj. impossible to understand 无法理解的

sentences.english: The trees formed a dark and impenetrable barrier.
sentences.chinese: 这些树形成了一道无法通过的黑暗屏障。

sentences.english: the impenetrable blackness of the night
sentences.chinese: 夜晚伸手不见五指的黑

detailed_translations.chinese: 不能穿过的, 不可理喻的
detailed_translations.english: impossible to get through, see through, or get into

name: imperceptible
trans: adj. impossible to see or notice 难以觉察的

sentences.english: Such changes are imperceptible to even the best-trained eye.
sentences.chinese: 这样的变化即使是对最训练有素的人来说也不易察觉。

name: imperil
trans: v. to bring into peril: endanger 危及

sentences.english: Tax increases now might imperil economic recovery.
sentences.chinese: 目前提高税收可能会危及经济的复苏。

detailed_translations.english: to put something or someone in danger

name: impermanent
trans: adj. not lasting forever 短暂的

sentences.english: single-storey structures, built from cheap and impermanent materials
sentences.chinese: 用廉价而不耐久的材料建成的单层建筑

detailed_translations.chinese: 非永久（性）的；不持久的，暂时的
detailed_translations.english: not staying the same forever

name: impetuous
trans: adj. acting or done quickly and without thought 鲁莽的

sentences.english: He was high-spirited and impetuous.
sentences.chinese: 他情绪高昂，行事鲁莽。

sentences.english: She might live to regret this impetuous decision.
sentences.chinese: 她可能会一辈子为这个鲁莽的决定感到后悔。

detailed_translations.english: tending to do things very quickly, without thinking carefully first, or showing this quality

name: implacable
trans: adj. opposed to someone or something in a very angry or determined way that cannot be changed 无法安抚的

sentences.english: implacable enemies
sentences.chinese: 死敌

detailed_translations.chinese: 不能安抚的；难和解的；不能缓和的

name: implement
trans: v. to begin to do or use 实施

sentences.english: ...writing implements.
sentences.chinese: …书写用具。

sentences.english: We have decided to implement the committee’s recommendations in full.
sentences.chinese: 我们已决定全面实施委员会提出的建议。

detailed_translations.english: a tool, especially one used for outdoor physical work
to take action or make changes that you have officially decided should happen

name: impolitic
trans: adj. unwise 不明智的

sentences.english: It was considered impolitic of him to spend too much time with the party radicals.
sentences.chinese: 他花太多时间与党内的激进分子在一起，这被认为是不明智的。

detailed_translations.english: behaving in a way that is not careful and that could make people think you are not sensible

name: import
trans: n. importance 重要性

sentences.english: a ban on beef imports
sentences.chinese: 禁止进口牛肉

sentences.english: In 2001, Britain exported more cars than it imported.
sentences.chinese: 2001年英国的汽车出口量大于进口

detailed_translations.english: a product that is brought from one country into another so that it can be sold there, or the business of doing this
to bring a product from one country into another so that it can be sold there

name: impotent
trans: adj. lacking power or strength 无能的，无力的

sentences.english: Emergency services seem impotent in the face of such a disaster.
sentences.chinese: 面对这种灾难，应急服务机构似乎无能为力。

sentences.english: impotent rage
sentences.chinese: 于事无补的狂怒

detailed_translations.chinese: 无力的；无效的；虚弱的；阳萎的
detailed_translations.english: unable to take effective action because you do not have enough power, strength, or control

name: impressive
trans: adj. deserving attention, admiration, or respect 令人敬畏的，值得尊敬的

sentences.english: The figures certainly look impressive.
sentences.chinese: 这些数字看上去确实很可观。

sentences.english: Among the guests was an impressive array of authors and critics.
sentences.chinese: 来宾中有不少出色的作家和评论家。

detailed_translations.english: something that is impressive makes you admire it because it is very good, large, important etc

name: improvise
trans: v. to speak or perform without preparation 即兴创作

sentences.english: I forgot to bring my notes, so I had to improvise.
sentences.chinese: 我忘了带笔记，只好临时发挥。

detailed_translations.english: to do something without any preparation, because you are forced to do this by unexpected events

name: impudent
trans: adj. failing to show proper respect and courtesy 放肆无礼的

sentences.english: Some of them spoke pleasantly and were well behaved, while others were impudent and insulting.
sentences.chinese: 他们当中的一些人谈吐不俗、举止得体，而另一些人则行为不恭、傲慢无礼。

detailed_translations.english: rude and showing no respect to other people

name: impugn
trans: v. to assail by words or argument 指责

sentences.english: I did not mean to impugn her professional abilities.
sentences.chinese: 我并不是怀疑她的专业能力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 指责，非难；抨击；反驳；对…表示怀疑
detailed_translations.english: to express doubts about someone’s honesty, courage, ability etc

name: impulsive
trans: adj. done suddenly and without planning 冲动的

sentences.english: Rosa was impulsive and sometimes regretted things she’d done.
sentences.chinese: 罗莎性情鲁莽，有时会为做过的事感到后悔。

sentences.english: In a burst of impulsive generosity, I offered to pay.
sentences.chinese: 因一时慷慨，我主动提出付款。

detailed_translations.chinese: 冲动的；受感情驱使的；任性的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is impulsive does things without considering the possible dangers or problems first

name: inaccessible
trans: adj. difficult or impossible to reach, approach, or understand 难以到达的，难以理解的

sentences.english: In winter, the villages are inaccessible by road.
sentences.chinese: 冬天时，进入这些村子的路很难走。

detailed_translations.chinese: 难达到的；难接近的；难见到的
detailed_translations.english: difficult or impossible to reach

name: inadequate
trans: adj. not enough or not good enough 不足的

sentences.english: inadequate resources
sentences.chinese: 资源缺乏

sentences.english: The new air conditioning system proved inadequate.
sentences.chinese: 新的空调系统不够好。

detailed_translations.english: not good enough, big enough, skilled enough etc for a particular purpose

name: inborn
trans: adj. existing from the time someone is born 天生的

sentences.english: Mammals have an inborn fear of snakes.
sentences.chinese: 哺乳动物天生害怕蛇。

sentences.english: Good taste is inborn and cannot be learned.
sentences.chinese: 好的鉴赏力是与生俱来的，无法通过后天习得。

detailed_translations.english: an inborn quality or ability is one you have had naturally since birth

name: inception
trans: adj. the time at which something begins 开始

sentences.english: a CD collection covering the band from its inception in 1994
sentences.chinese: 一套包括该乐队自1994年成立以来所有曲目在内的激光唱片

detailed_translations.english: the start of an organization or institution

name: inclined
trans: adj. wanting to do something or likely to do something 倾向于…的

sentences.english: Commandos are inclined to shoot first and ask questions later.
sentences.chinese: 突击队员往往会先开枪，然后再问话。

sentences.english: He was inclined to self-pity.
sentences.chinese: 他爱自怜。

detailed_translations.english: to be likely to do something or behave in a particular way

name: inclusive
trans: adj. covering or including everything 全包括的
adj. including the stated limits and everything in between 包括首尾两项的

sentences.english: The fully inclusive fare for the trip is £22.
sentences.chinese: 这次出行的全部费用为22英镑。

sentences.english: The rent is £120 a week, inclusive of heating.
sentences.chinese: 房租连暖气费在内是每星期120英镑。

detailed_translations.english: an inclusive price or cost includes everything

name: incommensurable
trans: adj. not commensurable broadly 不能相比的

name: incomprehensible
trans: adj. impossible to understand 费解的

sentences.english: legal documents full of incomprehensible jargon
sentences.chinese: 满是难懂术语的法律文件

sentences.english: I find your attitude quite incomprehensible.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得你的态度很难理解。

detailed_translations.chinese: 费解的；不可思议的；无限的
detailed_translations.english: difficult or impossible to understand

name: incongruity
trans: n. something that is incongruous 矛盾

sentences.english: The incongruity of her situation struck Gina with unpleasant force.
sentences.chinese: 吉娜猛然意识到自己处境尴尬，心里很不舒服。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不调和的, 不适宜的
detailed_translations.english: the fact that something is strange, unusual, or unsuitable in a particular situation

name: inconsequential
trans: adj. not important 不重要的

sentences.english: inconsequential but amusing chatter
sentences.chinese: 无谓但有趣的闲扯

detailed_translations.chinese: 不重要的；不合理的；不合逻辑的
detailed_translations.english: not important

name: inconsistent
trans: adj. not compatible with another fact or claim 不一致的，矛盾的

sentences.english: The accounts of the witnesses are inconsistent.
sentences.chinese: 几位目击者的说法不一致。

detailed_translations.english: two statements that are inconsistent cannot both be true

name: inconstant
trans: adj. likely to change frequently without apparent for cogent reason 善变的

name: incorporate
trans: v. to include as part of something else 纳入
v. to blend or combine 合并

sentences.english: It allows you to harness existing technologies and incorporate them into one application.
sentences.chinese: 它允许您利用现有的技术并将它们合并到同一个应用程序中。

sentences.english: The next step is to generate the report and then incorporate it as an affiliated document of the master document.
sentences.chinese: 紧接着的步骤就是产生这个报告，然后将它作为主文档的附属文档与主文档合并。

name: incursion
trans: n. a sudden invasion or attack 入侵

sentences.english: ...armed incursions into border areas by rebel forces.
sentences.chinese: ...叛军武装入侵边境地区。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden attack into an area that belongs to other people

name: indebted
trans: adj. owing gratitude or recognition to another 感激的

sentences.english: the 17 most heavily indebted nations
sentences.chinese: 17个负债最重的国家

detailed_translations.english: owing money to someone

detailed_translations.chinese: 使负债；使受恩惠（indebt的过去分词）

name: indecorous
trans: adj. conflicting with accepted standards of good conduct or good taste
不合礼节的

name: indict
trans: v. to charge with a fault or offense 控告

sentences.english: He was later indicted on corruption charges.
sentences.chinese: 他后来被控贪污。

detailed_translations.english: to officially charge someone with a criminal offence

name: indifferent
trans: adj. not interested in or concerned about something 冷漠的
adj. marked by impartiality 公正的

sentences.english: People have become indifferent to the suffering of others.
sentences.chinese: 人们已经变得对别人的痛苦漠不关心。

detailed_translations.english: If you accuse someone of being indifferent to something, you mean that they have a complete lack of interest in it

name: indigent
trans: adj. very poor 贫穷的

sentences.english: No where in the article does it mention her financial status. So…what is it that leads everyone to assume she was indigent?
sentences.chinese: 在文章中哪也没提及她的财务状况。那么…究竟是什么导致每个人都认为她是贫困的？

sentences.english: They "either fail to pay anything or pay a greatly-reduced amount designed for indigent or low income patients lacking insurance, " according to DHS.
sentences.chinese: 他们“一分钱都不付或者只支付非常少的费用，原先为贫困或短缺保险的低收入病人设定的费用。”

detailed_translations.english: very poor

name: indiscernible
trans: adj. impossible to see, hear, or know clearly 难以理解的

sentences.english: The path was almost indiscernible in the mist.
sentences.chinese: 迷雾中小路依稀难辨。

detailed_translations.english: very difficult to see, hear, or notice

name: indiscriminate
trans: affecting or harming many people or things in a careless or unfair way 肆意的
not careful in making choices 盲目的

sentences.english: the indiscriminate use of chemical fertilizers
sentences.chinese: 化肥的滥用

detailed_translations.chinese: 任意的；无差别的；不分皂白的
detailed_translations.english: an indiscriminate action is done without thinking about what harm it might cause

name: indispensable
trans: adj. extremely important and necessary 不可或缺的

sentences.english: Mobile phones have become an indispensable part of our lives.
sentences.chinese: 移动电话已经成为我们生活中的必需品。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is indispensable is so important or useful that it is impossible to manage without them

name: indubitable
trans: adj. too evident to be doubted 不容置疑的

sentences.english: His brilliance renders this film an indubitable classic.
sentences.chinese: 他的出色表现让这部电影成为了毋庸置疑的经典。

detailed_translations.english: You use indubitable to describe something when you want to emphasize that it is definite and cannot be doubted

name: induce
trans: v. to cause to do something 引起

sentences.english: Nothing would induce me to vote for him again.
sentences.chinese: 没有什么能诱使我再投他的票了。

sentences.english: Doctors said surgery could induce a heart attack.
sentences.chinese: 医生们说手术可能导致心脏病。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone to do something, especially something that does not seem wise

name: industrious
trans: adj. working very hard 勤奋的

sentences.english: She was an industrious and willing worker.
sentences.chinese: 她是个勤劳肯干的工人。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is industrious works hard

name: inert
trans: adj. unable to move 不活动的
adj. very slow to move or act 惰性的

sentences.english: inert gases
sentences.chinese: 惰性气体

detailed_translations.chinese: [化学] 惰性的；呆滞的；迟缓的；无效的
detailed_translations.english: not producing a chemical reaction when combined with other substances

name: inevitable
trans: adj. sure to happen 必然的

sentences.english: A further escalation of the crisis now seems inevitable.
sentences.chinese: 危机的进一步升级现在看来已不可避免。

detailed_translations.english: certain to happen and impossible to avoid

name: inexplicable
trans: adj. not able to be explained or understand 费解的

sentences.english: inexplicable behaviour
sentences.chinese: 费解的行为

sentences.english: For some inexplicable reason, he felt depressed.
sentences.chinese: 他无端地感到很沮丧。

detailed_translations.chinese: 费解的；无法说明的；不能解释的
detailed_translations.english: too unusual or strange to be explained or understood

name: infallibility
trans: n. incapable of error 无过失

name: infamy
trans: n. evil reputation brought about by something grossly criminal, shocking, or brutal 声名狼藉

name: infectious
trans: adj. capable of causing infection 传染性的
adj. spreading or capable of spreading rapidly to others 有感染力的

sentences.english: infectious diseases
sentences.chinese: 传染性疾病

detailed_translations.english: an infectious illness can be passed from one person to another, especially through the air you breathe

name: inferable from
trans: phrase. 能从...推断的

name: inflammatory
trans: adj. causing anger 煽动性的

sentences.english: inflammatory remarks
sentences.chinese: 煽动性言论

detailed_translations.chinese: 炎症性的；煽动性的；激动的
detailed_translations.english: an inflammatory speech, piece of writing etc is likely to make people feel angry

name: inflate
trans: v. to swell or distend with air or gas 使膨胀
v. to think or say that is larger or more important than it really is 夸大

sentences.english: It took us half an hour to inflate the dinghy.
sentences.chinese: 我们用了半小时给橡皮筏充好气。

sentences.english: Her life jacket failed to inflate.
sentences.chinese: 她的救生衣未能充进去气。

detailed_translations.english: to fill something with air or gas so it becomes larger, or to become filled with air or gas

name: informative
trans: adj. providing information 提供信息的

sentences.english: Both men termed the meeting friendly and informative.
sentences.chinese: 他们两人都称这次会晤亲切友好，使双方增进了解。

detailed_translations.chinese: 提供消息的, 情报的
detailed_translations.english: Something that is informative gives you useful information

name: ingenuous
trans: adj. showing innocent or childlike simplicity and candidness 天真的
adj. lacking craft or subtlety 真诚的

sentences.english: He seemed too ingenuous for a reporter.
sentences.chinese: 他好像太天真诚实，不适合做记者。

detailed_translations.chinese: 天真的；坦白的；正直的；朴实的
detailed_translations.english: an ingenuous person is simple, trusting, and honest, especially because they have not had much experience of life

name: inherent
trans: adj. belonging to the basic nature of someone or something 固有的

sentences.english: Every business has its own inherent risks.
sentences.chinese: 每笔生意本身都有风险。

sentences.english: I’m afraid the problems you mention are inherent in the system.
sentences.chinese: 你提及的这些问题恐怕本来就存在于这个体制中。

detailed_translations.english: a quality that is inherent in something is a natural part of it and cannot be separated from it

name: inhibit
trans: v. to keep from doing what he or she wants to do 抑制，禁止

sentences.english: An unhappy family life may inhibit children’s learning.
sentences.chinese: 不幸福的家庭生活可能会阻碍儿童的学习。

detailed_translations.english: to prevent something from growing or developing well

name: inimical
trans: adj. likely to cause damage or have a bad effect 有害的
adj. not friendly 不友好的

sentences.english: But allowing vigilantes to even the score will only lead to a spiral of violence that is hard to stop and inimical to democratic evolution.
sentences.chinese: 但是由治安委员会成员来弥补裂痕只能导致暴力事件的盘旋上升，这种事件又是难以遏制的，同时对民主进程又是极其有害的。

sentences.english: When Krugman repeated one of his "debt is good" posts, posters linked to the economic science from Reinhardt and Rogoff showing that high debt is inimical to economic recovery.
sentences.chinese: 当克鲁格曼重复发了一篇他的“举债是美德”博文时，回帖的网民用链接把人们引向了莱因哈特和罗格夫，揭示了巨额债务对经济复苏有害。

sentences.english: To the popular mind, science is completely inimical to religion: science embraces facts and evidence while religion professes blind faith.
sentences.chinese: 在大众的心目中，科学与宗教完全敌视：科学拥抱事实与证据，而宗教宣示盲目的信仰。

name: innate
trans: adj. existing from the time a person or animal is born 天生的

sentences.english: Children have an innate ability to learn language.
sentences.chinese: 儿童学习语言的能力是与生俱来的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 先天的；固有的；与生俱来的
detailed_translations.english: an innate quality or ability is something you are born with

name: innocuous
trans: adj. causing no injury 无害的
adj. not likely to bother or offend anyone 无意冒犯的

sentences.english: an innocuous remark
sentences.chinese: 无恶意的话

sentences.english: He’s a perfectly innocuous young man.
sentences.chinese: 他是个毫无恶意的年轻人。

detailed_translations.english: not offensive, dangerous, or harmful

name: innovative
trans: adj. introducing or using new ideas or methods 创新的

sentences.english: an innovative approach to language teaching
sentences.chinese: 创新的语言教学法

sentences.english: innovative schemes for recycling waste materials
sentences.chinese: 废物回收利用的创新计划

detailed_translations.english: an innovative idea or way of doing something is new, different, and better than those that existed before

name: insatiable
trans: adj. always wanting more 不满足的

sentences.english: A section of the reading public has an insatiable appetite for dirty stories about the famous.
sentences.chinese: 阅读大众中有一部分人对名人的风流韵事的欲望总是无法满足。

detailed_translations.english: always wanting more and more of something

name: inscrutable
trans: adj. difficult to understand 难以理解的

sentences.english: He stood silent and inscrutable.
sentences.chinese: 他静静地站着，让人难以捉摸。

detailed_translations.chinese: 神秘的；不可理解的；不能预测的；不可思议的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is inscrutable shows no emotion or reaction in the expression on their face so that it is impossible to know what they are feeling or thinking

name: insightful
trans: adj. having or showing a very clear understanding of something 有洞察力的

sentences.english: an insightful analysis
sentences.chinese: 有见地的分析

detailed_translations.chinese: 有深刻见解的，富有洞察力的
detailed_translations.english: able to understand, or showing that you understand, what a situation or person is really like

name: insipid
trans: adj. not interesting or exciting 枯燥乏味的

sentences.english: an insipid pasta dish
sentences.chinese: 一盘没有味道的意大利面食

detailed_translations.english: food or drink that is insipid does not have much taste

name: inspire
trans: v. to cause to happen or be created 使产生
v. to cause someone to have (a feeling or emotion) 激起，引起

sentences.english: We need someone who can inspire the team.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要一个能鼓舞团队士气的人。

sentences.english: Inspired by the sunny weather, I decided to explore the woods.
sentences.chinese: 阳光明媚的天气令人振奋，我决定到森林里寻幽探胜。

sentences.english: The story was inspired by a chance meeting with an old Russian duke.
sentences.chinese: 这个故事的创作灵感来自与一位俄国老公爵的不期而遇。

detailed_translations.english: to encourage someone by making them feel confident and eager to do something

name: insufferable
trans: adj. not to be endured: intolerable 难以忍受的

name: insufficient
trans: adj. not having or providing enough of what is needed 不充足的

sentences.english: Insufficient resources have been devoted to the health service.
sentences.chinese: 用于医疗保健服务的资源不足。

detailed_translations.english: not enough, or not great enough

name: insular
trans: adj. separated from other people or cultures 狭隘的

sentences.english: an insular community
sentences.chinese: 保守封闭的社团

detailed_translations.chinese: 孤立的；与世隔绝的；海岛的；岛民的
detailed_translations.english: relating to or like an island

name: insulate
trans: v. to keep separate from something unpleasant, dangerous, etc. 隔离，绝缘（不利的东西）

sentences.english: an insulated attic
sentences.chinese: 隔热[隔音]的阁楼

sentences.english: Pipes may need insulating against the cold.
sentences.chinese: 管道可能需要隔温以防冰冻。

detailed_translations.english: to cover or protect something with a material that stops electricity, sound, heat etc from getting in or out

name: intelligible
trans: adj. able to be understood 可理解的

sentences.english: His reply was barely intelligible.
sentences.chinese: 他的回复几乎让人听不懂。

detailed_translations.english: if speech, writing, or an idea is intelligible, it can be easily understood

name: intensity
trans: n. the degree or amount of strength or force that something has 强度

sentences.english: The intensity of the hurricane was frightening.
sentences.chinese: 飓风的猛烈程度令人恐惧。

detailed_translations.chinese: 强烈，剧烈；〔光、声等的〕强度
detailed_translations.english: the quality of being felt very strongly or having a strong effect

name: interchangeable
trans: adj. capable of being used in place of each other 可交换的

sentences.english: These two words are almost interchangeable.
sentences.chinese: 这两个单词几乎可以互换使用。

sentences.english: a camera with interchangeable lenses
sentences.chinese: 可换镜头的照相机

detailed_translations.chinese: 可互换的；可交换的；可交替的
detailed_translations.english: things that are interchangeable can be used instead of each other

name: interdependent
trans: adj. depending on each other 相互依赖的

sentences.english: countries with interdependent economies
sentences.chinese: 经济上相互依赖的国家

detailed_translations.english: depending on or necessary to each other

name: intermediary
trans: adj. acting as a mediator 调解的，中间的

sentences.english: Often the initial topology does not call for another intermediary, so this becomes a good choice.
sentences.chinese: 通常，最初的拓扑结构并不要求另外的中介，因此这成为了一个好的选择。

detailed_translations.chinese: 中间人；仲裁者；调解者；媒介物
detailed_translations.english: a person or organization that tries to help two other people or groups to agree with each other

name: interrelated
trans: adj. having a mutual or reciprocal relation 相互联系的

name: interweave
trans: v. to twist or weave together 交织

sentences.english: For these people, land is inextricably interwoven with life itself.
sentences.chinese: 对那些人来说，土地和生活本身紧密交织在一起。

detailed_translations.english: if two things are interwoven, they are closely related or combined in a complicated way

name: intimate
trans: adj. having a very close relationship 亲密的
v. to say or suggest in an indirect way 暗示

sentences.english: an intimate friend of Picasso’s
sentences.chinese: 毕加索的一个密友

sentences.english: an intimate relationship
sentences.chinese: 亲密的关系

sentences.english: She’s on intimate terms with people in government.
sentences.chinese: 她与政府官员关系密切。

detailed_translations.english: having an extremely close friendship
a close personal friend
to make people understand what you mean without saying it directly

name: intransigent
trans: adj. completely unwilling to change 不妥协的

sentences.english: an intransigent attitude
sentences.chinese: 不妥协的态度

detailed_translations.english: unwilling to change your ideas or behaviour, in a way that seems unreasonable

name: intricate
trans: adj. having many parts 错综复杂的

sentences.english: intricate patterns
sentences.chinese: 繁复的图案

detailed_translations.chinese: 错综复杂的， 复杂精细的
detailed_translations.english: containing many small parts or details that all work or fit together

name: intrinsic
trans: adj. belonging to the essential nature of a thing 本质的

sentences.english: the intrinsic interest of the subject
sentences.chinese: 该话题本身的趣味

detailed_translations.english: being part of the nature or character of someone or something

name: intuitive
trans: adj. agreeing with what seems naturally right 凭直觉的

sentences.english: He seemed to have an intuitive awareness of how I felt.
sentences.chinese: 他好像凭直觉就知道我的感受。

detailed_translations.english: an intuitive idea is based on a feeling rather than on knowledge or facts

name: invalidate
trans: v. to weaken or destroy the effect of 使无效
v. to show or prove to be false or incorrect 证明…错误

sentences.english: Failure to disclose all relevant changes may invalidate your policy.
sentences.chinese: 未能披露所有的相关变化会令保单无效。

detailed_translations.english: to make a document, ticket, claim etc no longer legally or officially acceptable

name: invective
trans: n. insulting or abusive language 猛烈抨击

sentences.english: The deputy leader of the group, which is based in Baghdad, explained its campaign using a stream of homophobic invective.
sentences.chinese: 这个组织总部设在巴格达，其副首领用一连串谩骂同性恋者的语言解释了这个运动。

sentences.english: Is it true that they and the entire  political culture will stop the self-sustaining and self-serving pendulum  of blame and invective only after a congressman has been shot?
sentences.chinese: 我们整个政治文化会出现终止自我维持和面对指责和谩骂时的自私摇摆不定的态度，改变从议员被枪杀开始吗？

sentences.english: A country whose politics have been damaged recently by bitter, racially tinged invective offered hundreds of thousands of visitors an affectionate welcome.
sentences.chinese: 就是这样一个被尖锐，夹带谩骂种族问题损害的政体的国家给了成百上千的来访者们热情的欢迎。

detailed_translations.english: rude and insulting words that someone says when they are very angry

name: invention
trans: n. product of the imagination 虚构

sentences.english: The invention of the computer has revolutionized the business world.
sentences.chinese: 电脑的发明使商界发生了根本变化。

sentences.english: They subsequently admitted that the story was pure invention.
sentences.chinese: 他们后来承认他们说的纯属虚构。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发明，创造；捏造， 假话
detailed_translations.english: the act of inventing something

name: inverse
trans: adj. opposite in nature or effect 相反的
n. something that is the opposite of something else 相反事物，相反数（数学）

sentences.english: Clearly, the amount of money people save increases in inverse proportion to the amount they spend.
sentences.chinese: 显然，人们储蓄的增加与消费成反比。

sentences.english: the inverse relationship between prices and interest rates
sentences.chinese: 价格和利率之间的反比关系

detailed_translations.english: if there is an inverse relationship between two amounts, one gets bigger at the same rate as the other gets smaller
the complete opposite of something

name: involved
trans: adj. very complicated 复杂的

sentences.english: The plot was so involved that very few people knew what was going on.
sentences.chinese: 情节太复杂，几乎没人知道是怎么回事。

detailed_translations.english: having so many different parts that it is difficult to understand

detailed_translations.chinese: 涉及；使参与；包含（involve的过去式和过去分词）

name: irascible
trans: adj. becoming angry very easily 易怒的

sentences.english: an irascible old man
sentences.chinese: 一位脾气暴躁的老人

detailed_translations.english: easily becoming angry

name: irenic
trans: adj. favoring, conducive to, or operating toward peace, moderation, or conciliation 和平主义的

name: irksome
trans: adj. annoying or irritating 讨厌的

sentences.english: an irksome journey
sentences.chinese: 一次恼人的旅行

detailed_translations.chinese: 令人厌烦的，讨厌的；令人厌恶的
detailed_translations.english: annoying

name: ironic
trans: adj. using words that mean the opposite of what you really think especially in order to be funny 讽刺的

sentences.english: Your car was stolen at the police station! How ironic!
sentences.chinese: 你的车在警察局被偷！真让人哭笑不得！

sentences.english: It’s ironic that her husband smoked for thirty years, and yet she’s the one who died of lung cancer.
sentences.chinese: 具有讽刺意味的是，她丈夫吸烟30年，而死于肺癌的却是她。
