sentences.english: In an ironic twist , the most trustworthy character in the film turned out to be the thief.
sentences.chinese: 影片中故事情节来了一个出乎意料的转折，最可信赖的人原来是小偷。

detailed_translations.english: an ironic situation is one that is unusual or amusing because something strange happens, or the opposite of what is expected happens or is true

name: irrefutable
trans: adj. not able to be proved wrong 无法反驳的

sentences.english: The pictures provide irrefutable evidence of the incident.
sentences.chinese: 这些图片为该事件提供了无法反驳的证据。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无可辩驳的， 毋庸置疑的
detailed_translations.english: an irrefutable statement, argument etc cannot be proved to be wrong, and must be accepted

name: irreparable
trans: adj. too bad to be corrected or repaired 不可弥补的

sentences.english: Extensive mining will cause irreparable damage to the area.
sentences.chinese: 大量采矿会对该地区造成无法弥补的损害。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不能挽回的；不能修补的
detailed_translations.english: irreparable damage, harm etc is so bad that it can never be repaired or made better

name: irresistible
trans: adj. impossible to resist especially because of strength or attractiveness
不可抵抗的

sentences.english: I was overcome by an irresistible urge to cry.
sentences.chinese: 我控制不住想大哭一场。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不可抵抗的,不能压制的
detailed_translations.english: too strong or powerful to be stopped or prevented

name: irresolution
trans: n. the state of not being certain about what to do 犹豫不决

name: isolationism
trans: n. the belief that a country should not be involved with other counties 孤立主义

name: itinerant
trans: adj. traveling from place to place 流动的，巡回的

sentences.english: itinerant labourers
sentences.chinese: 流动劳工

detailed_translations.english: travelling from place to place, especially to work

name: jarring
trans: adj. 刺耳的，不和谐的

name: jealous
trans: adj. hostile toward a rival or one believed to enjoy an advantage 嫉妒的

sentences.english: She got insanely jealous and there was a terrible fight.
sentences.chinese: 她变得过分地猜忌，接着是一场激烈的打斗。

detailed_translations.chinese: 妒忌的；猜疑的；唯恐失去的；戒备的
detailed_translations.english: feeling unhappy because someone has something that you wish you had

name: jejune
trans: adj. not interesting 乏味的
adj. too simple 幼稚的

sentences.english: jejune political opinions
sentences.chinese: 幼稚的政治观点

detailed_translations.english: ideas that are jejune are too simple

name: jettison
trans: v. to get rid of 丢弃

sentences.english: We're going to jettison the cargo.
sentences.chinese: 我们正准备投弃货物。

detailed_translations.english: to throw things away, especially from a moving plane or ship

name: judicious
trans: adj. having or showing good judgment 审慎的

sentences.english: a judicious choice
sentences.chinese: 审慎而明智的选择

detailed_translations.chinese: 明智的；头脑精明的；判断正确的
detailed_translations.english: done in a sensible and careful way

name: justify
trans: v. to prove or show to be just, right, or reasonable 证明…有理

sentences.english: Ministers must appear before Parliament and justify their actions.
sentences.chinese: 大臣们必须就自己的行为向议会作出解释。

detailed_translations.english: to give an acceptable explanation for something that other people think is unreasonable

name: keen
trans: adj. very excited about and interested in something 渴望的

sentences.english: keen students
sentences.chinese: 求知若渴的学生

sentences.english: The kids in my class are all very keen.
sentences.chinese: 我班上的学生都很好学。

sentences.english: She was new in the job and keen as mustard (= very keen ).
sentences.chinese: 她刚开始做这工作，热情很高。

detailed_translations.chinese: 热心的； 激烈的； 敏锐的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is keen is eager to work or learn, and enjoys doing it

name: keep abreast of
trans: phrase. 了解...的最新情况

name: kindred
trans: adj. alike or similar 同类的，相似的

sentences.english: The protest included members of Free the Streets and kindred organisations.
sentences.chinese: 参加此次抗议的包括“解放街头”组织以及类似团体的成员。

detailed_translations.english: belonging to the same group or family
your whole family

name: kinfolk
trans: n. a person's relatives 亲戚

sentences.english: I sent my other son to the country to stay with kinfolk.
sentences.chinese: 我把另一个儿子送到乡下和亲戚住在一起。

sentences.english: Poor Emily. Her kinsfolk should come to her.
sentences.chinese: 可怜的埃米莉，她的亲属应该到她这儿来。

detailed_translations.english: Your kinfolk or kinsfolk are the people who are related to you

name: knotty
trans: adj. difficult or complicated 复杂的，棘手的

sentences.english: a knotty problem
sentences.chinese: 棘手的问题

detailed_translations.chinese: 多节的， 多瘤的； 困难的， 棘手的
detailed_translations.english: knotty wood contains a lot of hard round places where branches once joined the tree

name: laborious
trans: adj. devoted to labor 勤劳的

sentences.english: the laborious business of drying the crops
sentences.chinese: 把收获的庄稼晒干这一艰苦的工作

detailed_translations.english: taking a lot of time and effort

name: laconic
trans: adj. using few words in speech or writing 简洁的

sentences.english: Usually so laconic in the office, Dr. Lahey seemed less guarded, more relaxed.
sentences.chinese: 平常在办公室里寡言少语的莱希医生似乎少了些拘谨，多了几分轻松。

detailed_translations.english: using only a few words to say something

name: lambaste
trans: v. to criticize very harshly 严厉批评

sentences.english: And you can be sure that when the referee cheats our boys, I'll be ready to lambaste him.
sentences.chinese: 而且你可以放心，如果裁判对孩子们不公平，我会公开斥责他。

detailed_translations.english: If you lambaste someone, you criticize them severely, usually in public

name: languish
trans: v. to continue for a long time without activity or progress in an unpleasant or unwanted situation 失去活力
v. to suffer neglect 被忽视

sentences.english: The housing market continues to languish.
sentences.chinese: 住宅市场继续疲软。

sentences.english: The shares are languishing at just 46p after yesterday’s fall.
sentences.chinese: 股价经历了昨天的下跌后，就停滞在46便士上了。

sentences.english: West Ham United are currently languishing at the bottom of the league.
sentences.chinese: 西汉姆联队目前在联赛中一直排名垫底。

detailed_translations.english: ifsomething languishes, it fails to improve and develop or become successful

name: lapse
trans: n. an occurrence in which you fail to think or act in the usual or proper way for a brief time and make a mistake 错误
n. an occurrence in which someone behaves badly or usually  a short period of time 行为失检
v. to stop for usually a brief time 终止

sentences.english: I had a little lapse of concentration in the middle of the race.
sentences.chinese: 我在比赛中走了一下神。

sentences.english: He was a genius and because of it you could accept lapses of taste.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个天才，因此他偶失得体，人们也可以接受。

detailed_translations.english: A lapse of something such as concentration or judgment is a temporary lack of that thing, which can often cause you to make a mistake

name: largesse
trans: n. the act of giving away money or the quality of a person who gives away money 捐赠

name: laudatory
trans: adj. expressing or containing praise 赞美的

sentences.english: a laudatory biography
sentences.chinese: 颂扬有加的传记

detailed_translations.english: expressing praise

name: layperson
trans: n. a member of the laity 门外汉

name: legitimate
trans: adj. allowed according to rules or laws 合法的

sentences.english: So all of this is a legitimate source of concern.
sentences.chinese: 因此，这些情况都是引发忧虑的合理根源。

sentences.english: Even though I had legitimate reasons ( bullshit ). You know I have to make them dividends ( bullshit ).
sentences.chinese: 即使我有合法的理由（胡说）。你知道我必须支付利息（胡说）。

sentences.english: Often, as in this case, there is no intentional hoaxing: It is a legitimate, straightforward photograph of something curious.
sentences.chinese: 就像此事一样，它们通常都是无意的闹剧：这是某些稀奇的东西合法的、易懂的照片。

detailed_translations.chinese: 正当的， 合理的； 合法的
detailed_translations.english: fair or reasonable

name: lethargic
trans: adj. feeling a lack of energy or a lack of interest in doing things 无精打采的

sentences.english: The cat became lethargic and had trouble breathing.
sentences.chinese: 这只猫整天昏睡而且呼吸困难。

sentences.english: The koala seemed to be asleep, and I wondered for the first time just how one went about startling such a lethargic creature.
sentences.chinese: 那只树熊似乎睡着了。 第一次干这活儿，我真不知怎么去惊吓一只昏睡的动物。

sentences.english: The organisers say they are also considering giving a prize to the slowest cell, since lethargic cells would be a boon for cancer therapy.
sentences.chinese: 主办方表示他们也在考虑颁一个奖给速度最慢的细胞，因为这种昏睡细胞也是癌症治疗的福音。

name: liberation
trans: n. the act or process of freeing someone or something from another’s control 解放
n. the removal of traditional social or sexual rules, attitudes, etc. 解脱

sentences.english: They pant after liberation.
sentences.chinese: 他们渴望解放。

sentences.english: All his life was submerged in the liberation of the people.
sentences.chinese: 他的一生全部献身于人民的解放事业。

sentences.english: They consecrated their lives to the liberation of their motherland.
sentences.chinese: 他们把生命献给了祖国的解放事业。

name: limpid
trans: adj. marked by transparency 清晰的

name: lionize
trans: v. to treat as a very important and famous person 崇拜，把...视为名人

name: list
trans: v. to tile to one side especially of a boat of ship 倾斜

sentences.english: Make a list of all the things you have to do.
sentences.chinese: 把你必须做的所有事情列一个清单。

sentences.english: The first person on my list is Mrs Gilling.
sentences.chinese: 我的名单上排在第一位的是吉林夫人。

sentences.english: The guidebook lists 1,000 hotels and restaurants.
sentences.chinese: 旅游手册上列有1,000家宾馆和餐厅。

detailed_translations.english: a set of names, numbers etc, usually written one below the other, for example so that you can remember or check them
to write a list, or mention things one after the other

name: live up to
trans: phrase. 达到，不辜负

name: loath
trans: adj. not wanting or willing to do something 不情愿的

sentences.english: Sarah was loath to tell her mother what had happened.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉不愿意告诉母亲所发生的事。

detailed_translations.english: to be unwilling to do something

name: long-winded
trans: adj. using too many words in speaking or writing 冗长的

sentences.english: His speeches tend to be rather long-winded.
sentences.chinese: 他的演说往往都很冗长乏味。

detailed_translations.english: continuing to talk for too long or using too many words in a way that is boring

name: loquacious
trans: adj. liking to talk and talking smoothly and easily 健谈的

sentences.english: He said that despite older adults being less “loquacious” or talkative than their younger adult counterparts, they elicit much more vocal responses when calling.
sentences.chinese: 他说，不管老人不太“饶舌”还是比年轻同伴更多话，他们呼叫时都能激发更多的语音回应。

detailed_translations.english: a loquacious person likes to talk a lot

name: lowly
trans: adj. in a low position, manner, or degree 卑微的

name: lucid
trans: adj. very clear and easy to understand 清晰的，易懂的

sentences.english: You must write in a clear and lucid style.
sentences.chinese: 你的写作风格一定要清楚易懂。

detailed_translations.chinese: 明晰的；透明的；易懂的；头脑清楚的
detailed_translations.english: expressed in a way that is clear and easy to understand

name: lucrative
trans: adj. producing money or wealth 获利丰厚的

sentences.english: Thousands of ex-army officers have found lucrative jobs in private security firms.
sentences.chinese: 成千上万的退役军官在私人保安公司找到了薪水丰厚的工作。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有利可图的，赚钱的；合算的
detailed_translations.english: a job or activity that is lucrative lets you earn a lot of money

name: ludicrous
trans: adj. very foolish 荒唐可笑的

sentences.english: It is ludicrous to suggest that I was driving under the influence of alcohol.
sentences.chinese: 说我酒后驾车，这真是太荒唐了。

sentences.english: The court granted him the ludicrous sum of £100 in damages.
sentences.chinese: 法院裁定他获得区区100英镑损害赔偿。

sentences.english: That’s a ludicrous idea.
sentences.chinese: 这个想法很荒唐。

detailed_translations.english: completely unreasonable, stupid, or wrong

name: lugubrious
trans: adj. full of sadness or sorrow 悲伤的

sentences.english: his lugubrious tear-stained face
sentences.chinese: 他那张忧伤、泪痕斑斑的脸

detailed_translations.english: very sad and serious – sometimes used humorously

name: lull
trans: v. to cause to sleep or rest 使平静
v. to cause to feel safe and relaxed instead of careful and alert 蒙蔽
n. a brief time when an action or activity stops 间歇

sentences.english: The hum of the tyres on the road lulled her to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 一路上滚滚的车轮声使她昏昏欲睡。

sentences.english: There was a lull in political violence after the election of the current president.
sentences.chinese: 现任总统选举结束以后，政治暴力曾暂时平息。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel calm or as if they want to sleep
A lull is a period of quiet or calm in a longer period of activity or excitement

name: luxuriant
trans: adj. yielding abundantly 茂盛的
adj. abundantly and often extravagantly rich and varied 丰富的

sentences.english: luxuriant black hair
sentences.chinese: 浓密的黑发

sentences.english: luxuriant vegetation
sentences.chinese: 茂盛的草木

detailed_translations.chinese: 繁茂的；丰富的；奢华的；肥沃的
detailed_translations.english: growing strongly and thickly

name: madcap
trans: adj. marked by capriciousness, recklessness, or foolishness 愚蠢的，鲁莽的

name: magnanimous
trans: adj. showing or suggesting nobility of feeling and generosity of mind 宽宏大量的，慷慨的

sentences.english: a magnanimous gesture
sentences.chinese: 宽宏大量的姿态

detailed_translations.chinese: 宽宏大量的；有雅量的；宽大的
detailed_translations.english: kind and generous, especially to someone that you have defeated

name: maintain
trans: v. to cause to exist or continue without changing 保持
v. to affirm in or as if in argument 断言

sentences.english: Careers Officers maintain contact with young people when they have left school.
sentences.chinese: 年轻人离开学校以后，职业指导员和他们保持联系。

sentences.english: Britain wants to maintain its position as a world power.
sentences.chinese: 英国想保持其世界强国的地位。

sentences.english: A lot depends on building and maintaining a good relationship with your customers.
sentences.chinese: 和顾客建立并保持良好关系很重要，很多事情要取决于此。

sentences.english: The hotel prides itself on maintaining high standards.
sentences.chinese: 这家酒店以保持高标准而自豪。

sentences.english: How can we maintain control of spending?
sentences.chinese: 我们如何保持对开支的控制？

sentences.english: Critics maintain that these reforms will lead to a decline in educational standards.
sentences.chinese: 批评者坚称这些改革会导致教育标准下降。

detailed_translations.english: to make something continue in the same way or at the same standard as before

name: malady
trans: n. a disease or illness 疾病

sentences.english: He was stricken at twenty-one with a crippling malady.
sentences.chinese: 二十一岁时腿瘸疾病让他受到重击。

detailed_translations.english: an illness

name: malfeasance
trans: n. wrongdoing or misconduct especially by a public official 渎职

sentences.english: Of the 22 officials, three were transferred to judicial departments for malfeasance, while the other 19 received administrative punishments.
sentences.chinese: 在这22人中，有三人因渎职罪被移送司法机关处理，其他19人受到行政处分。

sentences.english: Objectively, the crime of dereliction of a basic form and the basic types, dereliction of duty, malfeasance of causal relationship was analyzed.
sentences.chinese: 在客观方面，对渎职犯罪行为的基本形式和基本类型、渎职犯罪结果、渎职罪因果关系进行了分析。

detailed_translations.english: illegal or dishonest activity

name: malignant
trans: adj. aggressively malicious 恶性的

sentences.english: She developed a malignant tumour in her breast.
sentences.chinese: 她的乳房长了个恶性肿瘤。

detailed_translations.chinese: [医] 恶性的；有害的；有恶意的
detailed_translations.english: a malignant disease is one such as  cancer  , which can develop in an uncontrolled way and is likely to cause someone’s death

name: malinger
trans: v. to pretend or exaggerate incapacity or illness 装病

sentences.english: He accused Frank of malingering.
sentences.chinese: 他指责弗兰克装病逃避工作。

detailed_translations.english: to avoid work by pretending to be ill

name: malleable
trans: adj. capable of being easily changed or influenced 可塑的，易变的

sentences.english: malleable steel
sentences.chinese: 展性钢

detailed_translations.chinese: 可锻的；可塑的；有延展性的；易适应的
detailed_translations.english: something that is malleable is easy to press or pull into a new shape

name: malodorous
trans: adj. having a bad smell 难闻的

sentences.english: ...tons of malodorous rubbish bags.
sentences.chinese: …散发恶臭的数吨垃圾袋。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有恶臭的；令人极为反感的；不合法的
detailed_translations.english: smelling unpleasant

name: manacle
trans: v. to restrain from movement, progress, or action 束缚

sentences.english: The first, of administrative action manacle .
sentences.chinese: 第一，行政行为的束缚。

sentences.english: It makes we realize innovation from inside failing repeatedly, it makes we are flounced off manacle, go exploring uncharted territory.
sentences.chinese: 它使我们从反复失败中实现创新，它使我们挣脱束缚，去探索未知领域。

sentences.english: The home, also be your freest world, need not get another person again manacle, can return to ego truly.
sentences.chinese: 家，也是您最自由的天地，不必再受他人的束缚，真正能够回归自我。

sentences.english: His hands were manacled behind his back.
sentences.chinese: 他的双手被铐在了身后。

sentences.english: He was manacled by the police.
sentences.chinese: 他被警察上了镣铐。

detailed_translations.english: an iron ring on a chain that is put around the wrist or  ankle  of a prisoner
If a prisoner is manacled, their wrists or legs are put in manacles in order to prevent them from moving or escaping

name: manifest
trans: adj. able to be seen 明显的
v. to show clearly 清楚显示

sentences.english: The shareholders have manifested their intention to sell the shares.
sentences.chinese: 股东们表明了要出售股票的意图。

detailed_translations.english: to show a feeling, attitude etc
a list of passengers or goods carried on a ship, plane, or train
plain and easy to see

name: manipulate
trans: v. to use or change in a skillful way or for a particular purpose 控制，操纵

sentences.english: He was one of those men who manipulated people.
sentences.chinese: 他是那种要摆布别人的人。

sentences.english: You have the constant feeling you are being manipulated.
sentences.chinese: 你总感觉自己是被人控制着的。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone think and behave exactly as you want them to, by skilfully deceiving or influencing them

name: marginal
trans: adj. not very important 不重要的
adj. not included in the main part of society or of a group 边缘的

sentences.english: marginal groups in society
sentences.chinese: 社会中的非主流群体

sentences.english: marginal notes
sentences.chinese: 边注（旁注）

detailed_translations.english: not part of a main or important group or situation

name: marked
trans: adj. very noticeable 显著的

sentences.english: a marked lack of enthusiasm
sentences.chinese: 明显缺乏热情

sentences.english: The patient showed a marked improvement in her condition after changing medication.
sentences.chinese: 换药治疗后病人的病情明显好转。

sentences.english: Miller’s organized desk stood in marked contrast to the rest of the office.
sentences.chinese: 米勒的桌子上整理得井井有条，和办公室里的其他桌子形成明显的对比。

detailed_translations.english: very easy to notice

detailed_translations.chinese: 表示（mark的过去分词）；作记号；打分数

name: martinet
trans: n. a person who is very strict and demands obedience from others 严格执行纪律的人

name: mask
trans: v. to keep from being known or noticed 掩饰
n. a cover or partial cover for the face used for disguise 面具

sentences.english: a surgical face mask
sentences.chinese: 外科手术口罩

sentences.english: He was attacked and robbed by two people wearing masks .
sentences.chinese: 他被两个蒙面人袭击并抢劫。

detailed_translations.english: something that covers all or part of your face, to protect or to hide it
if a smell, taste, sound etc is masked by a stronger one, it cannot be noticed because of the stronger one

name: master
trans: n. an artist, performer, or player of consummate skill 能手
n. one having control 有控制权的人
v. to become skilled or proficient in the use of 精通

sentences.english: a work of art by a true master
sentences.chinese: 一件真正的大师之作

sentences.english: You’ll have to ask the master’s permission.
sentences.chinese: 你得去请求主人的同意。

sentences.english: You’ll have to ask the master’s permission.
sentences.chinese: 你得去请求主人的同意。

sentences.english: Master of Arts/Science/Education etc
sentences.chinese: 文学/理学/教育学等硕士

detailed_translations.english: someone who is very skilled at something

name: match
trans: v. to cause to correspond 和...一致
v. to set in competition or opposition 与...较量
n. an exact counterpart 相配之物

sentences.english: It’s our last match of the season.
sentences.chinese: 这是我们本赛季最后一场比赛。

sentences.english: They’re preparing for a big match tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 他们在为明天的一场大赛做准备。

sentences.english: McClaire’s goal earned him the title of man of the match (= the person in a team who plays best ) .
sentences.chinese: 麦克莱尔的进球为他赢得了“本场最佳球员”的称号。

sentences.english: Carlos was no match for the champion.
sentences.chinese: 卡洛斯根本不是冠军的对手。

detailed_translations.english: an organized sports event between two teams or people

name: materialize
trans: v. to become visible 显现
v. to begin to happen or exist 实现

sentences.english: Problems were expected, but they never materialized.
sentences.chinese: 估计会有问题，但一直没有发生。

sentences.english: The money we had been promised failed to materialize .
sentences.chinese: 答应给我们的钱并没有兑现。

detailed_translations.english: to happen or appear in the way that you expected

name: maudlin
trans: adj. weakly and effusively sentimental 多愁善感的

sentences.english: Jimmy turned maudlin after three drinks.
sentences.chinese: 三杯酒下肚后，吉米伤感起来。

sentences.english: ...maudlin self-pity.
sentences.chinese: ...自艾自怜。

detailed_translations.chinese: 感情脆弱的；容易流泪的；酒后伤感的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe someone as maudlin, you mean that they are being sad and sentimental in a foolish way, perhaps because of drinking alcohol

name: maverick
trans: n. a person who refuses to follow the customs or rules of a group 特立独行的人

sentences.english: He’s always been a bit of a maverick.
sentences.chinese: 他总是有点特立独行。

sentences.english: ...a maverick group of scientists, who oppose the prevailing medical opinion on the disease.
sentences.chinese: …一群特立独行的科学家，他们反对关于这种疾病的医学界的盛行观点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 没打烙印的动物；持不同意见的人
未打烙印的；行为不合常规的；特立独行的
detailed_translations.english: Maverick is also an adjective

name: meager
trans: adj. not having enough of something for comfort or happiness 缺乏的
adj. having little thin 瘦削的

sentences.english: His meager wage is not enough to support their five children.
sentences.chinese: 靠他一个人的微薄工资不足以养活他们的五个孩子。

sentences.english: Do you think those savings are meager, or not worth the effort?
sentences.chinese: 你认为这些节省的开支是微薄的，或者是不值得努力获得的吗？

sentences.english: It was medieval European monks who introduced scientific brewing techniques in an effort to produce a nutritious beverage to supplement their meager diets.
sentences.chinese: 正是中世纪欧洲的僧侣们引进科学的啤酒酿造技术，制造有营养的饮料， 从而补充了他们贫乏的饮食。

name: measured
trans: adj. done with thought and care 慎重的

sentences.english: a measured response to the problem
sentences.chinese: 对问题作出的慎重回应

sentences.english: She spoke in measured tones .
sentences.chinese: 她以不慌不忙的语调说话。

detailed_translations.chinese: 量过的， 精确的； 慎重的， 恰如其分的
detailed_translations.english: if you do something in a measured way, you do it in a careful and controlled way, not in an excited or sudden way

name: mediate
trans: v. to effect by action as an intermediary 调解

sentences.english: The former president has agreed to mediate the peace talks.
sentences.chinese: 前总统同意就和谈进行斡旋。

detailed_translations.english: to try to end a quarrel between two people, groups, countries etc

name: meet
trans: adj. precisely adapted to a particular situation, need, or circumstance 合适的

sentences.english: You’ll never guess who I met in town.
sentences.chinese: 你绝对猜不出我在镇上碰到谁了。

sentences.english: I was worried I might meet Henry on the bus.
sentences.chinese: 我担心可能会在公共汽车上遇到亨利。

detailed_translations.english: to see someone by chance and talk to them
to see someone by chance and talk to them

name: meld
trans: v. merge, blend 混合

sentences.english: She sang the first verse again, listening to the way the words melded with the music.
sentences.chinese: 她再次吟咏了第一节，倾听着歌词与音乐的交融。

sentences.english: ...a perfect meld of art and social comment.
sentences.chinese: ...一种艺术与社会评论的完美融合。

detailed_translations.english: if two things meld, or if you meld them, they combine into one thing
A meld of things is a mixture or combination of them that is useful or pleasant

name: mendacity
trans: n. lacking of honesty 不诚实

sentences.english: Mr. Gore's mendacity was supposedly demonstrated by trivial anecdotes, none significant, some of them simply false.
sentences.chinese: 据称可以证明戈尔虚伪的都不过是微不足道的小事，没有一件谈得上重要，其中一些根本为不实之辞。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of not being truthful

name: mercurial
trans: adj. changing often 变化无常的

sentences.english: an actor noted for his mercurial temperament
sentences.chinese: 以性情反复无常而出名的一名男演员

detailed_translations.chinese: 水银的；水星的；墨丘利神的；雄辩机智的；活泼善变的
detailed_translations.english: containing mercury

name: metaphor
trans: n. a figure of speech in which a word or phrase literally denoting one kind of object or idea is used in place of another to suggest a likeness or analogy between them 隐喻
n. an object, activity, or idea that is used as a symbol of something
else 象征

sentences.english: She uses some wonderful images and metaphors in her writing.
sentences.chinese: 她在作品中用了一些绝妙的比喻和暗喻。

sentences.english: a very creative use of metaphor
sentences.chinese: 隐喻的独到运用

detailed_translations.english: a way of describing something by referring to it as something different and suggesting that it has similar qualities to that thing

name: meticulous
trans: adj. very careful about doing something in a extremely accurate and exact way 周密的，一丝不苟的

sentences.english: He kept meticulous accounts.
sentences.chinese: 他的账记得一丝不苟。

sentences.english: Their planning and preparation were meticulous.
sentences.chinese: 他们的计划和准备工作都很周密。

sentences.english: He cleaned the tools with meticulous care.
sentences.chinese: 他十分认真地清洁了工具。

sentences.english: The book describes his journey in meticulous detail.
sentences.chinese: 这本书很详细地描述了他的旅程。

detailed_translations.chinese: 一丝不苟的；小心翼翼的；拘泥小节的
detailed_translations.english: very careful about small details, and always making sure that everything is done correctly

name: mimic
trans: v. to copy especially of humor 模仿
v. to naturally look like 和...相似

sentences.english: He could mimic all the teachers’ accents.
sentences.chinese: 他能模仿所有老师的口音。

sentences.english: ‘I’m so sorry,’ she mimicked.
sentences.chinese: “很抱歉。”她学着说道。

detailed_translations.english: to copy the way someone speaks or behaves, especially in order to make people laugh

detailed_translations.chinese: 效颦者，模仿者；仿制品；小丑

name: minimize
trans: v. to make as small as possible 将...减到最低程度
v. to treat or describe as smaller or less important than it is 贬低

sentences.english: Every effort is being made to minimize civilian casualties.
sentences.chinese: 正在尽最大努力减少平民伤亡。

sentences.english: The rail company is bringing in more trains in an effort to minimize disruption to travellers.
sentences.chinese: 铁路公司正投入更多的列车来减少旅客的不便。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce something that is difficult, dangerous, or unpleasant to the smallest possible amount or degree

name: minuscule
trans: adj. very small 极小的

sentences.english: a minuscule amount of food
sentences.chinese: 极少量的食物

sentences.english: Her office is minuscule.
sentences.chinese: 她的办公室非常小。

detailed_translations.chinese: 极小的；用草写小字写的
detailed_translations.english: extremely small

name: misconception
trans: n. an idea that is not correct 错误观念

sentences.english: It is a misconception that Peggy was fabulously wealthy.
sentences.chinese: 说佩吉以前极其富有，这是一个错误的看法。

detailed_translations.english: an idea which is wrong or untrue, but which people believe because they do not understand the subject properly

name: misconstrue
trans: v. to interpret wrongly 曲解

sentences.english: His behaviour could easily be misconstrued.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为容易被误解。

detailed_translations.english: to  misunderstand  something that someone has said or done

name: misgiving
trans: n. a feeling of doubt or suspicion especially concerning a future event
疑虑，担忧

sentences.english: Opponents of nuclear energy have deep misgivings about its safety.
sentences.chinese: 反核能人士非常担心核能的安全性。

sentences.english: She eyed the distant shoreline with misgiving.
sentences.chinese: 她担忧地望着远方的海岸线。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of doubt or fear about what might happen or about whether something is right

detailed_translations.chinese: 担忧；使…疑虑；害怕（misgive的ing形式）

name: misguide
trans: v. to lead astray: misdirect 误导

sentences.english: In addition, they will also misguide the innocent, which becomes a vicious circle.
sentences.chinese: 此外，他们将误导那些思想单纯的人，这将导致一个恶心循环。

sentences.english: The other type of behavior is non-deceptive information misguide or incompleteness of information, namely, significant omission of information disclosure.
sentences.chinese: 另一种行为是非欺骗性的误导或者信息不充分, 即信息披露的重大遗露.

sentences.english: One sort of behavior is incomplete or distorted information disclosure mentioned by Williamson, especially purposeful misguide, distortion, concealment and confusion, etc.
sentences.chinese: 第一种行为是威廉森提出的不完全或者扭曲的信息披露, 特别是故意误导, 扭曲和隐藏相关信息以及制造疑惑等等.

detailed_translations.english: to guide or direct wrongly or badly

name: mishandle
trans: v. to deal with or manage wrong or ignorantly 不当地处理
v. maltreat 虐待

sentences.english: The prime minister admitted that the crisis had been mishandled.
sentences.chinese: 首相承认此次危机处理不当。

detailed_translations.chinese: 粗暴地对待； 错误地处理， 胡乱操作
detailed_translations.english: to deal with a situation badly, because of a lack of skill or care

name: misnomer
trans: n. a name that is wrong or not proper or appropriate 名称误用

sentences.english: ‘Silent movie’ is a misnomer since the movies usually had a musical accompaniment.
sentences.chinese: “无声电影”这一名称不恰当，因为这类电影一般都有配乐。

detailed_translations.chinese: 用词不当；误称；写错姓名
detailed_translations.english: a wrong or unsuitable name

name: misrepresent
trans: v. to describe in a false way especially in order to deceive someone 歪曲

sentences.english: These statistics grossly misrepresent the reality.
sentences.chinese: 这些统计资料严重歪曲了实际情况。

detailed_translations.chinese: 歪曲，误传；不合适地代表
detailed_translations.english: to deliberately give a wrong description of someone’s opinions or of a situation

name: misuse
trans: v. to use incorrectly 误用
v. abuse, mistreat 虐待

sentences.english: Even harmless drugs can be misused.
sentences.chinese: 即使是无毒副作用的药物也有使用不当的时候。

sentences.english: The term ‘schizophrenia’ is often misused.
sentences.chinese: “精神分裂症”这个术语经常被误用。

sentences.english: There is concern that the judges might misuse their power.
sentences.chinese: 有人担心裁判员可能会滥用权力。

detailed_translations.english: to use something for the wrong purpose, or in the wrong way, often with harmful results
the use of something in the wrong way or for the wrong purpose

name: mitigate
trans: v. to make less severe, harmful, or painful 缓和

sentences.english: Measures need to be taken to mitigate the environmental effects of burning more coal.
sentences.chinese: 需要采取措施来减轻燃煤增加对环境造成的影响。

detailed_translations.english: to make a situation or the effects of something less unpleasant, harmful, or serious

name: mixed
trans: adj. combining characteristics of more than one kind 混合的
adj. including or accompanied by inconsistent, incompatible, or contrary elements 矛盾的

name: mockery
trans: n. insulting or contemptuous action or speech 嘲笑

sentences.english: There was a hint of mockery in his voice.
sentences.chinese: 他的话音里带着一丝嘲讽。

detailed_translations.chinese: 嘲弄；笑柄；徒劳无功；拙劣可笑的模仿或歪曲
detailed_translations.english: when someone laughs at someone or something or shows that they think they are stupid

name: modest
trans: adj. not too proud or confident about yourself or your abilities 谦虚的
adj. unpretentious 朴实无华的
adj. limited in size, amount, or scope 适度的，有限的

sentences.english: You’re too modest! You’ve been a huge help to us.
sentences.chinese: 你太谦虚了！你帮了我们大忙呢。

sentences.english: a modest increase in costs
sentences.chinese: 成本的小幅上涨

detailed_translations.chinese: 谦虚的；不太大的；不很贵的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is modest does not want to talk about their abilities or achievements

name: modicum
trans: n. a small amount 少量

sentences.english: a modicum of common sense
sentences.chinese: 一点常识

detailed_translations.english: a small amount of something, especially a good quality

name: modulate
trans: v. to adjust to or keep in proper measure or proportion 调节

sentences.english: He carefully modulated his voice.
sentences.chinese: 他仔细地调节了自己的声音。

detailed_translations.english: to change the sound of your voice

name: mollify
trans: v. to make less angry 平息，抚慰

sentences.english: He attempted to mollify her.
sentences.chinese: 他想安抚她。

sentences.english: Nature reserves were set up around new power stations to mollify local conservationists.
sentences.chinese: 新的发电站附近建立了自然保护区，以安抚当地的自然环境保护主义者。

detailed_translations.chinese: 平息，缓和；使…平静；使…变软
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel less angry and upset about something

name: momentary
trans: adj. lasting a very short time 短暂的

sentences.english: There was a momentary pause.
sentences.chinese: 停顿了片刻。

detailed_translations.chinese: 瞬间的；短暂的；随时会发生的
detailed_translations.english: continuing for a very short time

name: monitor
trans: v. to watch, observe, listen to, or check for a special purpose over a period of time 观察，监视

sentences.english: a heart monitor
sentences.chinese: 心脏监测仪

detailed_translations.chinese: 班长；监视器，检测器；显示器
detailed_translations.english: a television or part of a computer with a screen, on which you can see pictures or information
to carefully watch and check a situation in order to see how it changes over a period of time

name: monolithic
trans: adj. consisting of or constituting a single unit 单一的
adj. constituting a massive undifferentiated and often rigid whole 单一庞大的

sentences.english: This monolithic environment for an application eliminated any concern about which clock to use -- because there was only one clock.
sentences.chinese: 对于一个应用程序的这个单块集成电路环境消除了使用哪个时钟的问题 —— 因为只有一个时钟。

sentences.english: The solutions that were developed for that were usually large monolithic programs containing the business-level logic hardcoded in the modules.
sentences.chinese: 为此开发的解决方案通常是大型单片电路程序，在一些模块中包含硬编码的业务层面逻辑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 单片电路, 单块集成电路

name: monstrous
trans: adj. extremely or unusually large 巨大的
adj. extraordinarily ugly or vicious 可怕的

sentences.english: a monstrous nose
sentences.chinese: 很大的鼻子

sentences.english: a monstrous shadow on the stairs
sentences.chinese: 楼梯上一个可怕的影子

detailed_translations.english: unusually large

name: morbid
trans: adj. not healthy or normal 病态的

sentences.english: The trip was made all the worse by Frankie’s morbid fear of flying.
sentences.chinese: 弗朗基对坐飞机有种病态的恐惧，使得旅途变得更加糟糕。

sentences.english: His head was full of morbid thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 他的脑袋里全是不健康的思想。

detailed_translations.chinese: 病态的；由病引起的；恐怖的；病变部位的
detailed_translations.english: with a strong and unhealthy interest in unpleasant subjects, especially death

name: mordant
trans: adj. expressing harsh criticism especially in a way that is funny 尖刻的

sentences.english: The play’s mordant comedy makes for compelling viewing.
sentences.chinese: 该剧尖刻幽默的喜剧风格让人看了欲罢不能。

detailed_translations.english: unkind and insulting humour etc that is also funny

name: mount
trans: v. to increase in amount 增加

sentences.english: He mounted the stairs and looked around him slowly.
sentences.chinese: 他登上楼梯，慢慢环顾四周。

sentences.english: Mount Qomolangma
sentences.chinese: 珠穆朗玛峰

detailed_translations.english: to go up a step or stairs
used as part of the name of a mountain

name: muddle
trans: v. to cause confusion in 使...混乱
n. a state of confusion or disorder 混乱

sentences.english: The twins are so alike that it’s easy to muddle them up.
sentences.chinese: 这对双胞胎看上去太像了，很容易弄混。

sentences.english: Spanish and Italian are very similar and I sometimes get them muddled up .
sentences.chinese: 西班牙语和意大利语很相似，我有时会把它们弄混。

detailed_translations.chinese: 混合；使咬字不清晰；使微醉
detailed_translations.english: to confuse one person or thing with another, and make a mistake
when there is confusion about something, and things are done wrong as a result

name: multifaceted
trans: adj. having many different parts 多层面的

sentences.english: a multifaceted campaign to reduce teen pregnancy
sentences.chinese: 一个涉及多方面的减少少女怀孕的运动

detailed_translations.english: having many parts or sides

name: mundane
trans: adj. dull and ordinary 平凡的，乏味的
adj. relating to ordinary life on earth rather than to spiritual things 世俗的

sentences.english: Initially, the work was pretty mundane.
sentences.chinese: 刚开始，这工作非常乏味。

sentences.english: The mundane task of setting the table can be fun on holidays.
sentences.chinese: 摆放餐具这种无趣的事情在假日里也会变得有意思起来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 世俗的，平凡的；世界的，宇宙的
detailed_translations.english: ordinary and not interesting or exciting

name: mutable
trans: adj. able or likely to change often 易变的

sentences.english: Urban lifestyle retreats are in high demand and they are much more than mutable trends.
sentences.chinese: 城市的生活方式，退有很高的需求，他们更比变动趋势。

sentences.english: The Three Concurrency Goblins are all spawned from the same pit of evil: shared access to mutable state.
sentences.chinese: 三个并发哥布林都产生于同样的邪恶陷阱：共享可更改状态的访问权。

detailed_translations.english: able or likely to change

name: naiveté
trans: n. the state or quality of being inexperienced or unsophisticated 天真

name: narcissism
trans: n. egoism, egocentrism 自恋

sentences.english: He went to the gym every day, driven purely by narcissism.
sentences.chinese: 他每天都去健身房，纯粹出于自我欣赏。

detailed_translations.english: when someone is too concerned about their appearance or abilities or spends too much time admiring them – used to show disapproval

name: narrow
trans: adj. minutely precise 精确的，仔细的

sentences.english: The stairs were very narrow.
sentences.chinese: 楼梯非常狭窄。

sentences.english: a long, narrow band of cloud
sentences.chinese: 窄长的云带

detailed_translations.english: measuring only a small distance from one side to the other, especially in relation to the length

name: nascent
trans: adj. beginning to exist 刚出现的

sentences.english: the country’s nascent democracy
sentences.chinese: 该国新生的民主

sentences.english: their nascent industries
sentences.chinese: 他们的新兴行业

detailed_translations.chinese: 初期的；开始存在的，发生中的
detailed_translations.english: coming into existence or starting to develop

name: naysayer
trans: n. a person who says something will not work or is not possible 唱反调的人

sentences.english: Give up being a naysayer.
sentences.chinese: 不要做消极的否定者。

name: nebulous
trans: adj. not clear 模糊的

sentences.english: a nebulous ghostly figure
sentences.chinese: 幽灵般朦胧的身影

detailed_translations.chinese: 朦胧的；星云的，星云状的
detailed_translations.english: a shape that is nebulous is unclear and has no definite edges

name: negligent
trans: adj. failing to take proper or normal care of something or someone 疏忽大意的

sentences.english: Mr Brown was found guilty of negligent driving.
sentences.chinese: 布朗先生被判疏忽驾驶罪。

detailed_translations.english: not taking enough care over something that you are responsible for, with the result that serious mistakes are made

name: negligible
trans: adj. very small or unimportant 微不足道的，不重要的

sentences.english: The damage done to his property was negligible.
sentences.chinese: 对他财产造成的损失微不足道。

detailed_translations.english: too slight or unimportant to have any effect

name: negotiable
trans: adj. able to be discussed and changed before an agreement or decision is made 可协商的

sentences.english: Part-time barman required. Hours and salary negotiable.
sentences.chinese: 招聘兼职酒吧男服务员，工作时间及薪金面议。

sentences.english: The price is not negotiable.
sentences.chinese: 价格没有商量的余地。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可通过谈判解决的；可协商的
detailed_translations.english: an offer, price, contract etc that is negotiable can be discussed and changed before being agreed on

name: nettle
trans: v. to make angry 激怒

sentences.english: The nettles stung their legs.
sentences.chinese: 荨麻刺痛了他们的腿。

detailed_translations.english: a wild plant with rough leaves that sting you

name: neutrality
trans: n. the quality or state of not supporting either side in an argument, fight, war, etc. 中立

sentences.english: Net neutrality, or not?
sentences.chinese: 网络中立或不?

sentences.english: Some of the nations declared neutrality.
sentences.chinese: 有的国家宣布中立。

sentences.english: Yet in our view, the notion of “search neutrality” threatens innovation, competition and, fundamentally,your ability as a user to improve how you find information.
sentences.chinese: 但在我们看来“搜索中立”这个概念威胁创新，竞争和本质上的，你作为一个用户去提高你寻找信息的能力。

detailed_translations.english: the state of not supporting either side in an argument or war

name: nimble
trans: adj. able to move quickly, easily, and lightly 敏捷的
adj. able to learn and understand things quickly and easily 敏锐的

sentences.english: nimble fingers
sentences.chinese: 灵巧的手指

sentences.english: a nimble climber
sentences.chinese: 敏捷的攀登者

detailed_translations.english: able to move quickly and easily with light neat movements

name: no-nonsense
trans: adj. very serious about doing things in a direct and efficient way without any foolishness or nonsense 严肃的，高效干练的

name: noisome
trans: adj. offensive to the senses and especially to the sense of smell 令人讨厌的，恶臭的

sentences.english: noisome smells
sentences.chinese: 令人生厌的气味

name: nonchalant
trans: adj. having an air of easy unconcern or indifference 冷漠的

sentences.english: Clark's mother is nonchalant about her role in her son's latest work.
sentences.chinese: 克拉克的母亲对她在儿子最新作品中的角色反应平淡。

sentences.english: Denis tried to look nonchalant and uninterested.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼斯尽力作出冷淡、不感兴趣的样子。

detailed_translations.english: If you describe someone as nonchalant, you mean that they appear not to worry or care about things and that they seem very calm

name: nonconformist
trans: n. a person who does not behave the way most people behave 不守成规者

sentences.english: Victoria stood out as a dazzling nonconformist.
sentences.chinese: 维多利亚以令人惊叹的异己形象而引人注目。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不遵守规范的人，不遵循常规的人
detailed_translations.english: someone who does not accept the ways of thinking or behaving accepted by most other people in their society or group

name: nondescript
trans: adj. lacking distinctive or interesting qualities 无个性的

sentences.english: a rather nondescript suburban house
sentences.chinese: 很普通的郊区房子

detailed_translations.chinese: 平凡的，没有特色的；难以区别的；莫可名状的
detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is nondescript looks very ordinary and is not at all interesting or unusual

detailed_translations.chinese: 不属任何类型的人；难以形容的人或物

name: nonspecialist
trans: n. someone who does not specialize in a particular area, activity, field of research, etc. 非专业人士

name: nostalgia
trans: n. pleasure and sadness that is caused by remembering something from the past and wishing that you could experience it again 怀旧
n. the state of being homesick 思乡

sentences.english: He might be influenced by nostalgia for the surroundings of his happy youth.
sentences.chinese: 他也许被他对快乐青年时代的环境的怀念影响了。

detailed_translations.english: Nostalgia is an affectionate feeling you have for the past, especially for a particularly happy time

name: novel
trans: adj. new and different from what has been known before 新颖的

sentences.english: a novel by Jane Austen
sentences.chinese: 简·奥斯丁的小说

sentences.english: What a novel idea!.
sentences.chinese: 多么新奇的想法呀！

detailed_translations.english: a long written story in which the characters and events are usually imaginary
not like anything known before, and unusual or interesting

name: novice
trans: n. a person who has just started learning or doing something 新手

sentences.english: The computer course is ideal for novices.
sentences.chinese: 这门计算机课程非常适合初学者。

sentences.english: This trail is not recommended for novice bikers.
sentences.chinese: 不建议自行车新手走这条小路。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has no experience in a skill, subject, or activity

name: noxious
trans: adj. harmful to living things 有害的，有毒的

sentences.english: noxious fumes
sentences.chinese: 有毒烟雾

detailed_translations.chinese: 有害的；有毒的；败坏道德的；讨厌的
detailed_translations.english: harmful or poisonous

name: nuance
trans: n. a very small difference in color, tone, meaning, etc. 细微差别

sentences.english: He was aware of every nuance in her voice.
sentences.chinese: 他听得出她声音中的每一个细微变化。

sentences.english: subtle nuances of meaning
sentences.chinese: 含义的细微差别

detailed_translations.english: a very slight, hardly noticeable difference in manner, colour, meaning etc

name: numinous
trans: adj. having a mysterious, holy, or spiritual quality 神圣的
adj. supernatural, mysterious 超自然的，神秘的

sentences.english: The account of spiritual struggle that follows has a humbling and numinous power.
sentences.chinese: 接下来的关于精神挣扎的叙述有一种令人谦卑和神圣的力量。

detailed_translations.english: having a mysterious and holy quality, which makes you feel that God is present

name: obdurate
trans: adj. refusing to do what other people want 固执的

sentences.english: They argued, but he remained obdurate.
sentences.chinese: 他们发生了争论，但他还是固执己见。

detailed_translations.chinese: 顽固的，执拗的；冷酷无情的
detailed_translations.english: very determined not to change your beliefs, actions, or feelings, in a way that seems unreasonable

name: obedience
trans: n. the act of obeying 服从

sentences.english: obedience classes for dogs and their owners
sentences.chinese: 为狗和主人安排的服从训练课

detailed_translations.english: when someone does what they are told to do, or what a law, rule etc says they must do

name: obeisance
trans: n. respect for someone or something 尊敬

sentences.english: While he was still young and strong all paid obeisance to him.
sentences.chinese: 他年轻力壮时所有人都对他毕恭毕敬。

detailed_translations.english: respect and obedience to someone or something, often shown by bending your head or the upper part of your body

name: obfuscate
trans: v. to make more difficult to understand 混淆，使迷惑

sentences.english: They are obfuscating the issue, as only insurance companies can.
sentences.chinese: 他们在这个问题上混淆视听，也只有保险公司才做得出这种事。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately make something unclear or difficult to understand

name: objectionable
trans: adj. causing people to be offended 令人反感的

name: objective
trans: adj. based on facts rather than feelings or opinions 客观的，公正的

sentences.english: He vowed to achieve certain objectives before the end of his presidency.
sentences.chinese: 他立誓要在他的总统任期结束之前实现某些目标。

sentences.english: the best way to accomplish your objectives
sentences.chinese: 完成目标的最佳方法

sentences.english: The degree program has two main objectives.
sentences.chinese: 该学位课程有两个主要目标。

sentences.english: Managers should set specific performance objectives for their teams.
sentences.chinese: 经理应该为自己的团队制定明确的绩效目标。

sentences.english: The main objective was to improve children’s knowledge of geography.
sentences.chinese: 主要目的是要增长儿童的地理知识。

sentences.english: A clear objective was set and adhered to.
sentences.chinese: 定下了明确的目标并坚持到底。

sentences.english: One of your first business objectives should be to get your own office.
sentences.chinese: 你的首要工作目标之一应该是拥有自己的办公室。

detailed_translations.english: something that you are trying hard to achieve, especially in business or politics

name: obligatory
trans: adj. required by a law or rule 强制性的
adj. always or often included as a familiar and expected part of something 习惯性的

sentences.english: She offered him the obligatory cup of tea.
sentences.chinese: 她照例给他端来一杯茶。

detailed_translations.chinese: (法律或道义上)必须的，应尽的
detailed_translations.english: something that is obligatory must be done because of a law, rule etc

name: obliterate
trans: v. to destroy completely so that nothing is left 清除，摧毁

sentences.english: Nothing could obliterate the memory of those tragic events.
sentences.chinese: 那些悲惨事件的记忆是无法抹去的。

detailed_translations.english: to remove a thought, feeling, or memory from someone’s mind

name: obscure
trans: adj. not well-known 不出名的
adj. difficult to understand 费解的
v. to make difficult to understand or know 使...费解
v. to hide or cover 遮盖

sentences.english: an obscure poet
sentences.chinese: 名不见经传的诗人

sentences.english: The details of his life remain obscure.
sentences.chinese: 他的生平不详。

sentences.english: Trees obscured his vision; he couldn't see much of the square's southern half.
sentences.chinese: 树木遮住了他的视线，他不怎么看得见广场南半部。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不著名的，不重要的；费解的，模糊不清的
detailed_translations.english: not well known and usually not very important
If one thing obscures another, it prevents it from being seen or heard properly

name: obsequious
trans: adj. too eager to help or obey someone important 谄媚的

sentences.english: an obsequious smile
sentences.chinese: 谄媚的微笑

detailed_translations.english: very eager to please or agree with people who are powerful – used in order to show disapproval

name: observation
trans: n. a comment or remark 评论
n. something you notice by watching and listening 观察
n. an act or instance of observing a custom, rule, or law 遵守

sentences.english: Darwin’s observations on the habits of certain birds
sentences.chinese: 达尔文对某些鸟类习性的论述

sentences.english: Paz makes some observations about the role of the critic.
sentences.chinese: 帕斯论述了评论家的作用。

detailed_translations.english: a spoken or written remark about something you have noticed

name: obsessed
trans: adj. if someone is obsessed with a person or thing, they keep thinking about them and find it difficult to think about anything else 着迷的

sentences.english: He was obsessed with gangster movies.
sentences.chinese: 他那时迷上了警匪片。

detailed_translations.english: If someone is obsessed with a person or thing, they keep thinking about them and find it difficult to think about anything else

name: obsolete
trans: adj. no longer used by anyone 废弃的，老式的

sentences.english: obsolete weapons
sentences.chinese: 已被淘汰的武器

sentences.english: computer hardware that quickly became obsolete
sentences.chinese: 很快就变得过时的电脑硬件

sentences.english: Will computers render (= make ) books obsolete?
sentences.chinese: 计算机会把书籍淘汰掉吗？

detailed_translations.english: no longer useful, because something newer and better has been invented

name: obstacle
trans: n. something that impedes progress or achievement 障碍

sentences.english: The tax puts obstacles in the way of companies trying to develop trade overseas.
sentences.chinese: 这项税收为想在海外发展贸易的公司设置了障碍。

sentences.english: Women still have to overcome many obstacles to gain equality.
sentences.chinese: 妇女要获得平等仍需克服重重障碍。

sentences.english: We want to remove all obstacles to travel between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们想要消除在这两个国家之间旅行的所有障碍。

sentences.english: the single biggest obstacle to a Conservative victory in the next election
sentences.chinese: 保守党在下一届大选中获胜的最大障碍

sentences.english: There are formidable obstacles on the road to peace.
sentences.chinese: 通往和平的道路上存在难以逾越的障碍。

detailed_translations.english: something that makes it difficult to achieve some­thing

name: obtain
trans: v. to gain or attain usually by planned action or effort 获得

sentences.english: These conditions no longer obtain.
sentences.chinese: 这些状况已不复存在。

detailed_translations.chinese: 通用， 流行； 存在
detailed_translations.english: if a situation, system, or rule obtains, it continues to exist
to get something that you want, especially through your own effort, skill, or work

name: obtrusive
trans: adj. noticeable in an unpleasant or annoying way 惹眼的

sentences.english: obtrusive TV antennas
sentences.chinese: 碍眼的电视天线

detailed_translations.chinese: 突出的；强迫人的；冒失的

name: obviate
trans: v. to make no longer necessary 避免，取消

sentences.english: The new treatment obviates the need for surgery.
sentences.chinese: 新的疗法免除了手术的必要。

detailed_translations.english: to prevent or avoid a problem or the need to do something

name: occlude
trans: v. to close up or block off 阻闭

detailed_translations.english: to block or stop up (a passage or opening); obstruct

name: occult
trans: adj. not easily apprehended or understood 神秘的

sentences.english: occult practices
sentences.chinese: 神秘习俗

sentences.english: the occult powers
sentences.chinese: 超自然力量

detailed_translations.chinese: 神秘的；超自然的；难以理解的
detailed_translations.english: magical and mysterious
mysterious practices and powers involving magic and spirits

name: offset
trans: v. to create an equal balance between two things 补偿，抵消

sentences.english: He was able to offset his travel expenses against tax.
sentences.chinese: 他可以用旅费抵税。

sentences.english: What expenses can you offset against tax ?
sentences.chinese: 什么开支可以获得税项减免？

detailed_translations.english: to use one cost, payment or situation in order to cancel or reduce the effect of another

name: old-fashioned
trans: adj. of, relating to, or characteristic of a past era 老式的
adj. outmoded 过时的

name: ominous
trans: adj. suggesting that something bad is going to happen in the future 不祥的

sentences.english: ‘How long will she be ill?’ he asked. There was an ominous silence.
sentences.chinese: “她的病多久会好？”他问。大家的沉默让人感觉不妙。

sentences.english: The car is making an ominous rattling sound.
sentences.chinese: 汽车在发出一种不妙的咔嗒声。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel that something bad is going to happen

name: omit
trans: v. to leave out 遗漏

sentences.english: Please don’t omit any details, no matter how trivial they may seem.
sentences.chinese: 请不要忽略任何细节，不管它多细小。

detailed_translations.english: to not include someone or something, either deliberately or because you forget to do it

name: omnipresent
trans: adj. present in all places at all times 无处不在的

sentences.english: The sound of sirens was an omnipresent background noise in New York.
sentences.chinese: 在纽约，警报声是无处不在的背景噪音。

detailed_translations.english: present everywhere at all times

name: onerous
trans: adj. difficult and unpleasant to do or deal with 繁重的

sentences.english: an onerous task
sentences.chinese: 艰巨的任务

detailed_translations.chinese: 繁重的；麻烦的；负有义务的；负有法律责任的
detailed_translations.english: work or a responsibility that is onerous is difficult and worrying or makes you tired

name: onetime
trans: adj. having been someone or something specified in the past 过去的

sentences.english: The onetime heir apparent had played an instrumental role this year in propping up his father's rule and his crackdown against the rebellion that ultimately ended his 42-year grip on power.
sentences.chinese: 曾一度作为卡扎菲继承人的赛义夫今年在巩固其父亲的统治并帮助镇压反抗武装一事中起到积极作用。 这场反抗活动最终结束了卡扎菲对利比亚42年的统治。

name: onset
trans: n. the beginning of something 开始

sentences.english: the onset of winter
sentences.chinese: 冬天的来临

detailed_translations.chinese: 开始，着手；发作；攻击，进攻
detailed_translations.english: the beginning of something, especially something bad

name: opaque
trans: adj. not letting light through 不透明的
adj. difficult to understand or explain 难懂的

sentences.english: a shower with an opaque glass door
sentences.chinese: 装有不透明玻璃门的淋浴间

detailed_translations.chinese: 不透明的；不传热的；迟钝的
detailed_translations.english: opaque glass or liquid is difficult to see through and often thick

name: opinionated
trans: adj. unduly adhering to one’s own opinion or to preconceived notions 固执己见的

sentences.english: I found him very arrogant and opinionated.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得他非常傲慢和固执。

detailed_translations.english: expressing very strong opinions about things

name: opportune
trans: adj. done or happening at the right time 适时的

sentences.english: I waited, hoping for an opportune moment to discuss the possibility of a raise.
sentences.chinese: 我等待着，希望会有一个合适的时机讨论加薪的事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 适当的；恰好的；合时宜的
detailed_translations.english: a time that is suitable for doing something

name: oppressive
trans: adj. very cruel or unfair 残酷的
adj. overwhelming or depressing to the spirit or senses 令人窒息的

sentences.english: The new laws will be just as oppressive as those they replace.
sentences.chinese: 新法律将跟被它所取代的那些法律一样不公正。

detailed_translations.chinese: 压迫的；沉重的；压制性的；难以忍受的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe a society, its laws, or customs as oppressive, you think they treat people cruelly and unfairly

name: opprobrium
trans: n. very strong disapproval or criticism of a person or thing especially by a large number of people 谴责
n. something that brings disgrace 耻辱

sentences.english: His political opinions have attracted the opprobrium of the Left.
sentences.chinese: 他的政治观点遭到左派的抨击。

name: optimism
trans: n. a feeling or belief that good things will happen in the future 乐观

sentences.english: There are grounds for cautious optimism.
sentences.chinese: 有理由保持谨慎乐观。

detailed_translations.english: a tendency to believe that good things will always happen

name: opulent
trans: adj. having a large estate or property 富裕的
adj. amply or plentifully provided or fashioned often to the point of ostentation 豪华的，奢侈的

sentences.english: evening dresses in opulent fabrics
sentences.chinese: 用华丽织物做成的晚礼服

name: orderly
trans: adj. arranged or organized in a logical or regular way 有秩序的

sentences.english: She needs to organize her ideas in a more orderly way.
sentences.chinese: 她需要把自己的想法组织得更有条理些。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有秩序的；整齐的；值班的
detailed_translations.english: arranged or organized in a sensible or neat way
someone who does unskilled jobs in a hospital

name: orientation
trans: n. a main interest, quality, or goal 目标，态度

sentences.english: The company needs to develop a stronger orientation towards marketing its products.
sentences.chinese: 公司需要针对其产品的营销设定一个更为明确的目标。

sentences.english: How can we get students to adopt a serious orientation to learning?
sentences.chinese: 我们怎样才能让学生对学习采取认真的态度呢？

detailed_translations.english: the type of activity or subject that a person or organization seems most interested in and gives most attention to

name: original
trans: adj. made or produced first 原创的
adj. not like others 新颖的

sentences.english: The land was returned to its original owner.
sentences.chinese: 这块土地归还给了原主。

sentences.english: The kitchen still has many original features (= parts that were there when the house was first built ).
sentences.chinese: 这间厨房仍保留着当初的许多特点。

sentences.english: the original meaning of the word
sentences.chinese: 这个单词的原意

sentences.english: The original plan was to fly out to New York.
sentences.chinese: 原先的计划是飞往纽约。

detailed_translations.english: existing or happening first, before other people or things

name: orthodox
trans: adj. accepted as true or correct by most people 正统的

sentences.english: orthodox medical treatments
sentences.chinese: 传统疗法

sentences.english: He challenged the orthodox views on education.
sentences.chinese: 他对传统的教育观念提出了质疑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 正统的；传统的；惯常的；东正教的
detailed_translations.english: orthodox ideas, methods, or behaviour are accepted by most people to be correct and right

name: oust
trans: v. to cause or force to leave a position of power, a competition, etc.
罢黜，驱逐
v. to take the place of 取代

sentences.english: The leaders have been ousted from power by nationalists.
sentences.chinese: 那些领导人已被民族主义者赶下了台。

sentences.english: The Republicans may oust him in November.
sentences.chinese: 共和党人可能在11月罢免他。

detailed_translations.english: If someone is ousted from a position of power, job, or place, they are forced to leave it

name: outdated
trans: adj. no longer useful or acceptable 过时的

sentences.english: outdated teaching methods
sentences.chinese: 不合时宜的教学方法

sentences.english: a factory with outdated equipment
sentences.chinese: 设备陈旧的工厂

sentences.english: His writing style is now boring and outdated.
sentences.chinese: 他的写作风格如今已显得乏味而过时了。

detailed_translations.english: if something is outdated, it is no longer considered useful or effective, because something more modern exists

name: outdo
trans: v. to be better than 超过

sentences.english: When it comes to speed of response, a small firm can outdo a big company.
sentences.chinese: 说到反应速度，小公司会胜过大公司。

detailed_translations.english: to be better or more successful than someone else at doing something

name: outmoded
trans: adj. not modern or current 过时的

sentences.english: outmoded ideas
sentences.chinese: 过时的观点

detailed_translations.english: no longer fashionable or useful

name: outstanding
trans: adj. extremely good or excellent 杰出的
adj. easy to notice especially  because of being important or very good 显著的

sentences.english: an outstanding example of a 13th-century castle
sentences.chinese: 13世纪城堡的杰出典范

sentences.english: an outstanding success
sentences.chinese: 了不起的成功

sentences.english: His performance was outstanding.
sentences.chinese: 他的表演相当出色。

detailed_translations.chinese: 杰出的；显著的；未解决的；未偿付的
detailed_translations.english: extremely good

name: outstrip
trans: v. to get ahead of 超过

sentences.english: We outstripped all our competitors in sales last year.
sentences.chinese: 去年我们的销售额超过了所有竞争对手。

detailed_translations.english: to do something better than someone else or be more successful

name: overbearing
trans: adj. harshly and haughtily arrogant 傲慢的，专横的

sentences.english: a bossy overbearing wife
sentences.chinese: 专横霸道的妻子

detailed_translations.english: always trying to control other people without considering their wishes or feelings

name: overblown
trans: adj. inflated 浮夸的，过分的

sentences.english: He’s not really a scientist; he’s just an overblown technician.
sentences.chinese: 他根本不是科学家，只是个装模作样的技师而已。

detailed_translations.chinese: 盛期已过的， 残败的； 夸张的
detailed_translations.english: made to seem greater or more impressive than something really is

name: overlook
trans: v. to fail to see or notice 忽略
v. inspect 监督
v. to look down upon from above 俯瞰

sentences.english: Our room overlooks the ocean.
sentences.chinese: 我们的房间可以俯视大海。

sentences.english: It is easy to overlook a small detail like that.
sentences.chinese: 那样的小细节很容易被忽略。

sentences.english: She found him entertaining enough to overlook his faults.
sentences.chinese: 她觉得他很有趣，足以让她包容他的缺点。

detailed_translations.english: if a house, room etc overlooks something, it has a view of it, usually from above

name: oversell
trans: v. to make excessive claims for 吹嘘
v. to sell too much or too many 过多出售

name: overshadow
trans: v. to exceed in importance 超越

sentences.english: Hester is overshadowed by her younger and more attractive sister.
sentences.chinese: 她那更年轻而且更有魅力的妹妹使赫斯特黯然失色。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使失色；使阴暗；遮阴；夺去…的光彩
detailed_translations.english: If you are overshadowed by a person or thing, you are less successful, important, or impressive than they are

name: overstate
trans: v. to say that is larger or greater than it really is 夸大

sentences.english: To say that all motorists speed in residential areas is overstating the case.
sentences.chinese: 说所有驾驶员都在住宅区内超速行驶是言过其实了。

sentences.english: The importance of a child’s early years cannot be overstated (= is very important ).
sentences.chinese: 儿童幼年期的重要性怎么强调也不为过。

detailed_translations.english: to talk about something in a way that makes it seem more important, serious etc than it really is

name: overthrow
trans: v. to remove from power especially by force 推翻，废除

sentences.english: Rebels were already making plans to overthrow the government.
sentences.chinese: 反叛者已在密谋颠覆政府。

sentences.english: The organization was dedicated to the overthrow of capitalism.
sentences.chinese: 该组织致力于推翻资本主义。

detailed_translations.english: to remove a leader or government from power, especially by force
the defeat and removal from power of a leader or government, especially by force

name: overwhelming
trans: adj. tending or serving to overwhelm 势不可挡的，压倒一切的

sentences.english: There is overwhelming evidence that smoking damages your health.
sentences.chinese: 有难以辩驳的证据表明吸烟有损健康。

sentences.english: An overwhelming majority of the members were against the idea.
sentences.chinese: 占压倒性多数的成员反对这项主张。

sentences.english: The proposal has been given overwhelming support.
sentences.chinese: 这一提议得到了压倒性多数的支持。

sentences.english: The British Air Force succeeded despite overwhelming odds against them.
sentences.chinese: 英国空军虽然处境极为不利，但还是完成了任务。

detailed_translations.english: very large or greater, more important etc than any other

name: pacific
trans: adj. loving peace 和平主义的

sentences.english: Gorbachev was less pacific than people thought.
sentences.chinese: 戈尔巴乔夫不像人们想得那样温和。

detailed_translations.english: peaceful and loving or wanting peace

name: painstaking
trans: adj. showing or done with great care and effort 煞费苦心的

sentences.english: You said in your address that "developing excellence is a slow, painstaking process".
sentences.chinese: 你在你的致词中说“发展卓越性是一个缓慢艰苦的过程”。

sentences.english: In order to transform their environment, he drew up the project with painstaking accuracy.
sentences.chinese: 为了改造环境， 他苦心孤诣地制订了这个计划。

name: palliate
trans: v. to moderate the intensity of 减轻
v. the cover by excuses and apologies 辩解

sentences.english: Chosen carefully, the oils may not only palliate but also cure the condition.
sentences.chinese: 如果仔细挑选，挑到的精油不仅可以缓和症状，还可以治愈疾病。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce the effects of illness, pain etc without curing them

name: paltry
trans: adj. very small or too small in amount 很少的
adj. having little meaning, importance, or worth 无意义的

sentences.english: paltry sum of money
sentences.chinese: 微不足道的一点钱

sentences.english: He received only a paltry £25 a day.
sentences.chinese: 他每天只能拿到可怜的25英镑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不足取的；无价值的；琐碎的；卑鄙的
detailed_translations.english: a paltry amount of something is too small to be useful or important

name: panacea
trans: n. something that will make everything about a situation better 万能药

sentences.english: Trade is not a panacea for the world's economic or social ills.
sentences.chinese: 贸易不是世界经济或社会弊端的万灵丹。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that something is a panacea for a set of problems, you mean that it will solve all those problems

name: paradigm
trans: n. a model or pattern for something that may be copied 模板，典范

sentences.english: ...a new paradigm of production.
sentences.chinese: …一种新的生产范例。

detailed_translations.english: a very clear or typical example of something

name: paradoxical
trans: adj. of the nature of a paradox 矛盾的

sentences.english: Some sedatives produce the paradoxical effect of making the person more anxious.
sentences.chinese: 一些镇静剂产生出使人更紧张这样自相矛盾的结果。

detailed_translations.chinese: 矛盾的；诡论的；似非而是的
detailed_translations.english: If something is paradoxical, it involves two facts or qualities that seem to contradict each other

name: parity
trans: n. the quality or state of being equal or equivalent 平等，相等

sentences.english: Women have yet to achieve wage or occupational parity in many fields.
sentences.chinese: 妇女们在许多领域尚有待获得薪酬或职业的平等。

detailed_translations.chinese: 平价；同等；相等；胎次；分娩
detailed_translations.english: the state of being equal, especially having equal pay, rights, or power

name: parochial
trans: adj. limited to only the things that affect your local area 狭隘的

sentences.english: the parochial church council
sentences.chinese: 教区的教堂理事会

detailed_translations.chinese: 教区的；狭小的；地方范围的
detailed_translations.english: relating to a particular church and the area around it

name: parsimonious
trans: adj. very unwilling to spend money 吝啬的

detailed_translations.chinese: 吝啬的；过于节俭的；质量差的
detailed_translations.english: extremely unwilling to spend money

name: partisan
trans: adj. devoted to or biased in support of a party, group, or cause 有偏见的

sentences.english: British newspapers are highly partisan .
sentences.chinese: 英国报纸的立场壁垒分明。

detailed_translations.chinese: 党派的；效忠的；偏袒的；盲目推崇的
detailed_translations.english: strongly supporting a particular political party, plan or leader, usually without considering the other choices carefully
a member of an armed group that fights against an enemy that has taken control of its country

name: passive
trans: adj. used to describe someone who allows things to happen or who accepts what other people do or decide without trying to change anything 被动的

sentences.english: Kathy seems to take a very passive role in the relationship.
sentences.chinese: 凯茜在这一关系中似乎扮演着十分被动的角色。

sentences.english: their passive acceptance of their fate
sentences.chinese: 他们对命运的消极接受

detailed_translations.english: someone who is passive tends to accept things that happen to them or things that people say to them, without taking any action

name: pastiche
trans: n. a mixture of different things 大杂烩

sentences.english: His bathroom is a brilliant pastiche of expensive interior design.
sentences.chinese: 他的浴室是高档室内设计的集大成之作。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of writing, music, film etc that is deliberately made in the style of someone or something else

name: pastoral
trans: adj. of or relating to the countryside or to the lives of people who live in the country 乡村的

sentences.english: his pastoral work among the congregation
sentences.chinese: 他在教堂会众中的牧灵工作

detailed_translations.chinese: 牧师的；牧人的；田园生活的；乡村的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the duties of a priest, minister etc towards the members of their religious group

name: patchwork
trans: n. something that is made up of different things 大杂烩

name: patent
trans: n. an official document conferring a right or privilege 专利
adj. obvious or clear 显而易见的

sentences.english: a patent lock
sentences.chinese: 专利锁

sentences.english: He held a number of patents for his many innovations.
sentences.chinese: 他为他的许多革新申请了几项专利。

detailed_translations.english: protected by a patent
A patent is an official right to be the only person or company allowed to make or sell a new product for a certain period of time.

name: pathetic
trans: adj. causing feelings of sadness and sympathy 可怜的

sentences.english: You’re pathetic! Here, let me do it.
sentences.chinese: 你真没用！来，让我做吧。

sentences.english: I know it sounds pathetic now, but at the time I was frightened.
sentences.chinese: 我知道现在听起来挺窝囊，不过当时我很害怕。

sentences.english: Vic made a pathetic attempt to apologise.
sentences.chinese: 维克很勉强地道了歉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 差劲的， 令人生厌的； 引起怜悯的， 可怜的， 可悲的
detailed_translations.english: something or someone that is pathetic is so useless, unsuccessful, or weak that they annoy you

name: paucity
trans: n. a small amount of something 不足

sentences.english: Even the film's impressive finale can't hide the first hour's paucity of imagination.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影在开头一个小时中毫无想象力，即使有个让人印象深刻的结局也无法掩盖这个缺憾。

detailed_translations.english: less than is needed of something

name: peculiar
trans: adj. not usual or normal 奇怪的

sentences.english: He’s been a little peculiar lately.
sentences.chinese: 最近他有点怪异。

sentences.english: She’s a very peculiar child.
sentences.chinese: 她是个非常古怪的孩子。

detailed_translations.english: behaving in a strange and slightly crazy way

name: pecuniary
trans: adj. of or relating to money 金钱的

sentences.english: He was trying to get a pecuniary advantage for himself.
sentences.chinese: 他拼命为自己敛财。

detailed_translations.english: relating to or consisting of money

name: pedestrian
trans: adj. commonplace, unimaginative 乏味的

sentences.english: More than a third of all pedestrian injuries are to children.
sentences.chinese: 所有受伤的行人中有1/3以上是儿童。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is walking, especially along a street or other place used by cars

name: pedigree
trans: n. an ancestral line 身世

sentences.english: The service pedigree helps to determine the importance of the service in context of all the services provided.
sentences.chinese: 服务家谱可帮助确定服务在所提供的所有服务的上下文中的重要性。

sentences.english: This chart, also known as a pedigree, lists members of each generation of your biological family, with all available health and disease information.
sentences.chinese: 这份家谱关系图会列举出你这个家庭每一代所拥有成员，并附加有成员所有已知的健康和疾病信息。

detailed_translations.english: the parents and other past family members of an animal or person, or an official written record of this
a pedigree animal comes from a family that has been recorded for a long time and is considered to be of a very good  breed

name: peer
trans: n. a person who belongs to the same age group or social group as someone else 同龄人，同地位的人
v. to look searchingly at something difficult to discern 凝视

sentences.english: American children did less well in math than their peers in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 美国儿童的数学成绩不如日本的同龄儿童。

sentences.english: Staff members are trained by their peers.
sentences.chinese: 员工由同事培训。

detailed_translations.english: your peers are the people who are the same age as you, or who have the same type of job, social class etc

name: pejorative
trans: adj. insulting to someone or something 轻蔑的

sentences.english: For hard-line Republicans, the word ‘liberal’ had become a pejorative term.
sentences.chinese: 对强硬派共和党来说，“自由”一词已成了贬义词。

detailed_translations.chinese: 轻蔑的；[临床] 恶化的，变坏的

name: pellucid
trans: adj. very clear 清晰的

sentences.english: a pellucid stream
sentences.chinese: 清澈的小溪

detailed_translations.english: very clear

name: penalty
trans: n. punishment for breaking a rule or law 处罚
n. a disadvantage or difficulty you experience 不利结果

sentences.english: No littering. Penalty $500.
sentences.chinese: 禁止乱扔垃圾。 违者罚款500美元。

sentences.english: Withdrawing the money early will result in a 10% penalty.
sentences.chinese: 提前支取这笔钱将被处以10%的罚金。

sentences.english: If he is convicted, he could receive the death penalty (= be killed as a punishment ) .
sentences.chinese: 一旦定罪，他可能会被判处死刑。

detailed_translations.english: a punishment for breaking a law, rule, or legal agreement

name: penchant
trans: n. a strong and continued inclination 倾向，嗜好

sentences.english: a penchant for fast cars
sentences.chinese: 对跑车的酷爱

detailed_translations.english: if you have a penchant for something, you like that thing very much and try to do it or have it often

name: perceptible
trans: adj. able to be seen or noticed 可见的，可觉察的

sentences.english: a small but perceptible change
sentences.chinese: 微小但可以察觉的变化

sentences.english: The sound was barely perceptible .
sentences.chinese: 那声音几乎听不见。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可察觉的；可感知的；看得见的
detailed_translations.english: something that is perceptible can be noticed, although it is very small

name: peregrinate
trans: v. to walk or travel over 旅行

name: perennial
trans: adj. existing or continuing in the same way for a long time 持久的

sentences.english: Lack of resources has been a perennial problem since the beginning.
sentences.chinese: 财力不足从最初起就一直是个问题。

detailed_translations.chinese: 多年生的；常年的；四季不断的；常在的；反复的
detailed_translations.english: a plant that is perennial lives for more than two years
a plant that lives for more than two years

name: perfunctory
trans: adj. used to describe something that is done without energy or enthusiasm because of habit or because it is expected 敷衍的

sentences.english: She gave him a perfunctory smile.
sentences.chinese: 她对他漫不经心地笑了笑。

sentences.english: The applause was perfunctory.
sentences.chinese: 掌声听上去是在敷衍了事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 敷衍的；马虎的；得过且过的
detailed_translations.english: a perfunctory action is done quickly, and is only done because people expect it

name: perilous
trans: adj. full of danger 危险的

sentences.english: a perilous journey across the mountains
sentences.chinese: 穿越群山的危险旅程

detailed_translations.english: very dangerous

name: peripatetic
trans: adj. pedestrian, itinerant 巡回的

sentences.english: a peripatetic music teacher
sentences.chinese: 在多所学校任教的音乐教师

detailed_translations.english: travelling from place to place, especially in order to do your job

name: peripheral
trans: adj. of, relating to, involving, or forming a periphery or surface part 边缘的

sentences.english: a diplomat who had a peripheral role in the negotiations
sentences.chinese: 在谈判中发挥辅助作用的外交官

sentences.english: Her involvement in the case was peripheral.
sentences.chinese: 她在这宗案件中是从犯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 外围的；次要的；（神经）末梢区域的
detailed_translations.english: not as important as other things or people in a particular activity, idea, or situation
a piece of equipment that is connected to a computer and used with it, for example a  printer

name: permeable
trans: adj. allowing liquids or gases to pass through 可渗透的

sentences.english: the permeable cell membrane
sentences.chinese: 渗透性的细胞膜

detailed_translations.english: material that is permeable allows water, gas etc to pass through it

name: perpetuate
trans: v. to make perpetual or cause to last indefinitely 使…永存

sentences.english: an education system that perpetuates the divisions in our society
sentences.chinese: 使我们的社会持续分化的一种教育制度

name: perplex
trans: v. to confuse very much 迷惑

sentences.english: Shea’s symptoms perplexed the doctors.
sentences.chinese: 谢伊的症状令医生们困惑。

detailed_translations.english: if something perplexes you, it makes you feel confused and worried because it is difficult to understand

name: persist
trans: v. to continue to do something or to try to do something even though it is difficult or other people want you to stop 坚持不懈

sentences.english: If the pain persists, you must see a doctor.
sentences.chinese: 如果一直痛，你就必须去看医生了。

detailed_translations.english: if something bad persists, it continues to exist or happen

name: perspicacious
trans: adj. having or showing an ability to notice and understand things that are difficult or not obvious 有洞察力的

sentences.english: ...one of the most perspicacious and perceptive historians of that period.
sentences.chinese: ...那个时期最敏锐、最有洞察力的历史学家之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有洞察力的；聪颖的；敏锐的
detailed_translations.english: good at judging and understanding people and situations

name: pertain
trans: v. to relate to someone or something 有关
v. to belong as a part, member, accessory or product 从属

sentences.english: ...matters pertaining to naval district defence.
sentences.chinese: …与海军区域防卫有关的问题。

detailed_translations.english: If one thing pertains to another, it relates, belongs, or applies to it

name: pervasive
trans: adj. existing in every part of something 普遍的，弥漫的

sentences.english: the pervasive influence of television
sentences.chinese: 电视无所不在的影响

sentences.english: the all-pervasive mood of apathy
sentences.chinese: 到处弥漫的冷漠情绪

detailed_translations.chinese: 普遍的；到处渗透的；流行的
detailed_translations.english: existing everywhere

name: pessimistic
trans: adj. having or showing a lack of hope for the future 悲观的

sentences.english: a pessimistic view of life
sentences.chinese: 对人生的悲观看法

detailed_translations.english: expecting that bad things will happen in the future or that something will have a bad result

name: philosophy
trans: n. the study of ideas about knowledge, truth, the nature and meaning of life, etc. 哲学
n. a set of ideas about how to do something or how to live 理念

sentences.english: Emma studies philosophy at university.
sentences.chinese: 埃玛在大学攻读哲学。

detailed_translations.english: the study of the nature and meaning of existence, truth, good and evil, etc

name: pilfer
trans: v. to steal things that are not very valuable or to steal a small amount of something 偷窃

sentences.english: The staff were pilfering behind the bar.
sentences.chinese: 工作人员在吧台后面偷东西。

detailed_translations.english: to steal things that are not worth much, especially from the place where you work

name: pioneering
trans: adj. doing something that has not been done before 开创性的

name: pivotal
trans: adj. very important 重要的

sentences.english: The Bank of England has a pivotal role in the London money market.
sentences.chinese: 英格兰银行在伦敦货币市场中起着关键性的作用。

detailed_translations.english: more important than anything else in a situation, system etc

name: plague
trans: n. a large number of harmful or annoying things 让人讨厌的东西
v. to cause constant or repeated trouble, illness, etc. 困扰，纠缠

sentences.english: Financial problems continued to plague the company.
sentences.chinese: 资金问题持续困扰着该公司。

detailed_translations.english: to cause pain, suffering, or trouble to someone, especially for a long period of time

name: plaintive
trans: adj. expressing suffering or sadness 悲伤的

sentences.english: They lay on the firm sands, listening to the plaintive cry of the seagulls.
sentences.chinese: 他们躺在坚实的沙滩上，听着海鸥的哀鸣。
