v. to occur or develop as a consequence 起源

sentences.english: ‘Writ ’ is the stem of the forms ‘writes ’, ‘writing ’ and ‘written ’.
sentences.chinese: writ是writes、writing和written三个词的词干。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a word that stays the same when different endings are added to it, for example ‘driv-’ in ‘driving’

name: sterling
trans: adj. very good 优秀的

sentences.english: Ella has done some sterling work.
sentences.chinese: 埃拉做了一些出色的工作。

detailed_translations.chinese: 纯正的；英币的；纯银制的

detailed_translations.english: the standard unit of money in the United Kingdom, based on the pound

name: stifle
trans: v. to stop from doing or expressing something 阻止

sentences.english: He was almost stifled by the fumes.
sentences.chinese: 他差点被烟熏得窒息了。

detailed_translations.chinese: （马等的）后膝关节；（马等的）[动] 后膝关节病

name: stingy
trans: adj. not liking or wanting to give or spend money 吝啬的
adj. small in size or amount 微小的

sentences.english: She’s too stingy to give money to charity.
sentences.chinese: 她很小气，不愿捐钱行善。

detailed_translations.chinese: 吝啬的，小气的；有刺的；缺乏的
detailed_translations.english: not generous, especially with money

name: strain
trans: v. to make violent efforts 尽量使力

sentences.english: I’ve strained a muscle in my leg.
sentences.chinese: 我的腿有一处肌肉拉伤。

sentences.english: You’ll strain your eyes trying to read in this light.
sentences.chinese: 在这样的光线下看书会伤眼睛的。

detailed_translations.english: to injure a muscle or part of your body by using it too much or making it work too hard
to try very hard to do something using all your strength or ability

name: stratified
trans: adj. divided into different classes or social layers 形成阶层的，分层的

name: striking
trans: adj. attracting attention or notice through unusual or conspicuous qualities 引人注目的

sentences.english: a striking contrast between wealth and poverty
sentences.chinese: 显著的贫富差异

sentences.english: The most striking feature of those statistics is the high proportion of suicides.
sentences.chinese: 那些统计数据最显著的特征是高自杀率。

detailed_translations.english: unusual or interesting enough to be easily noticed

name: strip away
trans: phrase. to remove it completely 除去

name: stubborn
trans: adj. refusing to change your ideas or to stop doing something 固执的
adj. difficult to deal with, remove, etc. 难除去的

sentences.english: Why are you so stubborn?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么这么固执？

sentences.english: I’ve got a very stubborn streak (= a tendency to be stubborn ) .
sentences.chinese: 我的个性很固执。

sentences.english: Paul can be as stubborn as a mule (= very stubborn ) .
sentences.chinese: 保尔有时倔得像头驴。

detailed_translations.english: determined not to change your mind, even when people think you are being unreasonable

name: stun
trans: v. to surprise or upset very much 使惊讶

sentences.english: Redfern stunned the crowd with a last-minute goal.
sentences.chinese: 雷德芬在最后一分钟进球，使观众很是震惊。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使震惊， 使目瞪口呆； 把…打昏， 使昏迷
detailed_translations.english: to surprise or upset someone so much that they do not react immediately

name: stymie
trans: v. to stop from doing something or to stop from happening 阻碍

sentences.english: Investigators have been stymied by uncooperative witnesses.
sentences.chinese: 由于目击者不合作，调查人员的工作受阻。

detailed_translations.english: to prevent someone from doing what they have planned or want to do

name: subordinate
trans: adj. in a position of less power or authority than someone else 级别低的
adj. less important than someone or something else 次要的
n. someone who has less power or authority than someone else 下属

sentences.english: a subordinate officer
sentences.chinese: 下级官员

detailed_translations.chinese: 下级的，级别低的；次要的，从属的
detailed_translations.english: in a less important position than someone else
someone who has a lower position and less authority than someone else in an organization

detailed_translations.chinese: 使处于次要地位， 使从属于
detailed_translations.english: to put someone or something in a less important position

name: subsidize
trans: v. to help someone or something pay for the costs of 资助，补贴

sentences.english: Farming is heavily subsidized (= subsidized a lot ) by the government.
sentences.chinese: 农业得到政府的大量补贴。

detailed_translations.chinese: 资助；给与奖助金；向…行贿
detailed_translations.english: if a government or organization subsidizes a company, activity etc, it pays part of its costs

name: subtle
trans: adj. hard to notice or see 不易觉察的
adj. difficult to understand 难以理解的
adj. able to make fine distinctions 敏锐的

sentences.english: The pictures are similar, but there are subtle differences between them.
sentences.chinese: 这些图片很相似，但它们之间有细微的差别。

sentences.english: The warning signs of the disease are so subtle that they are often ignored.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病的警示征兆不易察觉，因而往往被忽视。

sentences.english: a subtle form of racism
sentences.chinese: 隐性的种族歧视

sentences.english: The dish had a subtle hint of ginger.
sentences.chinese: 这道菜微微带点姜的味道。

detailed_translations.english: not easy to notice or understand unless you pay careful attention

name: successive
trans: adj. following one after the other in a series 连续的

sentences.english: The team has had five successive victories.
sentences.chinese: 这支球队已经连胜五场了。

sentences.english: Successive governments have tried to deal with this issue.
sentences.chinese: 历届政府都试图解决这个问题。

detailed_translations.english: coming or following one after the other

name: succumb
trans: v. to stop trying to resist something 屈服
v. to die 死亡

sentences.english: Don't succumb to the temptation to have just one cigarette.
sentences.chinese: 不要屈服于只抽一支烟的诱惑。

detailed_translations.english: to stop opposing someone or something that is stronger than you, and allow them to take control

name: suffocate
trans: v. to impede or stop the development of 抑制
v. to stop the respiration of 窒息

sentences.english: The animal seizes its prey by the throat and suffocates it to death.
sentences.chinese: 这种动物会抓住猎物的喉咙，使其窒息而死。

sentences.english: One of the puppies suffocated inside the plastic bag.
sentences.chinese: 其中一只小狗在塑料袋里闷死了。

detailed_translations.english: to die or make someone die by preventing them from breathing

name: sullen
trans: adj. dismal, gloomy 郁郁寡欢的

sentences.english: Bill sat in sullen silence and refused to eat his lunch.
sentences.chinese: 比尔一声不响，闷闷不乐地坐着，不肯吃午饭。

sentences.english: a look of sullen resentment
sentences.chinese: 愤懑的眼神

detailed_translations.chinese: 愠怒的，不高兴的；（天气）阴沉的；沉闷的
detailed_translations.english: angry and silent, especially because you feel life has been unfair to you

name: superficial
trans: adj. concerned only with the obvious or apparent 肤浅的
adj. lying close to the surface 表面的

sentences.english: Despite their superficial similarities, the two novels are, in fact, very different.
sentences.chinese: 这两本小说尽管表面上有相似之处，但实际上大不一样。

sentences.english: They only have the most superficial understanding of prison life.
sentences.chinese: 他们对监狱生活只有最粗浅的了解。

detailed_translations.english: seeming to have a particular quality, although this is not true or real

name: superfluous
trans: adj. beyond what is needed 多余的

sentences.english: a modern building with no superfluous decoration
sentences.chinese: 一栋没有多余装饰的现代建筑

detailed_translations.chinese: 多余的；不必要的；奢侈的
detailed_translations.english: more than is needed or wanted

name: superlative
trans: adj. surpassing all others 最高级的，极好的

sentences.english: a superlative performance
sentences.chinese: 精彩绝伦的表演

detailed_translations.chinese: 最高的；最高级的；过度的
detailed_translations.english: excellent

detailed_translations.chinese: 最高级；最好的人；最高程度；夸大话
detailed_translations.english: the superlative form of an adjective or adverb. For example, ‘biggest’ is the superlative of ‘big’.

name: supplant
trans: v. to take the place of 取代

sentences.english: Barker was soon supplanted as party leader.
sentences.chinese: 巴克在党内的领导地位很快就被人取代了。

detailed_translations.english: to take the place of a person or thing so that they are no longer used, no longer in a position of power etc

name: supple
trans: adj. readily adaptable or responsive to new situations 能适应的，灵活的
adj. capable of being bent or folded without creases, cracks, or breaks 柔韧的

sentences.english: She exercises every day to keep herself supple.
sentences.chinese: 她每天锻炼以保持身体柔韧。

detailed_translations.chinese: 柔软的；灵活的；顺从的；易弯曲的；逢迎的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is supple bends and moves easily and gracefully

name: supplicate
trans: v. to ask humbly and earnestly of 恳求

sentences.english: A man can scarce allege his own merits with modesty, much less extol them; a man cannot sometimes brook to supplicate or beg; and a number of the like.
sentences.chinese: 一个人不能自承有功而免矜夸之嫌，更不用说是不能表扬自己底功绩了；他有时也不能低首下心地去有所恳求；诸如此类的事很多。

detailed_translations.english: to make a humble request to (someone); plead

name: suppress
trans: v. to end or stop by force 压制，镇压

sentences.english: The uprising was ruthlessly suppressed.
sentences.chinese: 起义受到了残酷的镇压。

detailed_translations.english: to stop people from opposing the government, especially by using force

name: surfeit
trans: n. an amount that is too much or more than you need 过量

sentences.english: Rationing had put an end to a surfeit of biscuits long ago.
sentences.chinese: 定量供应很久以前就结束了饼干过剩的情况。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过度；饮食过度；恶心（由于饮食过度所引起）
detailed_translations.english: A surfeit of something is an amount which is too large

detailed_translations.chinese: 使饮食过度；使厌腻；使过度沉溺于

name: surly
trans: adj. irritably sullen and churlish in mood or manner 阴郁的

sentences.english: He became surly and rude toward me.
sentences.chinese: 他变得对我粗暴无礼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乖戾的；板面孔的，无礼的；阴沉的
detailed_translations.english: Someone who is surly behaves in a rude bad-tempered way

name: surmise
trans: v. to form an opinion about something without definitely knowing the truth 推测
n. a thought or idea based on scanty evidence 猜测

sentences.english: There's so little to go on, we can only surmise what happened.
sentences.chinese: 几乎没有什么可继续进行的，我们只能猜测发生过的事。

sentences.english: It is mere surmise that Bosch had Brant's poem in mind when doing this painting.
sentences.chinese: 博斯画这幅画时头脑里想着勃朗特的诗，这只是猜测而已。

detailed_translations.english: to guess that something is true, using the information you know already
If you say that a particular conclusion is surmise, you mean that it is a guess based on the available evidence and you do not know for certain that it is true

name: surrender
trans: v. to agree to stop fighting, hiding, resisting, etc., because you know that you will not win or succeed 投降
v. to give the control or use of to someone else 交出
v. to allow something to influence or control you 放任

sentences.english: Germany surrendered on May 7th, 1945.
sentences.chinese: 德国于 1945 年 5 月 7 日投降。

sentences.english: The terrorists were given ten minutes to surrender.
sentences.chinese: 恐怖分子被限定在十分钟之内投降。

detailed_translations.english: to say officially that you want to stop fighting, because you realize that you cannot win
to give up something or someone, especially because you are forced to
when you say officially that you want to stop fighting because you realize that you cannot win

name: surreptitious
trans: adj. done in a secret way 鬼鬼祟祟的

sentences.english: Rory tried to sneak a surreptitious glance at Adam’s wristwatch.
sentences.chinese: 罗里试图偷偷看一眼亚当的手表。

detailed_translations.chinese: 秘密的；鬼鬼祟祟的；暗中的
detailed_translations.english: done secretly or quickly because you do not want other people to notice

name: susceptible
trans: adj. easily affected, influenced, or harmed by something 易受影响的

sentences.english: A lot of TV advertising is aimed at susceptible young children.
sentences.chinese: 很多电视广告瞄准了易受影响的幼儿。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易受影响的； 过敏的； 能经受的， 容许的
detailed_translations.english: likely to suffer from a particular illness or be affected by a particular problem

name: sustain
trans: v. to provide what is needed for to exist, continue, etc. 维持
v. to hold up the weight of 支撑

sentences.english: He leant against her so heavily that she could barely sustain his weight.
sentences.chinese: 他重重地靠在她身上，让她几乎撑不住了。

sentences.english: Which planets can sustain life?
sentences.chinese: 哪些行星可以维持生命的存在？

detailed_translations.english: to hold up the weight of something

name: sway
trans: v. to fluctuate or veer between one point, position, or opinion and another 摇摆
v. to exert a building or controlling influence on 影响

sentences.english: Don’t allow yourself to be swayed by his promises.
sentences.chinese: 你可不要听了他的许诺就改变主意呀。

detailed_translations.english: to influence someone so that they change their opinion

name: sweeping
trans: adj. including or involving many things 彻底的

sentences.english: sweeping generalizations about women drivers
sentences.chinese: 对女性司机一概而论的看法

detailed_translations.english: affecting many things, or making an important difference to something

detailed_translations.chinese: 打扫；扫除（sweep的现在分词形式）

name: sycophantic
trans: adj. fawning, obsequious 谄媚的

name: sympathetic
trans: adj. feeling or showing concern about someone who is in a bad situation 同情的

sentences.english: a sympathetic friend
sentences.chinese: 一个有同情心的朋友

sentences.english: a sympathetic attitude
sentences.chinese: 一种同情的态度

sentences.english: We hope always to provide a friendly sympathetic ear (= someone willing to listen to someone else’s problems ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们希望总能做到友善地倾听。

detailed_translations.english: caring and feeling sorry about someone’s problems

name: synonymous
trans: adj. having the same connotations, implications, or reference 同义的

sentences.english: HIS name is synonymous with Mandopop in the 21 st century.
sentences.chinese: 他的名字在21世纪和华语流行音乐是同义词。 。

sentences.english: ADOLESCENCE is practically synonymous in our culture with risk taking, emotional drama and all forms of outlandish behavior.
sentences.chinese: 在我们的文化里，青春期几乎是冒险、情感闹剧和各种出格举动的同义词。

sentences.english: "Getting fit" became synonymous not just with healthier living, but with a leaner, meaner body, and the ground was laid for a burgeoning gym industry.
sentences.chinese: “获得适合”成为同义词的不只是健康的生活，但一个更精简，寡情的身体，与地面是一个新兴的体育产业奠定。

detailed_translations.english: something that is synonymous with something else is considered to be very closely connected with it

name: synoptic
trans: adj. affording a general view of a whole 概要的

sentences.english: If you take a synoptic problem kind of analysis of a lot this stuff that are in some of these speeches in Matthew, a lot of these sayings might have occurred in another context in Luke or in Mark.
sentences.chinese: 如果你把对观福音书问题看成,对马太福音中这些讲论的分析，很多词句都出现在,路加或马可福音中，只是背景不同。

detailed_translations.chinese: 天气的；概要的；对观福音书的

name: synthesis
trans: n. something that is made by combining different things 合成，综合体

sentences.english: a synthesis of Eastern and Western philosophical ideas
sentences.chinese: 东西方哲学思想的结合

sentences.english: the synthesis of proteins
sentences.chinese: 蛋白质的合成

sentences.english: speech synthesis software
sentences.chinese: 语音合成软件

detailed_translations.chinese: 综合，综合物；（化学或生物学物质的）合成；（用电子方式对声音、语音或音乐的）合成
detailed_translations.english: something that has been made by combining different things, or the process of combining things

name: taciturn
trans: adj. temperamentally disinclined to talk 沉默寡言的

sentences.english: He is a taciturn man who dislikes parties.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个不喜欢聚会、天性沉默寡言的人。

sentences.english: But these men were a taciturn lot , picking their words carefully.
sentences.chinese: 但是这些人都是沉默寡言的人， 说起话来字斟句酌，非常谨慎。

sentences.english: We took a floatplane to the trail head. Our taciturn guide pointed out that it was this robust aircraft that had helped to open up the wilderness in the Fifties.
sentences.chinese: 我们乘坐一架水上飞机来到小道的顶端，沉默寡言的导游指着飞机说，五十年代人们正是在这种飞机的得力帮助下开拓荒野。

detailed_translations.english: speaking very little, so that you seem unfriendly

name: tactless
trans: adj. not showing or having tact 笨拙的

name: taint
trans: v. to contaminate morally 玷污
v. to affect with putrefaction 污染
n. something that causes a person or thing to be thought of as bad, dishonest, etc. 瑕疵

sentences.english: Baker argues that his trial was tainted by negative publicity.
sentences.chinese: 贝克抗辩说他的审判受到了负面宣传的影响。

detailed_translations.english: to damage something by adding an unwanted substance to it
the appearance of being related to something bad or morally wrong

name: tantamount
trans: adj. equal to something in value, meaning, or effect 等同于

sentences.english: What Bracey is saying is tantamount to heresy.
sentences.chinese: 布里斯正在说的无异于异端邪说。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that one thing is tantamount to another, more serious thing, you are emphasizing how bad, unacceptable, or unfortunate the first thing is by comparing it to the second thing

name: taxing
trans: adj. requiring a lot of effort, energy, etc. 费劲的

sentences.english: The job turned out to be more taxing than I’d expected.
sentences.chinese: 后来发觉这个工作比我原来想的要辛苦。

detailed_translations.english: needing a lot of effort

name: tedious
trans: adj. boring and too slow or long 单调乏味的

sentences.english: The audience coughed down the tedious speaker.
sentences.chinese: 听众用咳嗽声阻挠演讲人的沉闷发言。

sentences.english: There's no point in labouring at a tedious task.
sentences.chinese: 辛苦地干单调乏味的工作没有意义。

name: teem with
trans: phrase. 充满

name: temper
trans: v. to make less severe or extreme 缓和

sentences.english: Pete hit his brother in a fit of temper .
sentences.chinese: 皮特一气之下打了他弟弟。

detailed_translations.english: the way you are feeling at a particular time, especially when you are feeling angry for a short time

detailed_translations.chinese: 调和， 使缓和； 【冶】使回火
detailed_translations.english: to make something less severe or extreme

name: temperate
trans: adj. marked by moderation 温和的，适度的

sentences.english: The Nile Valley keeps a temperate climate throughout the year.
sentences.chinese: 尼罗河流域全年气候温和。

detailed_translations.chinese: 温和的；适度的；有节制的
detailed_translations.english: behaviour that is temperate is calm and sensible

name: temporary
trans: adj. lasting for a limited time 暂时的

sentences.english: temporary pain relief
sentences.chinese: 疼痛的暂时缓解

sentences.english: I’m living with my parents, but it’s only temporary.
sentences.chinese: 我和父母住在一起，但这只是暂时的。

sentences.english: You might want to consider temporary work until you decide what you want to do.
sentences.chinese: 在你定下来想做什么之前，也许可以考虑干点临时性工作。

sentences.english: She was employed on a temporary basis .
sentences.chinese: 她是受雇干临时性工作的。

detailed_translations.english: continuing for only a limited period of time

name: tenacity
trans: n. the quality or state of being very determined to do something 顽强

sentences.english: The coating has good tenacity and wearability.
sentences.chinese: 涂层具有良好的韧性和耐磨性能。

sentences.english: High strength, good rigidity and tenacity, good heat and seawater resisting, good Cl resisting, suitable for high performance products.
sentences.chinese: 高机械强度，高耐热性，韧性好，具有较好的耐海水、耐氯性。适用于高性能制品。

name: tendentious
trans: adj. expressing a strong opinion 有倾向性的

sentences.english: His analysis was rooted in a somewhat tendentious reading of French history.
sentences.chinese: 他的分析植根于对法国历史带有倾向性的解读。

detailed_translations.english: a tendentious speech, remark, book etc expresses a strong opinion that is intended to influence people

name: tenuous
trans: adj. very thin 纤细的
adj. having little substance or strength 脆弱的

sentences.english: For now, the band’s travel plans are tenuous.
sentences.chinese: 乐队的巡演计划暂时还没确定。

detailed_translations.english: very thin and easily broken

name: tepid
trans: adj. not energetic or excited 不够热情的

sentences.english: a tepid response from the audience
sentences.chinese: 观众冷淡的反应

detailed_translations.chinese: 微温的，温热的；不太热烈的；不热情的
detailed_translations.english: a feeling, reaction etc that is tepid shows a lack of excitement or interest

name: terrific
trans: adj. extremely good 极好的

sentences.english: That’s a terrific idea!
sentences.chinese: 这个主意真棒！

sentences.english: The actress who played the lawyer was terrific.
sentences.chinese: 扮演律师的女演员表演十分出色。

detailed_translations.chinese: 极妙的； 极大的； 令人恐惧的
detailed_translations.english: very good, especially in a way that makes you feel happy and excited

name: terrifying
trans: adj. causing great fear 令人恐惧的

sentences.english: I still find it terrifying to find myself surrounded by large numbers of horses.
sentences.chinese: 我发现被一大群马包围着还是很吓人。

detailed_translations.english: If something is terrifying, it makes you very frightened

name: terse
trans: adj. brief and direct in a way that may see rude or unfriendly 简短的

sentences.english: Derek’s terse reply ended the conversation.
sentences.chinese: 德里克的简短回答结束了谈话。

name: testimony
trans: n. proof or evidence that something exists or is true 证据

sentences.english: Barker’s testimony is crucial to the prosecution’s case.
sentences.chinese: 巴克的证词对控方的指控起到了关键作用。

sentences.english: In his testimony, he denied that the company had ignored safety procedures.
sentences.chinese: 他在证词中否认公司忽视了安全程序。

detailed_translations.english: a formal statement saying that something is true, especially one a  witness  makes in a court of law

name: thorough
trans: adj. careful about doing something in an accurate and exact way 周密的
adj. complete or absolute 彻底的

sentences.english: The doctor gave him a thorough check-up.
sentences.chinese: 医生给他做了一次全面的体检。

sentences.english: a thorough and detailed biography
sentences.chinese: 详尽的传记

sentences.english: The police investigation was very thorough.
sentences.chinese: 警方的调查十分彻底。

sentences.english: thorough notes of the meeting
sentences.chinese: 详尽的会议记录

detailed_translations.english: including every possible detail

name: thrift
trans: n. careful use of money so that it is not wasted 节约

sentences.english: They were rightly praised for their thrift and enterprise.
sentences.chinese: 他们因勤俭节约和开创精神而受到了应得的表扬。

detailed_translations.chinese: 节俭；节约；[植] 海石竹
detailed_translations.english: wise and careful use of money, so that none is wasted

name: thrill
trans: v. to cause to feel very excited or happy 使激动
n. a quivering or trembling caused by sudden excitement or emotion
激动，紧张

sentences.english: Winning first place must have been quite a thrill.
sentences.chinese: 赢得第一名肯定让人非常激动。

sentences.english: Even though I’ve been acting for years, I still get a thrill out of going on stage.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我演了多年戏，走上舞台我仍然感到十分激动。

sentences.english: It gave Pat a thrill to finally see the group perform live.
sentences.chinese: 帕特终于看到这个乐队现场表演，感到十分激动。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden strong feeling of excitement and pleasure, or the thing that makes you feel this

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…颤动；使…紧张；使…感到兴奋或激动
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel excited and happy

name: thrive
trans: v. to grow or develop successfully 繁荣

sentences.english: plants that thrive in tropical rain forests
sentences.chinese: 在热带雨林蓬勃生长的植物

sentences.english: a business which managed to thrive during a recession
sentences.chinese: 在经济萧条时期也能顺利发展的一家企业

detailed_translations.english: to become very successful or very strong and healthy

name: tilt
trans: n. slant, bias 倾斜，偏见

sentences.english: My mother tilted her head and smiled.
sentences.chinese: 我妈妈歪着头笑了。

sentences.english: Ned’s mouth tilted upwards slightly at the corners.
sentences.chinese: 内德的嘴角微微翘起。

detailed_translations.english: to move a part of your body, especially your head or chin, upwards or to the side
a movement or position in which one side of something is higher than the other

name: timely
trans: adj. happening at the correct or most useful time 适时的

sentences.english: The fight ended only with the timely arrival of the police.
sentences.chinese: 幸亏警察及时赶到，打斗总算停止。

detailed_translations.english: done or happening at exactly the right time

name: timid
trans: adj. feeling or showing a lack of courage or confidence 胆怯的，羞怯的

sentences.english: I was a timid child.
sentences.chinese: 我曾是个胆小的孩子。

sentences.english: a policy that is both timid and inadequate
sentences.chinese: 一项既无胆识又不完善的政策

detailed_translations.english: not having courage or confidence

name: tolerate
trans: v. to allow to exist, happen, or be done 容许
v. to put up with 容忍

sentences.english: We simply will not tolerate vigilante groups on our streets.
sentences.chinese: 我们决不容许有自行惩办犯罪的组织出现在我们的街头。

sentences.english: This sort of behaviour will not be tolerated.
sentences.chinese: 这种行为是不能容许的。

detailed_translations.english: to allow people to do, say, or believe something without criticizing or punishing them

name: tonic
trans: adj. increasing or restoring physical or mental tone 恢复健康的

sentences.english: A lot of people need a tonic at the end of the winter.
sentences.chinese: 很多人冬末需要进补。

detailed_translations.english: a drink that you have as a medicine to give you more energy or strength when you feel tired

detailed_translations.chinese: 滋补的；声调的；使精神振作的

name: topple
trans: v. to remove from power 推翻，颠覆

sentences.english: He just released his hold and toppled slowly backwards.
sentences.chinese: 他就松手，慢慢地向后倒下了。

detailed_translations.english: to become unsteady and then fall over, or to make something do this

name: tortuous
trans: adj. having many twists and turns 弯曲的
adj. complicated, long, and confusing 冗长复杂的

sentences.english: a tortuous path over the mountains to Kandahar
sentences.chinese: 翻山越岭通往坎大哈的一条蜿蜒小径

detailed_translations.english: a tortuous path, stream, road etc has a lot of bends in it and is therefore difficult to travel along

name: totemic
trans: adj. of, relating to, suggestive of, or characteristic of a totem or totemism 象征的

sentences.english: How could the ultimate scientist have been seemingly hornswoggled by a totemic psuedoscience like alchemy, which in its commonest rendering is described as the desire to transform lead into gold?
sentences.chinese: 一个终极科学家怎么会看上去像是被炼金术这种图腾伪科学所迷惑，而对这种伪学科最常见的描述是把铅变成黄金的欲望？

name: tractable
trans: adj. capable of being easily led, taught, or controlled 驯服的，温顺的

sentences.english: The issues have proved to be less tractable than expected.
sentences.chinese: 结果这些问题比预想的要难以处理。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易于管教的；易驾驭的；易处理的；驯良的
detailed_translations.english: easy to control or deal with

name: transgress
trans: v. to do something that is not allowed 违反，侵犯

sentences.english: Orton’s plays transgress accepted social norms.
sentences.chinese: 奥顿的戏剧违背了公认的社会准则。

detailed_translations.english: to do something that is against the rules of social behaviour or against a moral principle

name: transient
trans: adj. not lasting long 短暂的

sentences.english: transient fashions
sentences.chinese: 短暂的时尚

detailed_translations.english: continuing only for a short time

detailed_translations.chinese: 瞬变现象；过往旅客；候鸟

name: transitory
trans: adj. lasting only for a short time 短暂的

sentences.english: Most teenage romances are transitory.
sentences.chinese: 大多数少年时代的罗曼史都转瞬即逝。

detailed_translations.english: continuing or existing for only a short time

name: treasure
trans: adj. something that is very special, important, or valuable 珍宝
v. to value very much 珍惜

sentences.english: buried treasure
sentences.chinese: 埋藏的财宝

sentences.english: the priceless art treasures of the Uffizi gallery.
sentences.chinese: 乌菲齐美术馆收藏的无价艺术瑰宝

sentences.english: I treasure his friendship.
sentences.chinese: 我珍重他的友谊。

detailed_translations.english: a collection of valuable things such as gold, silver and jewellery
to keep and care for something that is very special, important, or valuable to you

name: tremendous
trans: adj. very large or great 巨大的

sentences.english: Suddenly, there was a tremendous bang, and the whole station shook.
sentences.chinese: 突然一声巨响，整个车站都晃动了。

sentences.english: She was making a tremendous effort to appear calm.
sentences.chinese: 她竭力表现出平静的样子。

sentences.english: She praised her husband for the tremendous support he had given her.
sentences.chinese: 她称赞丈夫给了她巨大支持。

sentences.english: Sales have been tremendous so far this year.
sentences.chinese: 今年到目前为止，销售额十分惊人。

sentences.english: This plan could save us a tremendous amount of money.
sentences.chinese: 这个计划能给我们节省一大笔钱。

detailed_translations.english: very big, fast, powerful etc

name: trenchant
trans: adj. very strong, clear, and effective 有力的，有效的

sentences.english: Stockman became one of the President’s most trenchant critics.
sentences.chinese: 斯托克曼成了总统最尖锐的批评者之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: 尖刻的；锐利的；苛刻的；锋利的（名词trenchancy，副词trenchantly）
detailed_translations.english: expressed very strongly, effectively, and directly without worrying about offending people

name: trepidation
trans: n. a nervous or fearful feeling of uncertain agitation 不安

sentences.english: With some trepidation, I opened the door.
sentences.chinese: 我有些惴惴不安地打开了门。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of anxiety or fear about something that is going to happen

name: tribute
trans: n. something that you say, give, or do to show respect or affection for someone 称赞
n. money or goods that a ruler or country gives to another ruler or country especially for protection 贡品

sentences.english: The players wore black armbands as a tribute to their late teammate.
sentences.chinese: 球员们戴着黑纱悼念已故的队友。

sentences.english: I’d like to pay tribute to (= praise and admire publicly ) the party workers for all their hard work.
sentences.chinese: 我谨向党内工作人员致敬，感谢他们的辛苦努力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 礼物；[税收] 贡物；颂词；（尤指对死者的）致敬，悼念，吊唁礼物
detailed_translations.english: something that you say, do, or give in order to express your respect or admiration for someone

name: trifling
trans: adj. having little value or importance 微不足道的

name: trigger
trans: v. to cause to start or happen 引发

sentences.english: He took aim and squeezed the trigger.
sentences.chinese: 他瞄准目标，扣动了扳机。

sentences.english: The assassination triggered off a wave of rioting.
sentences.chinese: 这次暗杀事件引发了一阵骚乱。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a gun that you pull with your finger to fire it
to make something happen very quickly, especially a series of events

name: triumph
trans: n. a great success or achievement 伟大胜利

sentences.english: All her life, Kelly had stuck with difficult tasks and challenges, and triumphed.
sentences.chinese: 凯利在一生中遭遇了种种艰巨任务与挑战，但成功了。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something triumphs, they gain complete success, control, or victory, often after a long or difficult struggle
an important victory or success after a difficult struggle

name: trivial
trans: adj. not important 不重要的

sentences.english: a trivial detail
sentences.chinese: 细枝末节

sentences.english: I know it sounds trivial , but I'm worried about it.
sentences.chinese: 我知道这事听起来微不足道，但我还是放心不下。

detailed_translations.english: not important or serious; not worth considering

name: truculent
trans: adj. easily annoyed or angered and likely to argue 好斗的

sentences.english: a truculent attitude
sentences.chinese: 凶狠的态度

detailed_translations.chinese: 好斗的；野蛮的；言词刻毒的
detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone is truculent, you mean that they are bad-tempered and aggressive

name: truncate
trans: v. to shorten by or as if by cutting off 截短

sentences.english: If the list is too long, it will be truncated by the computer.
sentences.chinese: 如果列表太长，电脑会将其截短。

sentences.english: The report is also available in a truncated version.
sentences.chinese: 该报告还有简缩版。

detailed_translations.english: to make something shorter

name: tumultuous
trans: adj. involving a lot of violence, confusion, or disorder 骚乱的

sentences.english: the tumultuous years of the Civil War
sentences.chinese: 内战的动荡年代

detailed_translations.english: full of activity, confusion, or violence

name: turbid
trans: adj. cloudy or muddy 浑浊的，混乱的

sentences.english: A fisherman drags nets of oysters from the turbid river water on a breathless summer day.
sentences.chinese: 一个渔民在喘不过气来的夏天从浑浊的河水里拖上了几网牡蛎。

sentences.english: Life is the clear and transparent white spirits, which seems pure at the first glance, but actually is turbid.
sentences.chinese: 生命是明确的和透明的白酒，这似乎纯在乍看之下，但实际上是浑浊。

detailed_translations.english: turbid water or liquid is dirty and muddy

name: tyro
trans: n. a person who has just started learning or doing something 新手

sentences.english: The scrutiny of investors, directors, regulators and media, may find out these tyro corporate leaders before they can do much damage.
sentences.chinese: 股东、董事、监管机构和媒体的仔细审视，或许会在这些新手企业领袖造成重大损害前发现问题。

sentences.english: Only the ineducable tyro can fail to sense the presence or absence of wolves, or the fact that mountains have a secret opinion about them.
sentences.chinese: 只有最不堪造就的新手，才感觉不到狼的存在与否，才不晓得大山对狼有着隐秘的看法。

detailed_translations.english: a novice or beginner

name: ubiquitous
trans: adj. seeming to be seen everywhere 无处不在的

sentences.english: Coffee shops are ubiquitous these days.
sentences.chinese: 如今好像到处都是咖啡馆。

sentences.english: a French film, starring the ubiquitous Gérard Depardieu
sentences.chinese: 一部法国电影，由家喻户晓的热拉尔·德帕迪约主演

detailed_translations.chinese: 普遍存在的；无所不在的
detailed_translations.english: seeming to be everywhere – sometimes used humorously

name: umbrage
trans: n. a feeling of being offended by what someone has said or done 生气

sentences.english: The answers were kept confidential to prevent any partners taking umbrage.
sentences.chinese: 为了防止他们的另一半感到不快，他们的答案都是保密的。

name: unalloyed
trans: adj. not mixed with something else 纯粹的

name: unambiguous
trans: adj. clearly expressed or understood 清晰的

name: unassailable
trans: adj. not able to be doubted 毋庸置疑的

name: unassuming
trans: adj. not having or showing a desire to be noticed, praised, etc. 谦逊的

sentences.english: He's a man of few words, very polite and unassuming.
sentences.chinese: 他不爱说话，非常有礼貌，也不装腔作势。

detailed_translations.chinese: 谦逊的；不装腔作势的；不出风头的
detailed_translations.english: showing no desire to be noticed or given special treatment

name: unattainable
trans: adj. cannot be achieved or is not available 无法获得的，无法达到的

name: unbalanced
trans: adj. appear disturbed and upset or they seem to be slightly crazy. 心神不定的
adj. unfair or inaccurate because it emphasizes some things and ignores others 不公正的

name: unblemished
trans: adj. not being harmed or spoiled 崭新的，清白的

sentences.english: a law firm with an unblemished reputation
sentences.chinese: 声誉良好的律师事务所

detailed_translations.english: not spoiled by any mistake or bad behaviour

name: unbounded
trans: adj. not limited in any way 无限的

name: unceasing
trans: adj. never stopping 不停的

name: unchecked
trans: adj. nobody controls it or prevents it from growing or developing 未受抑制的

name: uncompromising
trans: adj. not willing to change a decision, opinion, method, etc. 不妥协的

sentences.english: an uncompromising opponent of democratic reform
sentences.chinese: 民主改革的坚决反对者

detailed_translations.chinese: 不妥协的，不让步的；坚定的
detailed_translations.english: unwilling to change your opinions or intentions

name: undeniable
trans: adj. impossible to deny 不可否认的

sentences.english: undeniable proof
sentences.chinese: 确证

detailed_translations.chinese: 不可否认的, 无可辩驳的
detailed_translations.english: definitely true or certain

name: undercut
trans: v. to make weaker or less effective 削弱

sentences.english: Online bookstores can undercut retailers by up to 30%.
sentences.chinese: 网上书店最多能以低于零售店 30% 的价格销售。

detailed_translations.chinese: 廉价出售；较便宜的工资工作；从下边削球
detailed_translations.english: to sell goods or a service at a lower price than another company

detailed_translations.chinese: 底切；牛腰部下侧嫩肉；砍口；切球

name: undermine
trans: v. to make weaker or less effective usually in a secret or gradual way 暗中破坏

sentences.english: economic policies that threaten to undermine the health care system
sentences.chinese: 可能会损害医疗保健制度的经济政策

detailed_translations.english: to gradually make someone or something less strong or effective

name: undo
trans: v. to change or stop the effect of 取消，使无效

sentences.english: The screws can be undone by hand.
sentences.chinese: 这些螺丝可以用手拧开。

sentences.english: I undid the package carefully.
sentences.chinese: 我小心地打开包裹。

sentences.english: He undid most of the good work of the previous manager.
sentences.chinese: 他把前任经理的大部分功绩都毁掉了。

detailed_translations.english: to open something that is tied, fastened or wrapped

name: unencumbered
trans: adj. free of encumbrance 无阻碍的

sentences.english: Why not travel alone , in single blessedness , unencumbered and swiftly pursuing one's goal?
sentences.chinese: 为何不单独旅行，一个人， 无拘无束，快速的去追求自己的目标呢?。

sentences.english: Trading can be characterized as a pure, unencumbered personal choice with an immediate outcome.
sentences.chinese: 交易的特征是纯粹的， 没有阻碍的，很快就能出结果的个人选择。

sentences.english: No wonder, then, that those who build with glass look forward to a day when their structures will be unencumbered by metal or other materials.
sentences.chinese: 因此用玻璃作为建筑材料的人期待有一天他们的建筑不会被金属和其它材料阻挡的愿望也就不足为奇了。

detailed_translations.english: not burdened, impeded, or hampered

name: unerring
trans: adj. always right and accurate 万无一失的

name: uneven
trans: adj. not uniform 不规则的
adj. not level or smooth 不整齐的

sentences.english: She walked back carefully over the uneven ground.
sentences.chinese: 她小心翼翼地从凹凸不平的地面上走回来。

detailed_translations.english: not smooth, flat, or level

name: unexampled
trans: adj. having no example or parallel 前所未有的

name: unexceptional
trans: adj. not usually good, interesting, etc. 普通的

name: unfathomable
trans: adj. impossible to understand 不可理解的

sentences.english: For some unfathomable reason, there are no stairs where there should be.
sentences.chinese: 因为某种不可理解的原因，该有楼梯的地方却没有。

detailed_translations.chinese: 深不可测的；无底的；莫测高深的
detailed_translations.english: too strange or mysterious to be understood

name: unfeeling
trans: adj. not kind or sympathetic toward other people 无情的

name: unflagging
trans: adj. not decreasing or becoming weaker 不知疲倦的

name: unflinching
trans: adj. staying strong and determined even when things are difficult 不畏缩的

name: unfounded
trans: adj. not based on facts or proof 无根据的

sentences.english: Unfounded rumours of accounting problems hit stocks of other companies.
sentences.chinese: 有关账目问题的无根据的谣言打击了其他公司的股票。

detailed_translations.english: unfounded statements, feelings, opinions etc are wrong because they are not based on facts

name: ungainly
trans: adj. moving in an awkward or clumsy way  笨拙的，不优雅的

sentences.english: a tall ungainly teenager
sentences.chinese: 一个动作笨拙的高个子少年

detailed_translations.english: moving in a way that does not look graceful

name: unimpeachable
trans: adj. very reliable and trusted 毋庸置疑的

sentences.english: unimpeachable morals
sentences.chinese: 无可指摘的品行

detailed_translations.chinese: 无可指责的， 无可怀疑的
detailed_translations.english: so good or definite that criticism or doubt is impossible

name: uninformative
trans: adj. not giving you enough useful information 缺乏信息的

sentences.english: It was a singularly uninformative document.
sentences.chinese: 它是一份格外缺乏信息的文件。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不提供信息的；不增长见闻的
detailed_translations.english: Something that is uninformative does not give you enough useful information

name: universal
trans: adj. done or experienced by everyone 广泛的
adj. existing or true at all times or in all places 普遍适用的，无处不在的

sentences.english: free universal healthcare
sentences.chinese: 免费的全民保健制度

sentences.english: These stories have universal appeal.
sentences.chinese: 这些故事人人都喜欢。

sentences.english: a topic of universal interest
sentences.chinese: 人们普遍感兴趣的一个话题

sentences.english: a universal truth
sentences.chinese: 普遍的真理

detailed_translations.chinese: 宇宙的，全世界的；普遍的
detailed_translations.english: involving everyone in the world or in a particular group

name: unkempt
trans: adj. messy or untidy 不整洁的

sentences.english: His hair was unkempt and filthy.
sentences.chinese: 他的头发没梳洗，十分脏腻。

detailed_translations.chinese: 蓬乱的，不整洁的；（言语等）粗野的
detailed_translations.english: unkempt hair or plants have not been cut and kept neat

name: unmistakable
trans: adj. not capable of bing mistaken or misunderstood 毋庸置疑的，明显的

sentences.english: the unmistakable sound of gunfire
sentences.chinese: 清清楚楚的枪炮声

detailed_translations.english: easy to recognize

name: unorthodox
trans: adj. different from what is usually done or accepted 非正统的

sentences.english: The reality-based show followed the unorthodox lives of Ozzy, his wife Sharon, daughter Kelly, and son, Jack.
sentences.chinese: 这个写实剧取材于奥兹、其妻莎伦、女儿凯莉和儿子杰克的另类生活。

detailed_translations.chinese: 非正统的；异端的；异教的
detailed_translations.english: unorthodox opinions or methods are different from what is usual or accepted by most people

name: unostentatious
trans: adj. not ostentatious 不夸耀的

name: unprecedented
trans: adj. not done or experienced before 前所未有的

sentences.english: Such a move is rare, but not unprecedented.
sentences.chinese: 这样的举动少见，但并非从来没有过。

detailed_translations.english: If something is unprecedented, it has never happened before

name: unprepossessing
trans: adj. looking rather plain or ordinary 不吸引人的

sentences.english: Despite his unprepossessing appearance, he was very popular with women.
sentences.chinese: 他虽然其貌不扬，但很有女人缘。

detailed_translations.english: not very attractive or noticeable

name: unqualified
trans: adj. complete or total 完全的，不受限制的
adj. not having the skills, knowledge, or experience needed to do a particular job or activity 无资格的

sentences.english: unqualified staff
sentences.chinese: 不合格的员工

detailed_translations.chinese: 不合格的；无资格的；不胜任的；不受限制的；无条件的；绝对的
detailed_translations.english: not having the right knowledge, experience, or education to do something

name: unravel
trans: v. to find the correct explanation for 阐明，解开

sentences.english: Detectives are still trying to unravel the mystery surrounding his death.
sentences.chinese: 侦探们仍在试图解开他的死亡之谜。

detailed_translations.english: to understand or explain something that is mysterious or complicated

name: unremitting
trans: adj. not stopping or growing weaker 不停的

sentences.english: unremitting poverty
sentences.chinese: 长期的贫困

detailed_translations.chinese: 不懈的；不间断的；坚忍的
detailed_translations.english: continuing for a long time and not likely to stop

name: unseemly
trans: adj. not proper or appropriate for the situation 不得体的

sentences.english: Ann thought it unseemly to kiss her husband in public.
sentences.chinese: 安认为当众亲她丈夫不太得体。

detailed_translations.english: unseemly behaviour is not polite or not suitable for a particular occasion

name: unsettle
trans: v. to make nervous, worried, or upset 使不安

sentences.english: The sudden changes unsettled Judy.
sentences.chinese: 突如其来的变化弄得朱迪心神不宁。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使动摇；使不安定；使心神不宁
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel slightly nervous, worried, or upset

name: unsurpassed
trans: adj. emphasizing that it is better or greater than anything else of its kind
无可比拟的

name: untenable
trans: adj. not capable of being defended against attack or criticism 站不住脚的

sentences.english: The scandal put the President in an untenable position.
sentences.chinese: 这桩丑闻使总统处境艰难。

detailed_translations.chinese: （论据等）站不住脚的；不能维持的；不能租赁的；难以防守的
detailed_translations.english: an untenable situation has become so difficult that it is impossible to continue

name: untether
trans: v. to free from or as if from a tether 脱离

name: untrammeled
trans: adj. not confined, limited, or impeded 没有限制的

name: unwarranted
trans: adj. if you describe something as unwarranted, you are critical of it because there is no need or reason for it 无根据的

sentences.english: unwarranted interference
sentences.chinese: 无理干涉

name: unwieldy
trans: adj. difficult to handle, control, or deal with because of being large, heavy, or complex 笨重的，难操作的

sentences.english: unwieldy bureaucracy
sentences.chinese: 尾大不掉的官僚机构

detailed_translations.chinese: 笨拙的；笨重的；不灵便的；难处理的
detailed_translations.english: an unwieldy object is big, heavy, and difficult to carry or use

name: unwitting
trans: adj. not intended or planned 无意的

sentences.english: We were unwitting collaborators in his plan.
sentences.chinese: 我们无意中成为他的计划的协作者。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不知情的；不知不觉的，无意的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe a person or their actions as unwitting, you mean that the person does something or is involved in something without realizing it

detailed_translations.chinese: 使精神错乱；使丧失智能（unwit的ing形式）

name: unyielding
trans: adj. characterized by firmness or obduracy 不屈的

sentences.english: an unyielding resistance to change
sentences.chinese: 固执己见，不愿改变

detailed_translations.chinese: 不屈的；坚强的；[材] 不易弯曲的
detailed_translations.english: not willing to change your ideas or beliefs

name: upend
trans: v. to cause to be upside down 颠倒

name: upheaval
trans: n. a major change or period of change that causes a lot of conflict, confusion, anger, etc. 剧变

sentences.english: political upheaval
sentences.chinese: 政治剧变

sentences.english: Moving house is a major upheaval.
sentences.chinese: 搬家很折腾。

detailed_translations.english: a very big change that often causes problems

name: urbane
trans: adj. notably polite or polished in manner 儒雅的

sentences.english: Neil was urbane, witty, direct, and honest.
sentences.chinese: 尼尔文雅机智，坦率诚实。

detailed_translations.chinese: 彬彬有礼的，温文尔雅的；都市化的
detailed_translations.english: behaving in a relaxed and confident way in social situations

name: urgent
trans: adj. very important and needing immediate attention 紧急的，迫切的

sentences.english: He was in urgent need of medical attention.
sentences.chinese: 他急需治疗。

sentences.english: The report called for urgent action to reduce lead in petrol.
sentences.chinese: 报告呼吁迅速采取行动，减少汽油中的铅含量。

sentences.english: an urgent message
sentences.chinese: 一封急报

detailed_translations.english: very important and needing to be dealt with immediately

name: utilitarian
trans: adj. made to be useful rather than to be decorative or comfortable 实用的

sentences.english: ugly utilitarian buildings
sentences.chinese: 丑陋但实用的建筑物

sentences.english: One of the greatest utilitarians was Claude Helvetius.
sentences.chinese: 最伟大的功利主义者之一是克劳德·爱尔维修。

detailed_translations.chinese: 功利的；功利主义的；实利的
detailed_translations.english: intended to be useful and practical rather than attractive or comfortable
A utilitarian is someone with utilitarian views

name: utopia
trans: n. an impractical scheme for social improvement 不切实际的幻想

sentences.english: We weren't out to design a contemporary utopia.
sentences.chinese: 我们不想去设计一个当代乌托邦。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乌托邦（理想中最美好的社会）；理想国
detailed_translations.english: an imaginary perfect world where everyone is happy

name: utter
trans: adj. complete and total 完全的
v. to say 表达

sentences.english: That’s utter nonsense!
sentences.chinese: 真是一派胡言！

sentences.english: This company treats its employees with utter contempt.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司对其员工不屑一顾。

sentences.english: I watched in complete and utter horror as he pulled out a gun.
sentences.chinese: 我惊恐万分地看着他拔出枪来。

sentences.english: fifteen years of utter confusion
sentences.chinese: 15年的大混乱

detailed_translations.english: complete – used especially to emphasize that something is very bad, or that a feeling is very strong
to make a sound with your voice, especially with difficulty

name: vacant
trans: adj. being without content or occupant 空的
adj. devoid of thought, reflection, or expression 心不在焉的

sentences.english: Only a few apartments were still vacant.
sentences.chinese: 只有几套公寓仍然空着。

sentences.english: There was only a vacant lot (= empty unused area of land in a city ) where her house used to be.
sentences.chinese: 她以前房子所在的地方只剩下一块空地了。

detailed_translations.english: a vacant seat, building, room or piece of land is empty and available for someone to use

name: vacillation
trans: n. inability to take a stand 犹豫不决

name: vacuous
trans: adj. having or showing a lack of intelligence or serious thought 空洞的

sentences.english: a vacuous expression
sentences.chinese: 茫然的表情

sentences.english: a vacuous romantic novel
sentences.chinese: 空洞的爱情小说

detailed_translations.chinese: 空的；空虚的；空洞的；无意义的
detailed_translations.english: showing no intelligence or having no useful purpose

name: vague
trans: adj. not clear in meaning 模糊的，不确定的

sentences.english: The governor gave only a vague outline of his tax plan.
sentences.chinese: 州长只是含糊地大致说了一下他的税务计划。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不明确的； 含糊的； 暧昧的
detailed_translations.english: unclear because someone does not give enough detailed information or does not say exactly what they mean

name: vainglorious
trans: adj. having or showing too much pride in your abilities or achievements
自负的

sentences.english: Behind the words, at once self-pitying and vainglorious, the merits of the case were overwhelming.
sentences.chinese: 在那些既是顾影自怜而又自命不凡的字眼后面，事情本身的是非曲直是无可争辩的。

sentences.english: He was silent for a minute , casting about for the least vainglorious way in which to express himself.
sentences.chinese: 他沉默了一会儿，想找到个最不虚荣的方式表达自己的意思。

detailed_translations.english: too proud of your own abilities, importance etc

name: valediction
trans: n. an act of bidding farewell 告别

detailed_translations.english: the act of saying goodbye, especially in a formal speech

name: valorize
trans: v. to assign value or merit to 称赞

name: vanish
trans: v. to disappear entirely without a clear explanation 消失

sentences.english: My keys were here a minute ago but now they’ve vanished.
sentences.chinese: 我的钥匙刚刚还在这里，现在却不翼而飞了。

sentences.english: The bird vanished from sight.
sentences.chinese: 那只鸟从视线中消失了。

sentences.english: She seemed to have just vanished into thin air (= suddenly disappeared in a very mysterious way ).
sentences.chinese: 她好像就蒸发了似的。

detailed_translations.english: to disappear suddenly, especially in a way that cannot be easily explained

name: vaporize
trans: v. to change into a vapor or to cause to change into a vapor 蒸发
v. to cause to become dissipated 消散

sentences.english: The benzene vaporized and formed a huge cloud of gas.
sentences.chinese: 苯蒸发形成了一大团气体。

detailed_translations.english: to change into a vapour, or to make something, especially a liquid, do this

name: vehement
trans: adj. showing strong and often angry feelings 激烈的

sentences.english: She suddenly became very vehement and agitated, jumping around and shouting.
sentences.chinese: 她突然变得十分激动和不安，四处暴跳并大喊大叫。

detailed_translations.chinese: 感情强烈的；热烈的；(人)有强烈感情的
detailed_translations.english: showing very strong feelings or opinions

name: venal
trans: adj. willing to do dishonest things in return for money 贪污的，唯利是图的

sentences.english: our venal politicians
sentences.chinese: 我们腐败的政客

detailed_translations.chinese: 贪污的；用金钱买得的；贿赂的；贪赃枉法的
detailed_translations.english: willing to use power and influence in a dishonest way in return for money

name: venerate
trans: v. to feel or show deep respect for 崇敬

sentences.english: a symbol of Arab courage, to be venerated for generations
sentences.chinese: 受到世代尊崇的阿拉伯人勇气的象征

detailed_translations.english: to honour or respect someone or something because they are old, holy, or connected with the past

name: veracity
trans: n. truth or accuracy 真实

sentences.english: We have total confidence in the veracity of our research.
sentences.chinese: 对我们研究的真实性，我们有绝对的信心。

detailed_translations.chinese: 诚实；精确性；老实；说真实话
detailed_translations.english: the fact of being true or correct

name: verbose
trans: adj. using more words than are needed 啰嗦的

sentences.english: For once, his usually verbose wife was content to listen.
sentences.chinese: 他那个一贯唠叨的老婆难得一次愿意倾听。

sentences.english: Legal writing is often unclear and verbose.
sentences.chinese: 法律文书往往措辞含糊，行文冗长。

detailed_translations.english: using or containing too many words

name: verisimilitude
trans: n. the quality of seeming real 逼真

sentences.english: questions about the verisimilitude of the document
sentences.chinese: 针对这份文件的真实性提出的问题

detailed_translations.chinese: 逼真，貌似真实；逼真的事物
detailed_translations.english: the quality of being true or real

name: versatile
trans: adj. able to do many different things 多才多艺的
adj. having many different uses 多功能的

sentences.english: The potato is an extremely versatile vegetable.
sentences.chinese: 马铃薯是一种用途极广的蔬菜。

detailed_translations.english: having many different uses

name: vestige
trans: n. the last small part that remains of something that existed before 残留部分

sentences.english: We represent the last vestige of what made this nation great – hard work.
sentences.chinese: 我们代表了曾经使这个国家伟大的仅存的品质–勤奋。

detailed_translations.english: a small part or amount of something that remains when most of it no longer exists

name: vigilant
trans: adj. carefully noticing problems or signs of danger 警惕的

sentences.english: Please remain vigilant at all times and report anything suspicious.
sentences.chinese: 请时刻保持警惕，有可疑情况随时报告。

detailed_translations.chinese: 警惕的；警醒的；注意的；警戒的
detailed_translations.english: giving careful attention to what is happening, so that you will notice any danger or illegal activity

name: vigorous
trans: adj. done with great force and energy 精力充沛的

sentences.english: Your dog needs at least 20 minutes of vigorous exercise every day.
sentences.chinese: 你的狗每天需要进行至少20分钟的剧烈运动。

sentences.english: Environmentalists have begun a vigorous campaign to oppose nuclear dumping in the area.
sentences.chinese: 环保人士已经发动了一场积极的运动，反对在该地区倾倒核废物。

sentences.english: a vigorous debate
sentences.chinese: 一场激烈的辩论

sentences.english: Vigorous efforts are being made to find a solution to the problem.
sentences.chinese: 正积极地寻找办法解决这个问题。

sentences.english: The measures provoked vigorous opposition in right-wing circles.
sentences.chinese: 这些举措激起了右翼群体的强烈反对。

detailed_translations.english: using a lot of energy and strength or determination

name: violate
trans: v. break, disregard 违反
v. interrupt, disturb 侵扰

sentences.english: 34 protesters were arrested for violating criminal law.
sentences.chinese: 34名抗议者因违反刑法而被逮捕。

sentences.english: regimes that violate human rights
sentences.chinese: 侵犯人权的政权

detailed_translations.english: to disobey or do something against an official agreement, law, principle etc

name: virtue
trans: n. morally good behavior or character 美德
n. a commendable quality or courage 优点

sentences.english: Women have often been used as symbols of virtue.
sentences.chinese: 女性常被用作美德的象征。

sentences.english: Wilkins is now extolling the virtues of organic farming.
sentences.chinese: 威尔金斯现在盛赞有机耕作的好处。

detailed_translations.english: moral goodness of character and behaviour

name: visible
trans: adj. capable of being discovered or perceived 看得见的
adj. conspicuous 明显的

sentences.english: The comet is visible to the naked eye (= can be seen without using special equipment ).
sentences.chinese: 这颗彗星肉眼看得见。

sentences.english: Check the plant for any visible signs of disease.
sentences.chinese: 检查一下植物是否有患病的迹象。

detailed_translations.english: something that is visible can be seen

name: vitiate
trans: v. to ruin or spoil 损害

sentences.english: Strategic policy during the War was vitiated because of a sharp division between easterners and westerners.
sentences.chinese: 由于“东方人”和“西方人”间的巨大分歧，战争期间的战略方针没有得到切实的执行。

detailed_translations.english: to make something less effective or spoil it

name: vitriolic
trans: adj. bitterly scathing 尖酸刻薄的

sentences.english: vitriolic remarks
sentences.chinese: 刻薄的言辞

detailed_translations.english: vitriolic language, writing etc is very cruel and angry towards someone

name: vivacious
trans: adj. happy and lively in a way that is attractive 活泼的

sentences.english: a vivacious personality
sentences.chinese: 活泼外向的个性

detailed_translations.chinese: 活泼的；快活的；有生气的
detailed_translations.english: someone, especially a woman, who is vivacious has a lot of energy and a happy attractive manner – used to show approval

name: volatile
trans: adj. likely to change in a very sudden or extreme way 善变的

sentences.english: an increasingly volatile political situation
sentences.chinese: 日益动荡的政治局势

sentences.english: the highly volatile stock and bond markets
sentences.chinese: 相当不稳定的股票和债券市场

detailed_translations.chinese: [化学] 挥发性的；不稳定的；爆炸性的；反复无常的
detailed_translations.english: a volatile situation is likely to change suddenly and without warning

name: voluble
trans: adj. talking a lot in an energetic and rapid way 健谈的

sentences.english: She was voluble with excitement.
sentences.chinese: 她因为激动而变得很健谈。

sentences.english: Bert is a voluble, gregarious man.
sentences.chinese: 伯特是个健谈且善于交际的人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 健谈的；缠绕的；易旋转的
detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone is voluble, you mean that they talk a lot with great energy and enthusiasm

name: voracious
trans: adj. having a huge appetite 贪吃的
adj. excessively eager 贪得无厌的

sentences.english: Pigs are voracious feeders.
sentences.chinese: 猪的食量很大。

sentences.english: Kids can have voracious appetites.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子有时胃口很大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 贪婪的；贪吃的；狼吞虎咽的
detailed_translations.english: eating or wanting large quantities of food

name: wane
trans: v. to become smaller or less 衰落，减少
n. a time of phase of gradual decrease 衰落期

sentences.english: My enthusiasm for the project was waning.
sentences.chinese: 我对这个项目的热情逐渐减退了。

sentences.english: The group’s influence had begun to wane by this time.
sentences.chinese: 此时，这个团体的影响力已经开始减弱。

detailed_translations.chinese: 衰落；变小；亏缺；退潮；消逝
detailed_translations.english: if something such as power, influence, or a feeling wanes, it becomes gradually less strong or less important

name: wanting
trans: adj. not having all that is needed or expected 有缺陷的

name: wayward
trans: adj. following one’s own capricious, wanton, or depraved inclinations 任性的

sentences.english: a wayward teenager
sentences.chinese: 任性的少年

detailed_translations.chinese: 任性的；不规则的；刚愎的
detailed_translations.english: behaving badly, in a way that is difficult to control

name: wealth
trans: n. a large amount of money and possessions 财富
n. a large amount or number 大量

sentences.english: The country’s wealth comes from its oil.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家的财富来自石油。

sentences.english: the distribution of wealth
sentences.chinese: 财富的分配

sentences.english: The purpose of industry is to create wealth.
sentences.chinese: 工业的目的就是创造财富。

detailed_translations.chinese: 财富； 财产； 丰富
detailed_translations.english: a large amount of money, property etc that a person or country owns

name: well-defined
trans: adj. easy to see or understand 明确的

sentences.english: well-defined limits on spending
sentences.chinese: 明确的开支限定

detailed_translations.english: clear and easy to see or understand

name: welter
trans: n. a state of wild disorder 混乱无序

sentences.english: There is a welter of information on the subject.
sentences.chinese: 关于这个问题有一大堆乱七八糟的信息。

detailed_translations.english: a large and confusing amount or number of something

name: wherewithal
trans: n. the money, skill, etc., that is needed to get or do something 必要手段
（钱或技能）

name: whimsical
trans: adj. subject to erratic behavior or unpredictable change 难以预测的

sentences.english: He has a wonderful whimsical sense of humour.
sentences.chinese: 他怪异的幽默感令人惊叹。

detailed_translations.chinese: 古怪的；异想天开的；反复无常的
detailed_translations.english: unusual or strange and often amusing

name: wide-ranging
trans: adj. dealing with or affecting a great variety of different things 广泛的

name: wield
trans: v. to have and use (power, influence, etc.) 行使，施加

sentences.english: The Church wields immense power in Ireland.
sentences.chinese: 在爱尔兰，教会操纵着大权。

detailed_translations.english: to have a lot of power or influence, and to use it

name: wistful
trans: adj. having or showing sad thoughts and feelings about something that you want to have or do and especially about something that made you happy in the past 伤感的，依依不舍的

sentences.english: a wistful smile
sentences.chinese: 怅然若失的微笑

detailed_translations.chinese: 渴望的；沉思的，默想的；引起怀念的；不满足似的
detailed_translations.english: thinking sadly about something you would like to have but cannot have, especially something that you used to have in the past

name: witless
trans: adj. very foolish or stupid 愚蠢的

name: wondrous
trans: adj. causing wonder 奇妙的

name: woo
trans: v. to seek to gain or bring about 恳求，争取

sentences.english: the Party’s efforts to woo working class voters
sentences.chinese: 该党拉拢工薪阶层选民的努力

detailed_translations.chinese: 求爱， 求婚； 恳求， 争取
detailed_translations.english: to try to persuade a woman to love you and marry you

name: yield
trans: v. to produce or provide 产生
v. to surrender or submit to another 屈服

sentences.english: Our research has only recently begun to yield important results.
sentences.chinese: 直到最近我们的研究才开始取得重要成果。

detailed_translations.english: to produce a result, answer, or piece of information

name: zealot
trans: n. a person who has very strong feelings about something and who wants other people to have those feelings 狂热者

sentences.english: religious zealots
sentences.chinese: 宗教狂热分子

detailed_translations.chinese: 狂热者；犹太教狂热信徒
detailed_translations.english: someone who has extremely strong beliefs, especially religious or political beliefs, and is too eager to make other people share them

name: zealous
trans: adj. feeling or showing strong and energetic support for a person, cause, etc. 热情的，狂热的

sentences.english: a zealous preacher
sentences.chinese: 热心的讲道者

sentences.english: zealous political activists
sentences.chinese: 积极的政治活动家

detailed_translations.english: someone who is zealous does or supports something with great energy
